story:
AXIOM: A premise so evident as to be accepted as true without controversy.

 

The color PINK is more synonymous with the playa than any other. When we see it, we smile. When we wear it, we feel sexy and wild.  It is almost always associated with free spirited & happy people. PINK is the favorite color of life! 

 

In 2014, we bring PINK to the BRC community in massive scale. Our team is constructing the largest PINK effigy ever built! We are bringing you an enormous artistic interpretation of the word PINK, spanning 80 feet in length and over 20 feet high. Artists from around the globe are designing intricate patterns that will be etched into the structure, covering every inch of it with creative love. At night PINK on Playa will be a constant PINK beacon, welcoming BRC citizens and visible from the far reaches of the desert as it glows with over 2000 feet of PINK LED lighting. We are also partnering with Kaliope, an art car with state of the art sound and lighting, to host PINK celebrations for all leading up to the burn. When you dance with your community amidst it's warm glow, you will feel alive and at home. When it erupts into massive PINK flames on burn night, your inner fire to be free will ignite along with it. You will understand the unique state of mind that only PINK can bring.

 

It costs nearly $60K to make PINK on Playa a reality. We are looking to raise at least $15K of this through indigogo contributions. The money will go to raw materials & lumber, tools, lighting, transportation, fire protection equipment, and food & lodging for our build team.

 

Our project brings nearly 100 burners from across the globe together to work towards a common artistic goal that benefits the entire community. Our core team includes 10 veteran burners, including the project lead for Denver Decompression and many lead team members from CORE burn projects in Maui and San Diego in 2012 and 2013.

 

We look forward to your support!

 

- Team PINK <3 )'(

story:
Goodbye electronic toys.

Tarc 4 isn’t another electronic plaything that counts the birds in the sky. It doesn't go beep-beep. This is real technology. Hand-crafted. Microchip-free. Battery-free. Software-free. It uses the magic of electrons and bioelectricity to enhance your thinking.

Let the electrons flow.

Whether you’re brainstorming new ideas, managing negativity and depression or looking for a boost to your meditation, you need more electrons. Introducing the 4th-generation Tarc. A microchip-free thought instrument.

Think better with electrons.

Every one of us thinks. Some people think more than others. Thoughts are based on vibration and electrons. When the electrons flow the vibration goes up and thoughts become magical. The opposite is also true. A low vibration results in negativity, anger, and depression.

It only looks like magic.

Inventor Tosen thinks that Tarc 4 works by tuning the natural frequencies of the body through the management of ions and electrons. On that subtle field of energy, where fringe science resides, the electrical exchanges between cells and molecules begin to multiply. Bioelectricity begins to flow. You feel more connected. You resonate with the world. These subtle processes also enable higher levels of thinking.

A thought enhancement stick. (Thoughts not included).

Invented by Paris Tosen who envisioned an electronic tool with no electronics. That’s why there are no transistors, and no battery. The magic comes from the unique combination of working scientific principles and advanced characteristics of the human body. We added copper conductivity to make it easier to use. It’s an advanced instrument that makes you into a better version of yourself by tuning your body frequencies. Use it for your work, for your walks along the beach, for times of stress, for inspiration, for creativity, for healing, and yes, for astral travel. It's in your hands.

Copper has been used by human civilizations for 8,000 years. It has a natural antimicrobial and sanitizing quality. The surface will tarnish when exposed to air. This can be cleaned easily.

Escape the transistor prison.

Building technology in a device with no microchip or battery was difficult. Having no background in engineering or science or design led to free-flow imagination. The result is Tarc 4. It combines advanced ideas with basic principles of electricity and presents them unlike ever before. This is a new paradigm in technology. The transistor has been around for 100 years and a standard in electronic devices since its early use in the radio. There are probably 100 billion transistors in an average home. Soon transistors will be implanted into our bodies. Before that happens, test drive the magic in a Tarc.

"My view is that the human being contains the most advanced technology ever invented. For some reason that technology has been largely turned off. If the body is the engine, Tarc is the ignition switch." (Paris Tosen)

A new design.

The idea 7 years ago started simple. A thought-based device for the new generation. Built on the principles of ionization and charged particles that even physicists are still working out. Let’s be honest, the technology in Tarc 4 is hard to explain because there’s not enough science to explain it. When you improve the flow of electrons in your body chemistry, you naturally think and feel better. Tarc 4 improves the flow of electrons. It doesn't take much to feel a dramatic improvement.

Beyond electronics. Back to electrons.

It’s not another smart device. There are no USB cables. No batteries. No software. Tarc 4 is real technology. Electrons. Bioelectricity. Everyone has them. Now everyone can use them.

How it works.

We’re still working that out. Basically, Tarc 4 optimizes the ionization of air through the excitation of electrons and other particles. It doesn’t fit the scientific model properly because the device is a hybrid of advanced and modern sciences. The flow of ions together with natural body frequencies allow the awareness of an individual to expand. With its unparalleled ability to improve the rate of vibration you can dramatically change how you engage life. Just hold the device in your hand, or between your fingers, even hang it around your neck, to ionize your body. Then focus your thoughts and intention where it needs to be. With health and happiness uniquely tied to your vibration, life takes on new meaning. Tarc now brings everything back to where it should be.

A new approach.

Inventor Tosen has put a lot of thought into this thought device, including a radical redesign that incorporates principles that genius Nikola Tesla developed (hint: this is not a Tesla device).

** The Tarc device is still being revised and refined in order to deliver the best possible product to consumers. Image and size may change.

Let the technology inside Tarc 4 take you to a higher existence. It requires a little practice and a stable mind. It’s a new approach to electronics. It’s a future that takes advantage of thought energy. There is nothing else in the world like Tarc. It’s a product with a lot of potential. And we need your support to continue its evolution.

"Tarc is a thought instrument. It's advanced but still in its early stages. It is a hybrid device created from my imagination and hard work. I've taken working principles from elsewhere and repurposed them (hint: that's what inventors do). I've kept it as simple as possible in order to make sure the technology works. But don't be fooled by its simplicity. There are many reasons why it works. I hope to build on these reasons in the future. And yes, some are secret." (Paris Tosen)

Escape the transistor world.

The circuit board is reaching its limits. Transistors have been getting smaller and smaller. IBM recently announced a chip with 5.4 billion nano-sized transistors. The iPhone has 2 billion transistors. In 1971 a chip contained 2,000 transistors. A 1955 computer had 200 transistors. Transistors will soon reach their limits and will be implanted into humans. Tarc 4 utilizes electrons to perform its functions.

Raise your vibration and life gets better. Maintain a stable frequency in your life and you will be able to achieve all the things you came here to achieve.

Tarc 4 – Specs

  • Hand-crafted
  • Thought instrument
  • Pure copper casing
  • Ion-centric core
  • Dimensions (approx): 2 inches x 0.5 inches
  • Uses bioelectricity
  • Microchip-free design
  • Battery-free
  • Software-free
*Tarc 4 is not for everyone.
1. Science is based on theoretical experience from previous editions and ongoing research; actual scientific theory may be different.
2. Final size may not be exactly as shown.
3. Not suitable for people allergic or sensitive to copper.
4. Results may vary according to user.
5. Images not exact. Final design still being worked out.
6. As each Tarc is hand-crafted, variations will exist between devices. Some imperfections will remain but will not affect the performance of the device.

About the inventor.

Author Paris Tosen is an alternative thinker and the founder of reality science. For 10 years he has researched topics most people would never dare touch. Since 2007, Tosen has been developing a new kind of thought instrument that does not rely on transistors or batteries, and utilizes the available bioelectricity in the human body.

story:
WE ARE FULLY FUNDED!

Eunice and I want to give a huge thank you to all of you who have helped us made Pixors a reality! It means a lot to us to have Pixors funded and we will work our ass off to ensure that each and every one of you get your set of Pixors. Most of our plans are set in motion right now, we will try to update you as much as we can on our progress on Indiegogo and on our blog at Pixors.com. 
Thank you so much again and I am looking forward to see a lot of pixel art created by you guys!

Press Coverage

Perks & Rewards


How it works?

Achievements & Testimonials

Sept 1st - Covered by Vulcan Post, an Online Digital News Channel

July 12th - Pixors Receives “Maker of Merit” Award at Maker Faire Singapore

June 4th - https://twitter.com/_bunnyrock/status/606394045930160128

May 19th - "Darius seems happy with the artwork and asked me to hang the pixelart in his bedroom" - Darius' Parent's Testimony

Pixors Stickers Highlights

25 Colors (More if stretch goals are met)

We have hand picked each colors to ensure that you will be able to utilize most of the colors in our designs.  In a standard Pixors Creative Box, each colors have 100 Pixors stickers, 500 for Black and 200 for White. 

Water Resistant

Tried and tested. Water will not prevent Pixors from sticking on the walls.


Repositionable

Made an error? It's OK, because you can always change the position of the stickers.


Removable

No debris or residues after you have removed the stickers.


Children Love Pixors

Children naturally love stickers, more if they can make their own pixel art using stickers. Pixors give children the opportunity to create, it sparks their imagination and let them make decorations from pixel art.  

(It is also a good way to distract them from tablets and smartphones)

Last for Years

In-door, the stickers will last a long long time. The lifespan of Pixors is 3 years if you put it outdoor. 


Stretch Goals

$5,500 – Every $100 on top of $5,500 we will conduct a free Pixors Workshop.

$8,000 - Different Sizes Rewards: 10mm, 30mm and 40mm

$15,000 – More colors! We are thinking around 25 more!

$20,000 – Online Pixel Art App

Unlock 12 Achievements – We will UPGRADE ALL BOXES to 3,500 Pixors Stickers! 

Unlock 24 Achievements – Tell us what awesome stuff we can do!

Total Achievements Unlocked: 5

Our Story

Hi! I am James and I am the founder of Pixors. My story started 25 years ago when I was learning how to write and draw. My parents bought me and my siblings color pencils and sketchpads so that we can learn how to draw. Drawing was fun, until we have exhausted all of the sketchpads. The next thing that comes close to an empty paper is the white, large walls. When our parents are out to work, we started decorating the walls. I cannot seem to recall what happened later when our parents came back, it must have been an unpleasant memory.

Fast forward to 1998 when my dad bought us our first computer, the first thing we learnt was playing computer games. Back then, all the games we played were mostly pixelated. Yes, most mainstream games looked like Minecraft in 2D. Later, as graphic cards become more powerful and were able to support higher resolution graphics, pixelate games have slowly eroded away from mainstream games (though there are still some indie game developers still stick to pixelated graphics).

In 2015, even though all digital elements are still made of pixels, we really cannot see them with our naked eyes because the resolutions are so highly packed together. Also, pixel art only exists in a digital format and there isn't an efficient way for people to make pixel art in real life. That was when I got the idea to create Pixors.


Video music credits:
Bensound & Purple Planet & FreeSongsToUse Royalty Free Music

Design & Manufacturing

Every product started out with a simple idea. However, time, sweat and effort determine whether it will be a great product. Creating Pixors is no different. Since January 2015, we have been experimenting, testing, prototyping and refining Pixors.

Raw Material

Pixors rely heavily around the sticker raw material. Therefore, we waste no effort and resources to ensure that Pixors stickers fulfill the following criteria:

  • Repositionable stickers so it is error proof.
  • Removable without damaging walls.
  • Self-adhesive and easy to use.
  • Pixel art created by Pixors must last a long period of time.
  • Pixel art must be able to stick to most wallsurfaces.
  • Must be at least waterproof.

We’ve had conducted many experiments on stickers. Some left residues when peeled off the wall. Some lost its adhesiveness after a couple of peel offs. Many stickers took the painting off the walls at home. We found that only a limited types of stickers fit the bill. So we got to work.

Manufacturers

We have approached many manufacturers over the past few months. After spending a lot of time working with multiple suppliers and filtering through them, I believe we have found the necessary people and the equipment required to manufacture Pixors in bulk. In the beginning, we manufactured different 10mm and 15mm sticker sizes, both are suitable for adults. However, our tests have shown that children work better with 15mm stickers. Therefore, we have decided to produce the Pixors stickers in a standard 15mm size.

Design

With the raw material and manufacturing aspect of Pixors all laid out, the next step is to design the product. Pixel art has always been an inspiration for me, it brings back nostalgic moments of the days of pixel graphics in games. Our main challenge with the designs is the number of pixels used in an art. We want to use the minimum possible pixels to create the best-looking pixel art. On the other side, we also want to create really large wall pixel art murals. Therefore, we have created a panoramic view of cities. With a little twist of imagination, we can design city pixel art to look like the background for games.

Prototyping & Testing in Kindergartens

When we designed Pixors, we designed it for adults for object decorations. However, when we trialed Pixors, we tested it out in kindergartens with children aged 4 to 7. We couldn't decorate the walls in the kindergartens, so we created a Pixors Children’s Pack. Pixors Children Pack consists of a specially laminated A3 template, a guide card and Pixors stickers.

I invited Eunice, a child education specialist to help me with the kindergarten classes. With her help, it didn't take much time for the children to know what they were supposed to do. We discovered that most kids were immediately engaged with the activity. Initially, children would find it difficult to accurately place the stickers in the square boxes. But with the teachers' guidance, we had noticed improvements in children using Pixors.

We observed the following:

  • Improvement in hand-eye coordination.
  • Increased patience level in children.
  • A dramatic progress in fine motor skills.
  • Learns color, objects names, numbers and alphabets.
  • Great sense of achievement and satisfaction upon completion of work.

Showcasing Pixors in Maker Faire Singapore

When we exhibited Pixors in Make Faire Singapore, many people came to create their first ever pixel art. People in Singapore are so enthusiastic and their participation and feedback continues to motivate us to share Pixors to more people. We are honored to receive the “Maker of Merit” award from Dale Dougherty and his organizing staffs from Singapore. 

"The staff of MAKE and Maker Faire award Maker Faire Editor’s Choice Ribbons to the Makers that have demonstrated great creativity, ingenuity and innovation for their Maker Faire project. These ribbons are handed out at each event and signify the highlights of Maker Faire." - MakerFaire.com

Is Pixors Children/Human Friendly?

The health and safety document provided by the manufacturing company suggests that the PVC films used to manufacture Pixors is harmless to both children and adults. All fire extinguishing methods can be used on Pixors in case of fire. The self-adhesive compound used in Pixors films will not cause chemical reaction in water. Medical aid is not required when touching, tasting or inhaling the film.

Generally speaking, Pixors is safe for both human being and the environment. However, swallowing the film is a choking hazard. We highly discourage the use of Pixors for children aged three years old or younger.

Why Contribute to Pixors?

Prior to Pixors, most pixel arts exist in digital form. We want to make pixel art a reality that can be created in real life. The possibilities to create are endless! Imagine the amount of pixel art decorations that can be created by people all around the world. Thinking of this is enough to make us all excited.

On top of that, by contributing to this project, you are also contributing to the future generation. For every $100 dollars on top of our funding goal, we are going to conduct a free of charge Pixors workshop for 15 children. The fact is, we do not earn anything from this crowdfunding project because we will be giving away so much with the contributions. 

We’ve got a great idea, a refined product, the necessary talents and the know how to make this happen. The most important thing is, we’re generous and we believe in the phrase “the more we give, the more we receive”. All we need now, is your contribution to help us kick start Pixors. 

Risks & Challenges

Manufacturing Pixors is a relatively straightforward process. We have already done most of the backend work on the manufacturing procedures. We are working closely with suppliers to ensure that the whole manufacturing process will be smooth as butter. We have set the estimated delivery date of Pixors in the reward section and we will be working day and night to stick to that timeline. No one wants to wait a year to receive the rewards of their contributions. If you contribute to this project, we want you to receive your set of Pixors Stickers as soon as possible and we will work closely with all of you to make that happen. 

FAQs

Q1: I don't have a Paypal account, how can I contribute without using a Paypal Account

A1: If you don't have a Paypal account, you can still contribute using a credit card through the Paypal website. Please follow this written step by step guide to figure out how. Known issues: Mobile phone format incorrect.

Q2: How is Pixors different from other stickers?

A2: We source our raw material (stickers) from Germany and we fully back the quality of the product.  

Q3: If I want 2 x $100 Charity Rewards, what should I do? 

A3: That is simple, all you need to do is press the $100 Charity Reward first. On the next page, you can top up another $100 as "Additional Gift". Press "Custom" and enter a value.

sweat and effort determine whether it will be a great product. Creating Pixors
is no different. Since January 2015, we have been experimenting, testing,
prototyping and refining Pixors. 
Raw Material
Pixors rely heavily around the sticker raw material. Therefore, we waste no effort and resources to ensure that Pixors stickers fulfill the following criteria:


Repositionable stickers so it is error proof.
Removable without damaging walls.
Self-adhesive and easy to use.
Pixel art created by Pixors must last a long period of time.
Pixel art must be able to stick to most wallsurfaces.
Must be at least waterproof.


We’ve had conducted many experiments on stickers. Some left
residues when peeled off the wall. Some lost its adhesiveness after a couple of peel offs. Many stickers took the painting off the walls at home. We found that
only a limited types of stickers fit the bill. So we got to work.
Manufacturers
We have approached many manufacturers over the past few
months. After spending a lot of time working with multiple suppliers and
filtering through them, I believe we have found the necessary people and the
equipment required to manufacture Pixors in bulk. In the beginning, we
manufactured different 10mm and 15mm sticker sizes, both are suitable for
adults. However, our tests have shown that children work better with 15mm
stickers. Therefore, we have decided to produce the Pixors stickers in a standard
15mm size. 
Design
With the raw material and manufacturing aspect of Pixors all
laid out, the next step is to design the product. Pixel art has always been an
inspiration for me, it brings back nostalgic moments of the days of pixel
graphics in games. Our main challenge with the designs is the number of pixels
used in an art. We want to use the minimum possible pixels to create the best-looking
pixel art. On the other side, we also want to create really large wall pixel
art murals. Therefore, we have created a panoramic view of cities. With a little
twist of imagination, we can design city pixel art to look like the background
for games.


Prototyping & Testing in Kindergartens
When we designed Pixors, we designed it for adults for
object decorations. However, when we trialed Pixors, we tested it out in
kindergartens with children aged 4 to 7. We couldn't decorate the walls in the
kindergartens, so we created a Pixors Children’s Pack. Pixors Children Pack
consists of a specially laminated A3 template, a guide card and Pixors
stickers.
I invited Eunice, a child
education specialist to help me with the kindergarten classes. With her help, it didn't take much time for the children to know what they were supposed
to do. We discovered that most kids were immediately engaged with the activity.
Initially, children would find it difficult to accurately place the stickers in
the square boxes. But with the teachers' guidance, we had noticed improvements
in children using Pixors. 


We observed the following:


Improvement in hand-eye coordination.
Increased patience level in children.
A dramatic progress in fine motor skills.
Learns color, objects names, numbers and alphabets.
Great sense of achievement and satisfaction upon completion of work.




Showcasing Pixors in Maker Faire Singapore
When we exhibited Pixors in Make Faire Singapore, many
people came to create their first ever pixel art. People in Singapore are so
enthusiastic and their participation and feedback continues to motivate us to
share Pixors to more people. We are honored to receive the “Maker of Merit” award
from Dale Dougherty and his organizing staffs from Singapore. 

"The staff of MAKE and Maker Faire award Maker Faire Editor’s Choice Ribbons to the Makers that have demonstrated great creativity, ingenuity and innovation for their Maker Faire project. These ribbons are handed out at each event and signify the highlights of Maker Faire." - MakerFaire.com
Is Pixors Children/Human Friendly?
The health and safety document provided by the manufacturing
company suggests that the PVC films used to manufacture Pixors is harmless to
both children and adults. All fire extinguishing methods can be used on Pixors
in case of fire. The self-adhesive compound used in Pixors films will not cause
chemical reaction in water. Medical aid is not required when touching, tasting
or inhaling the film.
Generally speaking, Pixors is safe for both human being and
the environment. However, swallowing the film is a choking hazard. We highly
discourage the use of Pixors for children aged three years old or younger. 
Why Contribute to Pixors?
Prior to Pixors, most pixel arts exist in digital form. We
want to make pixel art a reality that can be created in real life. The
possibilities to create are endless! Imagine the amount of pixel art
decorations that can be created by people all around the world. Thinking of
this is enough to make us all excited. 
On top of that, by contributing to this project, you are
also contributing to the future generation. For every $100 dollars on top of
our funding goal, we are going to conduct a free of charge Pixors workshop for
15 children. The fact is, we do not earn anything from this crowdfunding
project because we will be giving away so much with the contributions. 


We’ve got a great idea, a refined product, the necessary talents and the know how to make this happen. The most important thing is,
we’re generous and we believe in the phrase “the more we give, the more we
receive”. All we need now, is your contribution to help us kick start
Pixors.  
Risks & Challenges
Manufacturing Pixors is a relatively straightforward
process. We have already done most of the backend work on the manufacturing
procedures. We are working closely with suppliers to ensure that the whole
manufacturing process will be smooth as butter. We have set the estimated
delivery date of Pixors in the reward section and we will be working day and
night to stick to that timeline. No one wants to wait a year to receive the
rewards of their contributions. If you contribute to this project, we want you
to receive your set of Pixors Stickers as soon as possible and we will work
closely with all of you to make that happen. 
FAQs
Q1: I don't have a Paypal account, how can I contribute without using a Paypal Account
A1: If you don't have a Paypal account, you can still contribute using a credit card through the Paypal website. Please follow this written step by step guide to figure out how. Known issues: Mobile phone format incorrect.Q2: How is Pixors different from other stickers?A2: We source our raw material (stickers) from Germany and we fully back the quality of the product.  Q3: If I want 2 x $100 Charity Rewards, what should I do? A3: That is simple, all you need to do is press the $100 Charity Reward first. On the next page, you can top up another $100 as "Additional Gift". Press "Custom" and enter a value.

story:
Always… the eyes are there!
–Barney Hill, 1964 hypnosis session with Dr. Benjamin Simon

So far, only one thing is certain: it is not just a rumor: something is seen.
–Dr. Carl G. Jung

I am an artist who was invited to do a show at Machine Project gallery in Los Angeles that will open in late January 2016. For more than a year, I've been developing what will be an electronic media installation that focuses on UFOs, alien abduction, and related anomalous phenomena. I am raising additional funds to help secure the materials and technology to expand some elements of the show to make it a richer, more immersive experience for gallery visitors.

Gallery storefront visualization


About Me

Based in Los Angeles, I work primarily in video, CG animation, stereoscopic 3D, and sound and light installation. I've exhibited in the U.S., Canada, and Europe in galleries, film and media festivals, and museums. Though the styles vary significantly from project to project, all of my work reflects an interest in a group of subjects: visual perception, time and dimensional space, consciousness and altered states. More information about me and my past projects can be found at joemerrell.com.


The Eyes Are Always There

The Eyes Are Always There is an upcoming multimedia installation at Machine Project gallery in Los Angeles that explores the subjects of UFOs, alien abduction, and related anomalous phenomena. Scheduled to open in late January 2016, the show will feature 3D video, print, sculpture, as well as computer-controlled lighting and sound. In addition to my work in the first floor gallery, super-talented artist and animator Johnny Woods is creating an animated film to be screened in the gallery's Mystery Theater.

The Eyes Are Always There is technically ambitious – more so than any of my previous projects. It's also important to point out that Johnny and I have avoided a typical pop culture take on the subject matter. Inspired by a shared long-term interest, we've drawn from specific UFO and abduction researchers in developing our work for this show. While our aim isn't necessarily to convince our audience of anything, we hope to communicate some of the range, intensity, and "high strangeness" of reported sightings and experiences.

A special program of film, video, workshops and guest speakers is being planned to accompany the installation. A blog/site will be launched to document the project and provide more information on the research informing the work in the show.


The Goal

I am trying to raise an additional $4,000 for The Eyes Are Always There. While Machine Project is providing basic funding and we are working to secure in-kind donations and equipment loans, the materials and technology being used to put on this show are expensive. 

Your support will help with additional construction, furniture, dmx-controlled lighting, as well as some equipment needed for a special stereoscopic 3D phantogram projection.

Your contribution will go to Machine Project directly (not me personally). Machine Project is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization and all gifts are tax deductible to the fullest extent allowed by law.


The Perks

Any contributions are hugely appreciated, though gifts at certain levels come with exclusive opportunities to own high quality photographic prints related to the project. 

This campaign is scheduled to end in mid-December and every effort will be made to deliver your perk prior to the 25th. This only applies to shipments in the U.S., as worldwide shipments obviously take longer. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

$5 – Your Name on the Donor Roll

Your name will be added to the list of contributors on the project blog.

$20 – 5x7 UFO Print

Your name name will be added to the list of contributors on the project blog. You will also be sent one of several UFO "snapshots" (our choice) printed on metallic finish Fuji Pearl photo paper (higher quality preview here):


Phantograms

A phantogram is a special 3D image that is designed for horizontal viewing through 3D glasses for an uncanny effect similar to that of a vivid hologram. When made properly, a phantogram image looks like a tangible, physical object.

The phantogram prints I'm offering here are based on a cg animated 3D video I've made for the show. While it's very difficult to demonstrate the effect online, I've spent many hours working to perfect the clarity and depth of these images (I think they look amazing). Like the video, the prints are rendered in greyscale, which also results in a much sharper 3D effect.

Please note that I'm offering them for less than half of what I've sold similar prints in a gallery. 

$65 – Phantogram Set #1

Your name name will be added to the list of contributors on the project blog. You will also be sent two specially mounted 6x10 prints with two pairs of 3D glasses. I'm posting these 2D images to give a sense of what the actual 3D images look like (descriptions and higher quality previews here):


$65 – Phantogram Set #2

Your name name will be added to the list of contributors on the project blog. You will also be sent two specially mounted 6x10 prints with two pairs of 3D glasses. I'm posting these 2D images to give a sense of what the actual 3D images look like (descriptions and higher quality previews here):


$275 – Print & Phantogram Set #3

Your name name will be added to the list of contributors on the project blog. You will also be sent all four UFO 5x7" prints, the mounted phantogram images from sets #1 and #2, as well as two larger 12x18" mounted prints with 6 pairs of 3D glasses. I'm posting these 2D versions of the larger images to give a sense of what the actual 3D images look like (descriptions and higher quality previews here):

story:
Motivation

The memory of Steve Jobs is a source of inspiration. His humble origins, personal imperfections and the turbulence of his career make his story relatable; his prolific, world-changing career make his story admirable. Steve Jobs had flaws and was knocked down in his career. He responded by rising to even greater heights: developing life-changing, genre-defining products, revolutionizing industries, and creating billions of dollars of economic value. Steve Jobs put the emphasis on innovation and creating what has never been created. The memory of Steve Jobs is of someone for whom we relate to his lows and can aspire to reach the heights he attained.

Steve Jobs once said he wanted to “leave a dent in the universe”. He lived up to that and had an immense impact during his lifetime. Whether the mark he made becomes indelible remains to those who are still around. We are the bearers of his legacy. This statue will act as a reminder for the preservation of a memory worth remembering.

Why now?

His passing is still relatively recent and the memory still fresh in our imaginations. Now is the time to capture our sentiments and express them before their potency fades through time. This statue is intended to instantiate the admiration we have before we forget.

Additionally, the launch of this campaign is timed to coincide with the Jobs (2013) movie release. We anticipate that the release of the new Steve Jobs movie will likely bring about a spike of interest in Steve Jobs, which indicates that the timing is opportune.

How

We identified world-class sculptors to build the statue. We coordinated with the sculptors who now understand the draft specifications and quoted us on a price. We have budgeted for the statue building, based on the quote, and a number of additional expenses, including the cost of transporting the statue to its end location and of engraving the plaque. The next step is to use this crowd funding campaign to raise the capital required to bring the statue to reality.

Following the fundraising, the contributors to the campaign, as specified in the donation tiers, will be able to provide input and feedback throughout the design process of the statue.

More Raised -> Larger Statue

The size of the statue will be directly proportional (positive correlation) to the amount raised. The project budget is based on quotes for a life-sized statue. However, if the campaign raises enough capital - more than what we could conservatively hope to raise - we'll aim for Statue of Liberty and Colossus of Rhodes proportions :).


Let's get started

This statue will only be built through the help and contribution of others. Please contribute to the campaign; then, please help spread the word, and encourage others to support the vision. When the funding total is reached, please actively participate in the co-creational activities. The next step is a joint one and this project needs your help to be successful.

We look forward to working with you to make this happen.

Press Coverage

The campaign has generated some press, such as PandoDaily, The Next Web, 9to5mac, The Huffington Post, The Independent and a lot more. Please continue spreading the word to those who may be interested in supporting the campaign!

Frequently Asked Questions

What will be done with the capital?

The plan is to put the capital towards building as big of a statue possible, taking into account other anticipated costs (i.e. transportation, plaque engraving, etc). Any remaining capital will be recycled - by Realizing Utopia LLC, Monuments Series only - for similar projects.

What qualifies you to make this statue?

Not much. We can't say that we have extensive prior statue building experience. We're just huge Steve Jobs fans. We'll work with experts to make this happen.

Where will the statue be located?

We anticipate that the eventual location of the statue will be somewhere in the Bay Area. We will work with the project contributors to determine where to put the statue. We currently intend to hold a poll to determine preferences among campaign contributors on possible locations, and then coordinate with relevant communities to place the statue.

What about other statues?

After conceiving of the idea to build a statue, we performed further research. We came across the statue built in Budapest. We think that Steve Jobs is worthy of more than one statue, and that building a statue here, in the United States, would be fitting.

How can we continue to contribute?

Building this statue will be a team effort. We will look to actively involve contributors during the development of the statue. We are additionally planning an unveiling ceremony, for which campaign contributors will be invited (see perks). If you have any ideas for ways in which you could help with this endeavor, please reach out.

Who is behind this project?

We are young entrepreneurs living in San Francisco. Steve Jobs is a role model for us. We admire the work he did, and the life he lived. We want the focus to be on the statue, so we'd prefer to be more 'behind the scenes' on this project. Please feel free to reach out with inquiries to statueofstevejobs@gmail.com.

story:
Greetings! 

  The cover photo catch your eye? You found the dark mysterious side of the sunny south! 
 Often Depicted in literature and film the Southern Gothic is a subgenre of Gothic fiction that takes place exclusively in the American South. If your reading this you probably knew that, right? As far as i know there has yet to be a photo book dedicated to the style so I am putting together a collection of my photography prints to illustrate a rarely seen side of an area i know well. Dark, mysterious, beautiful aesthetic of deep south countryside and towns that goes largely unnoticed. 
  I feel like this is something that needs to be shown as it seems most fail to fully grasp the depth of just how much the tone of what is "Southern Gothic" permeates this particular area. For goodness sake in a county with a population of just over 9,000 there are 138 known cemeteries. That's like one tombstone for every two live people. Any ways, its everywhere here and in part im wanting this to be a kind of documentary of the vibe before time crumbles it all away. 
 For instance, this creepiest church ever... 

Its been like that for as long as i have been alive but one day it will fall and never be the same... Then, not a mile from there, this field of yellow flowers backed by a foreboding swamp...

   Down the road from there is a tomb in the forest... 

A short walk by the tomb is this house... 

Further on past the big tree...

To this cemetery...

 Where the tombstones slowly return to the earth. 

  See what i'm getting at? As bright and sunny as the areas reputation certainly deserves, it is juxtaposed with an equally forlorn paling as previous eras waste away to bones. I want to show you before its gone. 

  So about this book. 

   Fifty prints of various sizes about 5"x8" some a little larger , some a little smaller come in a hand made wooden box (by me) with a glass and wood frame on the front, that one in the pic is made of cherry. Opens by way of a leather strap and solid copper buckle and you can even change the cover print with a favorite. Props up with a leg on the back so its also a neat picture frame! 

  On the inside you will find unbound prints. I want to take you on a tour through a "Collection of Art"  rather than a typical book as i feel looking through them in this way is a more interactive and special experience. Rather than one of many pages, each print is its own entity. 

   I don't want to spoil the surprise so i'm leaving out most of and the best images but that should give you a good idea of what you get! 

   Funding. 

   I am doing this all myself so each book is a work of art in itself. Each book is individually funded by your contribution of 35 bucks so there isnt a risk of project failure due to funds not being met or this or that. Even if the goal isnt reached you will still get a coppy. I just want to get this out to as many people as will enjoy it while keeping production cost as low as possible while still giving you something super cool. 

  I feel like this is an art piece that needs to be created. Especially with the modern impetus to develop and build new things over everything and natural decay taking its toll. I want to document and share the joy of the special hidden places I've come to know. A unique photography collection that takes you on a little tour of my perspective in the Southern Gothic style we love. 

  If you like it, give it a share and if you have any questions, do ask! 

 Thanks for taking interest!

Each book is individually funded by your contribution of 35 bucks so there isnt a risk of project failure due to funds not being met or this or that. Even if the goal isnt reached you will still get a coppy. I just want to get this out to as many people as will enjoy it while keeping production cost as low as possible while still giving you something super cool.   I feel like this is an art piece that needs to be created. Especially with the modern impetus to develop and build new things over everything and natural decay taking its toll. I want to document and share the joy of the special hidden places I've come to know. A unique photography collection that takes you on a little tour of my perspective in the Southern Gothic style we love.   If you like it, give it a share and if you have any questions, do ask!  Thanks for taking interest!

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Tiffany Sosa and I am the artist of the Bohemian Wild. With the help of my team, we are looking to publish a one of a kind Lenormand deck that is both whimsical and charming. It has been a dream of mine to create a beautiful deck that resonates with the gypsy wanderers and the spirited bohemian. With the help of your contribution we can make this dream come true and share it with the world!

            

          

A little about Lenormand cards: 

The cards were originally created as a game and wasn't until later, began being used for divination. It’s named after French fortune-teller Marie Anne Adelaide Lenormand, one of the most famous cartomancy readers in history. The deck is comprised of 36 beautiful cards that are represented by a symbol and card value. Unlike the tarot where the symbolism in the card's artwork has different meanings, only the symbol on the card is truly important. 

Original:              Traditional:


Objective of this campaign:

To raise money to place a large order for the lenormand decks. The larger the order we can place, the more successful this deck can be.  These decks would also make lovely gifts for any fan of fortune telling, oracle cards or anyone interested in collectible art.

                 

What we need and what you get:

The illustrations for the cards are complete and if this campaign is successful, the deck will be ready to hit the printing press almost immediately. However, we need your help to make that happen and we will be so excited if together, we can bring this deck into the world! Listed in the perks is a limited number of decks available  get yours today!

                        


The deck is deorative and chic, while not being overly superficial. 

This 36 card deck will be printed at standard 2.45 x 3.95" card size, packaged in a custom card tuck box. 

The traditional decks are printed at 2.5" x 3.5", packaged in a custom card tuck box.

The vast majority of the costs are for the printing of 100 decks- the rest of the funds will be used for marketing and shipping supplies.

Original:          Traditional:

 


Risks and challenges:

The biggest risk is not meeting our goal. Without meeting goal I will only be limited to a certain amount of decks which in turn would make it nearly impossible to publish!         

                                        

                                       



Other ways to help:

If you cannot contribute, another way to help is to spread the word and share this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or a blog.

 Original:        Traditional:

  


Perks:

story:
Our Story

On December 15th, 2011, I am going to exhibit Domestic Tension in the Jakarta Biennial XIV.  My work was selected by the Jakarta Arts Council, as one of two artists representing the United States; it is a great opportunity.

The Jakarta Biennial is a prestigious event held every two years since 1968 by the Jakarta Arts Council. Jakarta XIV – called Maximum City, Survive or Escape? – is curated by Bambang Wijanarko, Ilham Choiri and Seno Joko Suyono.  Jakarta is a city of diverse society: cosmopolitan, adventurous, a melting pot.  The event enriches and refreshes the practice and discourse of arts in Indonesia, especially by engaging the people directly in the arts projects in public areas. In line with the characteristics of the “Bataviasche” who are liberal and pluralistic, the event also introduces directly international works to the public as a reference of comparison for both the local and international artistic community. By introducing, enhancing appreciation, and then engaging the people in arts, the Jakarta Biennial raises the levels of tolerance and sympathy towards diverse creations and cultures.


My 2007 work Domestic Tension has special relevancy to the biennial theme. In Jakarta I will recreate the original installation, wherein I sequestered myself in a Chicago gallery with a paintball gun where people could shoot at me over the Internet for a month. The project was a way to provoke dialogue about the Iraq war, the technological and remote nature of modern warfare, and what it means for Iraqis to live constantly under the threat of fire. Through out the 31 day performance, over 70,000 individual shots were fired at me. I received international attention for the work and the Chicago Tribune named me the Artist of the Year in 2008 and called the dynamic installation, “one of the sharpest works of political art to be seen in a long time.”

The Impact

The exhibition installation in Jakarta begins December 10th. Currently, myself and the project manager Nathan Suter are making arrangements for shipping the piece plus flights and accommodations for installing the piece.  Your support will help make possible these essential aspects.


What We Need & What You Get

As you may know, exhibiting work and shipping crated work can be extremely costly. We need to raise $3,000 for shipping & packaging, insurance, administration expenses, on-site installation costs, and transportation. The Jakarta Arts Council has generously offered $3,000 for our flights and a modest honorarium. They have also offered to cover shipping through IMS freight.  The $3,000.00 that we are raising today, through IndieGoGo, is necessary for the costs which exceed Jakarta's funding. 


Pledge $10 or More
Personal email thank you and your name listed on website and Facebook page.

Pledge $25 or More
Personal email thank you and your name listed on website and Facebook page. + A thank you  postcard from Jakarta.

Pledge $50 or More
Personal email thank you and your name listed on website and Facebook page, a thank you postcard from Jakarta. + One signed print from the installation.

Pledge $150 or More
Personal email thank you and your name listed on website and Facebook page, a thank you postcard from Jakarta, one signed print from the installation + Signed copy of the book, SHOOT AN IRAQI: Art, Life and Resistance Under the Gun.

Pledge $500 or More
Personal email thank you and your name listed on website and Facebook page, a thank you souvenir postcard from Jakarta, one signed print from the installation + Signed copy of the book, SHOOT AN IRAQI: Art, Life and Resistance Under the Gun. + An invitation to a private dinner party.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our cause and use the share buttons above, or email to friends/colleagues to help others to notice our campaign and this incredible opportunity.

Thank you 

Thank you for taking time to read this and if you feel compelled to make a donation, then an even bigger thank you ! You are truly wonderful!  Also, a special thank you to Helen Day Art Center.

story:
We all recall those special houses on the block that would give out the huge candy bars. Or would cause the best scare, or had the most gruesome display. These awesome families gave their all to make Halloween not just about the candy… They made the night come alive with spooks, tricks and magic! These folks that went above and beyond, just to hear a scream or see a smile, made Halloween my favorite holiday. And I love nothing more than continuing that special tradition. By the time I was officially too old to be going Trick or Treating, I knew exactly how I wanted to spend my Halloweens. I wanted to give children the best and most frightening October 31st they could have!

My father, brother and I early on spent most Halloweens, just the three of us, trying our best to scare the kids. Soon after we added more props, created more terror, and handed out more candy. Eventually my group of friends became actors, prop builders and makeup artists in their time off. We put our heads together year after year to create a small home haunt that receives hundreds of kids every Halloween night. It’s called The Dread Keep!

And we want to make a safer, scary, fun place to go on Halloween. We never had and never will be a haunt that charges kids or adults for admittance. We simply do this for the fun! The only problem is that every year it gets harder and harder to make a bigger and better haunt. We pour our own time and funds into projects. And well… We are pretty limited when it comes to funds. That’s where you can help!

This year we are expanding the Haunt to another portion of our house. And we already have tons of ideas and a great classic haunt theme. The Crypt! This project is our biggest yet. By the end we will have constructed more than 125 square feet of façade walls and underground crypt, and a giant monster animatronic. With your help we can afford the supplies to build this great art piece. This project will put our construction, art, sculpting, and painting skills to the ultimate test! And we would love to have you be a part of this great project!

If you want to help fund our project, you will receive some awesome homemade Halloween rewards! Pledges of just $1 might not get anything in the mail. But we thank you beyond words for your support!

With a 10$ pledge, be assured you will get a custom made, personalized Thank You card in the mail. It will have been made by the cast and crew of Dread Keep, and will have tid bits of information, words of thanks, and some fun bios of the people who run the haunt. And that’s not all! We will also include some exclusive photos of building process and fun Halloween extras!

With a $30 pledge you will be sent a fun set of 10 individual, hand painted Halloween decor stones. They are great decorations to add to any Halloween party! Each stone is different and has an eerie, creepy or gross Halloween image. All hand painted and personalized, these stones are awesome for adding to a Halloween centerpieces, decoration, or candle displays!

What works better for setting a Halloween mood, than a candle! Candles, not just for inside pumpkins. For just a $50 pledge, you will receive one hand painted Halloween scene candle votive. In your choice of scene (graveyard, ravens, creepy forest). Light the candle and watch a spooky scene come to life! It’ll brighten to darkest dungeon and creep’ify the brightest living room!

With a pledge of $80, expect to get the complete set of three Halloween scene candle votives! Including the graveyard, raven, and creepy forest votive. All individual and hand painted just for you! Swap out for a scented candle, and Bam! Now your Halloween party will smell like pumpkin pie, without the hassle of cooking! What could be better than that?

A pledge of $100? You’re going to get some great rewards! We will send you the whole shebang! Including a custom thank you card, the set of 10 decor stones, and the set of three candle votives! Every reward is handmade, painted and designed by the cast and crew. No one item is identical, we want to thank you for funding our project with something one of a kind!

All backers will have their rewards sent out in September of this year! Just in time for October and the Halloween season! We here at Dread Keep hope you too have a spooky spirit. Cause we want to build something spectacular for kids of all ages to enjoy on Halloween night!

story:
video english:


Scroll down for the ENGLISH version

INTRO

PASSO A DUE è un progetto artistico nato dalla collaborazione tra Elena Bellantoni e Mariana Ferratto. Le due artiste, invitate presso il prestigioso spazio Milanese Careof DOCVA per una residenza durante il mese di Maggio 2014, hanno deciso di sviluppare un progetto in parallelo frutto di un confronto sul proprio lavoro.

 

CHI SIAMO

Elena Bellantoni vive e lavora tra Berlino e l’Italia. Si laurea alla "Sapienza" in Arte Contemporanea e studia a Parigi e Londra, dove nel  2007 ottiene un MA in Visual Art WCA University of Arts London. Nel 2007 costituisce Platform Translation Group, nel 2008 è cofondatrice di 91mQ art project space di Berlino. Nel 2006 vince il premio Temphelhof-Shoneberg Kunstpreis Zum Ball-Spiel a Berlino; 2009 vince ilMovin'up del G.A.I. Torino con un progetto a Santiago del Cile; 2012 vince in bando NGBK con il progetto In Other Words  realizzato alla Kunstraum Kreuzberg Bethaniene al NGBK di Berlino. Nel 2013 vince la sezione video arte di FestArte/Factory I colori del Mondo al Museo Macro la Pelanda. Residenze: 98weeks project space con Francis Alys a Beiruth nel 2008, Residencia Expacio Versus a Santiago del Cile nel 2013; Progetto Isole a Palermo nel 2009.  Nel 2014 viene selezionata per African Fabbers, un workshop ed una mostra all’interno della Biennale di Marrakech. 

Tra le mostre PERSONALI: my name is… elena bellantoni  [. BOX] videoart project space Milano 2013; Hala Yella Presentation Caja Negra exhibition space Santiago de Chile 2012; Looking for E.B. Galleria Muratcentoventidue, Bari 2012; Is it Real? 91 mQ Art Project Space, Berlin 2008; Room1 Performance, Tacheles, Berlin 2008; Transparenz alla Weisser Elephant Galerie Berlin 2007; G.i.u.l.i.a, Linux Art Space Roma 2004. 

Tra le COLLETTIVE: BAC Festival Internacional de Arte Contemporaneo Barcelona, CCB Museum Spain 2009; Europe as a Space of Translation Biennale della Traduzione PAN Palazzo delle Arti Napoli, 2010; ITaliens Ambasciata Italiana a Berlino 2011; Re-Generation Museo Macro Roma 2012; “Regeln für die Revolution sul 'Fatzer' di Brecht” Volksbühne Kurzfilmkino Berlino e Cinema Massimo Torino 2012; Ikono Video Festival: Visioni Domestiche Collegium Hungaricum Berlino 2013 ; Archive tellers, al MAXXI B.A.S.E. Roma 2013; Visioni d’arte Galleria A+A Venezia 2013;C'è una piccola radice che, se la masticate, vi spuntano le ali immediatamente MAC Museo Lissone, 2013; Exodus ItaliaMUMI Museo de las Migraciones Montevideo Uruguay 2013; ReAzione video installations and live performances, Fabbrica delle Candele Forlì, Forlì 2014; Spazi di percezione tra intangibile e tangibileGalleria Nazionale d’Arte Moderna Roma GNAM, 2014.  E’ artista in residenza al Careof/DOCVA nel 2014.

Mariana Ferratto si è laureata all’Accademia di Belle Arti di Roma ed ha completato la sua formazione con studi di teatro danza. Nel 2010-2011 ha vinto la residenza alla Cité Internationale des Arts, Paris premio promosso da Incontri Internazionali D’Arte. Nel 2012 vince insieme a Sara Basta il concorso “Arte, Patrimonio e Diritti Umani” indetto da Connecting Cultures, agenzia di ricerca per l'arte e il territorio in partnership con Fondazione ISMU - Patrimonio e Intercultura, con il sostegno del Ministero per i Beni e le Attività Culturali Nel 2008 ha vinto il primo premio del concorso “Intercorto, percorsi audiovisivi interculturali”, bandito dal Comune di Arezzo e dal Ministero del lavoro, della Salute e delle Politiche Sociali. È stata selezionata per il workshop “Officine dell’arte”, presso Careoff-DOCVA, Milano.

MOSTRE PERSONALI: 2011 - Ciao, The Gallery Apart, Roma; 2009 - I pesci rossi crescono in base alla dimensione del loro acquario, Fondazione Adriano Olivetti, Roma; Inside #4, The Gallery Apart, Roma; 2005 - Why?, Fondazione Pastificio Cerere, Roma.

MOSTRE COLLETTIVE: 2013 Exodus Italia presso il MUMI Museo de las Migraciones di Montevideo Uruguay, 2012 - Omaggio a Graziella Lonardi Buontempo, PAN – Palazzo delle Arti Napoli; Progetto delle Accademie di Belle Arti (2000 - 2010), 54a Biennale di Venezia, Tese delle Vergini dell’Arsenale, Venezia; Rumors sobre una exposició, Espai Zer01, Olot; 2010 - Monnaie de Paris, Paris; Videoprogetto Birmingham; Platform Translation_Interface, MLAC, Roma; 2009 - EXTRACONTEMPORANEA, Nuovo Cinema Aquila, Roma; 2 VIDEO UnDo.net 2008 - N.EST 2.0, Museo MADRE, Napoli; All day video & sound Art. Works selected, par des commissaries indépendans, St. Louis, Missouri – USA; Videoteque in Calypso, Sala Rekalde, Bilbao; XIII Biennale dei Giovani Artisti dell'Europa e del Mediterraneo, Bari; HELP YOURSELF become an ego lover, Londra; UP Itinerant Visions, Zurigo; 2007 - V Festival Internacional del Cine Pobre, Cuba; Isola Video, Studio Stefania Miscetti, Roma; Attori/ Spettatori, Auditorium Parco della Musica, Fondazione Alda Fendi, Roma; 2006 - Almadromestica, avec Drome megazine; 2005 - Play ’04, Neon-Campobase, Bologna, C/O Careof Milano; 2014 Roma. Artista in Residenza al Careof DOCVA di Milano.

CONCEPT

Sia Elena che Mariana negli anni hanno sviluppato dei progetti artistici su temi simili come l'identità e la relazione con l'altro. PASSO A DUE ha come obiettivo l'analisi del concetto di potere all'interno del rapporto di coppia, le due artiste hanno deciso di confrontarsi su questo tema e sviluppare due lavori video che indaghino proprio questo elemento relazionale.

I punti di partenza di Bellantoni e Ferratto sono stati due loro lavori antecedenti, nello specifico Ich bin... du bist ( Bellantoni 2010) e Ciao (Ferratto 2011). Dal confronto e dallo scambio è nata l'idea di sviluppare durante il periodo di residenza due nuove opere video, per approfondire il percorso di ricerca. 

CAMPAGNA

La campagna di Crowdfunding mira a sostenere la Giovane Arte Italiana attraverso un percorso di ricerca per la realizzazione di due opere d'arte. Il sostegno diventa fondamentale ai fini della creazione artistica, sia concettualmente che concretamente.

I  sostenitori potranno entrare in relazione con le artiste durante il processo di creazione delle opere. La dinamica di condivisione è parte sostanziale del processo creativo richiamando direttamente il concept: la RELAZIONE. Come in una scatola cinese si parte dal rapporto tra le artiste, ci si apre verso l'esterno attraverso il crowdfunding e si rende visibile il legame sviluppato lungo il percorso nelle opere finali.

La residenza si concluderà con la presentazione del lavoro in cui sarà evidente ogni processo relazionale: da quello dei protagonisti dei video a quello delle artiste, al processo partecipativo innescato dalla campagna Passo a due.

OBIETTIVI

Il vostro supporto è funzionale a:

- realizzare le riprese

- completare i lavori di post-produzione: montaggio, sound design, color correction

- esposizione finale: noleggio service e allestimento

CIO’ CHE DAI E’ TUO PER SEMPRE, ciò che non dai è perso per sempre. Noi cercheremo, in un rituale del corteggiamento di sedurvi con il nostro progetto, proprio come un innamorato cerca di conquistare la ragazza dei suoi sogni, offrendole, in un crescendo di coinvolgimento e pathos, una serie di doni.

Per "sedurvi" ancora di più abbiamo deciso di prendervi per la gola. Vi offriremo infatti, nel caso in cui vogliate omaggiarci di un anello di fidanzamento (500 €) o addirittura portarci all'altare (3000 €), un BRUNCH o una CENA presso il KITCHEN ristorante di Milano dove il vero protagonista è il cibo. Pochi tavoli in un ambiente intimo e rilassante. I migliori piatti della tradizione italiana, anche in chiave "gluten free" che si evolvono nel corso delle stagioni. Due orti che ne garantiscono la freschezza. La buona cucina senza compromessi. Una proposta che non potrete proprio rifiutare!


SI PUO' DARE DI PIU'

Siamo convinti che l'amore sia il "virus" più contagioso al mondo, quindi, se non potete sostenerci economicamente, innamoratevi del nostro progetto:

- fateci arrivare migliaia di LIKE

- postate questo messaggio d'amore sui tutti social che conoscete

- riempite la nostra casella di posta del cuore

- attaccatevi alla cornetta e parlate a tutti del nostro progetto

 PASSO A DUE project:

Passo a due is a project born from the collaboration between Elena Bellantoni and Mariana Ferratto. The two artists have been invited at the prestigious space for Contemporary Art Careof DOCVA in Milan for an artistic residency during the month of May 2014, and decided to develop a project in parallel as result of a comparison between their works.

Elena and Mariana have developed over the years some artistic projects with similar themes related to the concept of identity and relationship. Passo a due aims to analyse the concept of power within the relationship. They decided to confront this issue and develop two video works that investigate this relational topic.

The starting points of Bellantoni and Ferratto were two of their previous work, specifically Ich bin du bist ... (Bellantoni 2010) and Ciao (Ferratto 2011). 

CAMPAIGN

The Crowdfunding Campaign aims to support the Young Italian Art for the realization of two works of art. The support is fundamental to the creation of art, either conceptually and in practice.

Supporters will be able to get involved with the artists during the creation process of the works. The dynamics of sharing is a substantial part of the creative process by directly invoking the concept: the RELATIONSHIP.

The Artistic residency will end with the presentation of the work, where the relational and participatory processes triggered by the Passo a due campaign will be evident, too.

OBJECTIVES

Your support is functional:

- Carry out the shooting

- Complete the work on post-production: editing, sound design, color correction

-  Exhibition, rental service and equipments

We will try, as in a ritual of courtship to seduce you with our project, and such as a lover tries to win the girl of his dreams,  will offer you a series of gifts.

To "seduce" even more we decided to take you by the throat. In case you want to engage us with ring (500 €) or even lead to the altar (3000 €), we will express our gratitude with a BRUNCH or DINNER at KITCHEN restaurant in Milan, where food is the absolute protagonist! A few tables in an intimate and relaxing atmosphere where you can taste the best dishes of the Italian tradition. Two vegetables gardens guarantee only fresh and tasty products, without any compromises.
A proposal you cannot refuse!

OUR PERKS, to support us:

€10

First glances: thanks in the credits

€25

Courtship: digital postcard + thanks in the credits

€50

Dinner invitation: digital composition created by the artists + thanks in the credits

€100

First kiss: memory photo, composition of two photos 20X30 cm + thanks in the credits

€200

Declaration of love: emotional poster, poster signed by the artists produced during the residency edition of 100 + thanks in the credits

€500

Engagement ring:

Softbook, small artist's book edition of 5 format 15X20 cm produced during the residency @ KITCHEN + brunch restaurant in Milan + thanks in the credits

€1000

I introduce you my Parents:

Family Photo, diptych-scene photos framed autographed edition of one, 50X70 cm + thanks in the credits

€3000

Wedding Orange flower:

Wedding pictures, diptych-scene photos framed autographed edition of one, 100X80 cm + thanks in the credits as co producer, dinner invitation with the artists @ KITCHEN restaurant in Milan


Thanks to

In collaboration with

Le due artiste, invitate presso il prestigioso spazio Milanese Careof DOCVA per una residenza durante il mese di Maggio 2014, hanno deciso di sviluppare un progetto in parallelo frutto di un confronto sul proprio lavoro. 
CHI SIAMOElena
Bellantoni vive e lavora tra Berlino
e l’Italia. Si laurea alla "Sapienza" in Arte Contemporanea e studia
a Parigi e Londra, dove nel  2007 ottiene un MA in Visual Art WCA University of Arts London. Nel 2007 costituisce Platform

Berlino 2013 ; Archive tellers, al MAXXI B.A.S.E. Roma 2013; Visioni
d’arte Galleria A+A Venezia 2013;C'è una piccola radice che, se la
masticate, vi spuntano le ali immediatamente MAC Museo Lissone, 2013; Exodus ItaliaMUMI Museo de las Migraciones Montevideo Uruguay 2013; ReAzione video
installations and live performances, Fabbrica delle Candele Forlì, Forlì 2014; Spazi di percezione tra intangibile e tangibileGalleria Nazionale d’Arte Moderna Roma GNAM, 2014.  E’ artista in residenza al Careof/DOCVA nel
2014.
Mariana Ferratto si è laureata all’Accademia di Belle Arti di Roma ed ha completato la sua formazione con studi di teatro danza. Nel 2010-2011 ha vinto la residenza alla Cité Internationale des Arts, Paris premio promosso da Incontri Internazionali D’Arte. Nel 2012 vince insieme a Sara Basta il concorso “Arte, Patrimonio e Diritti Umani” indetto da Connecting Cultures, agenzia di ricerca per l'arte e il territorio in partnership con Fondazione ISMU - Patrimonio e Intercultura, con il sostegno del Ministero per i Beni e le Attività Culturali Nel 2008 ha vinto il primo premio del concorso “Intercorto, percorsi audiovisivi interculturali”, bandito dal Comune di Arezzo e dal Ministero del lavoro, della Salute e delle Politiche Sociali. È stata selezionata per il workshop “Officine dell’arte”, presso Careoff-DOCVA, Milano.
MOSTRE PERSONALI: 2011 - Ciao, The Gallery Apart, Roma; 2009 - I pesci rossi crescono in base alla dimensione del loro acquario, Fondazione Adriano Olivetti, Roma; Inside #4, The Gallery Apart, Roma; 2005 - Why?, Fondazione Pastificio Cerere, Roma.
MOSTRE COLLETTIVE: 2013 Exodus Italia presso il MUMI Museo de las Migraciones di Montevideo Uruguay, 2012 - Omaggio a Graziella Lonardi Buontempo, PAN – Palazzo delle Arti Napoli; Progetto delle Accademie di Belle Arti (2000 - 2010), 54a Biennale di Venezia, Tese delle Vergini dell’Arsenale, Venezia; Rumors sobre una exposició, Espai Zer01, Olot; 2010 - Monnaie de Paris, Paris; Videoprogetto Birmingham; Platform Translation_Interface, MLAC, Roma; 2009 - EXTRACONTEMPORANEA, Nuovo Cinema Aquila, Roma; 2 VIDEO UnDo.net 2008 - N.EST 2.0, Museo MADRE, Napoli; All day video & sound Art. Works selected, par des commissaries indépendans, St. Louis, Missouri – USA; Videoteque in Calypso, Sala Rekalde, Bilbao; XIII Biennale dei Giovani Artisti dell'Europa e del Mediterraneo, Bari; HELP YOURSELF become an ego lover, Londra; UP Itinerant Visions, Zurigo; 2007 - V Festival Internacional del Cine Pobre, Cuba; Isola Video, Studio Stefania Miscetti, Roma; Attori/ Spettatori, Auditorium Parco della Musica, Fondazione Alda Fendi, Roma; 2006 - Almadromestica, avec Drome megazine; 2005 - Play ’04, Neon-Campobase, Bologna, C/O Careof Milano; 2014 Roma. Artista in Residenza al Careof DOCVA di Milano.
CONCEPT

Sia Elena che Mariana negli anni hanno sviluppato dei progetti artistici su temi simili come l'identità e la relazione con l'altro. PASSO A DUE ha come obiettivo l'analisi del concetto di potere all'interno del rapporto di coppia, le due artiste hanno deciso di confrontarsi su questo tema e sviluppare due lavori video che indaghino proprio questo elemento relazionale. 
I punti di partenza di Bellantoni e Ferratto sono stati due loro lavori antecedenti, nello specifico Ich bin... du bist ( Bellantoni 2010) e Ciao (Ferratto 2011). Dal confronto e dallo scambio è nata l'idea di sviluppare durante il periodo di residenza due nuove opere video, per approfondire il percorso di ricerca. 

CAMPAGNA
La campagna di Crowdfunding mira a sostenere la Giovane Arte Italiana attraverso un percorso di ricerca per la realizzazione di due opere d'arte. Il sostegno diventa fondamentale ai fini della creazione artistica, sia concettualmente che concretamente. 
I  sostenitori potranno entrare in relazione con le artiste durante il processo di creazione delle opere. La dinamica di condivisione è parte sostanziale del processo creativo richiamando direttamente il concept: la RELAZIONE. Come in una scatola cinese si parte dal rapporto tra le artiste, ci si apre verso l'esterno attraverso il crowdfunding e si rende visibile il legame sviluppato lungo il percorso nelle opere finali.
La residenza si concluderà con la presentazione del lavoro in cui sarà evidente ogni processo relazionale: da quello dei protagonisti dei video a quello delle artiste, al processo partecipativo innescato dalla campagna Passo a due. 
OBIETTIVI
Il vostro supporto è funzionale a:
- realizzare le riprese
- completare i lavori di post-produzione: montaggio, sound design, color correction
- esposizione finale: noleggio service e allestimento
CIO’ CHE DAI E’ TUO PER SEMPRE, ciò che non dai è perso per sempre. Noi cercheremo, in un rituale del corteggiamento di sedurvi con il nostro progetto, proprio come un innamorato cerca di conquistare la ragazza dei suoi sogni, offrendole, in un crescendo di coinvolgimento e pathos, una serie di doni.Per "sedurvi" ancora di più abbiamo deciso di prendervi per la gola. Vi offriremo infatti, nel caso in cui vogliate omaggiarci di un anello di fidanzamento (500 €) o addirittura portarci all'altare (3000 €), un BRUNCH o una CENA presso il KITCHEN ristorante di Milano dove il vero protagonista è il cibo. Pochi tavoli in un ambiente intimo e rilassante. I migliori piatti della tradizione italiana, anche in chiave "gluten free" che si evolvono nel corso delle stagioni. Due orti che ne garantiscono la freschezza. La buona cucina senza compromessi. Una proposta che non potrete proprio rifiutare!
SI PUO' DARE DI PIU'

- postate questo messaggio d'amore sui tutti social che conoscete
- riempite la nostra casella di posta del cuore
- attaccatevi alla cornetta e parlate a tutti del nostro progetto PASSO A DUE project:Passo a due is a project born from the collaboration

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Louise Lowe. I'm a 25 year old Liverpool born photographer, and have been working professionally in the fields of Portrait, Fashion, Editorial, Music and PR for the last 7 years.  
  • I started my project last year, wanting to photograph the unique characters I saw each day on the streets of Liverpool and hold a small exhibition showcasing the diverse identity of this city. The project became very popular, very quickly and I decided to continue it for one whole year, curious to see how many people I could photograph throughout this time. 
  • The project vastly took hold when I created an interactive public event for Liverpool Light Night 2013, and had over 300 people attend the event to be photographed.
  • More and more people have wanted to be involved, and the turn out to each of the public open sessions has been incredible. 
  • Those 12 months have passed,all the portraits have been compiled and I am now ready to exhibit but this is no longer the small exhibition I first thought and after already supporting this project financially in my spare time, I now turn to you, the public to help me bring this epic collection of portraits to life.
  • Not only is this my first exhibition as an artist and photographer but I believe I have created a project that has brought together a community and also shows the identity of a city via the people who live here. I feel it is important for this collection to reach it's goal not only for myself and those featured and involved but also for the Liverpool public to see who they are and feel a part of something bigger.        
  • As well as Camp and Furnace, kindly donating "The Gold Room" to the project, Liverpool Light Night 14 are featuring it as a must-see exhibition in this year's celebration of art in the city.    

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need to raise £6,800 in the next 6 weeks. The majority of the funding is to cover the cost of printing the art work itself, and then the rest of the money is to go towards building the exhibition including lighting, marketing and advertising, promoting the event via posters and flyers and the distribution costs this entails, in order to reach as many people as possible.        
  • There are many amazing rewards for your pledges. From Postcards, Prints, Books and even your own Photo Session to commemorate this epic project coming to fruition, to also Personal, Editorial & Commercial High End Photographic and Video Sessions if you would prefer something a bit different and tailored more to your liking. I want you to feel involved in this project as well as get the most out of your rewards.    
  • If I don't reach my target, I have already discussed plans with the art printers to down scale the size of the exhibition. This would mean many people would not be included and it would be such a sorry waste of the hundreds of photographs that would not get to be seen that all help in creating the bigger picture.
  • Any further funds over my target will only lead to a bigger and better exhibition, with the possibility of the full collection being turned in to a beautiful coffee table book so the exhibition will live on once it is over.     

The Impact

  • This project has a chance to show the world who one city is. The people that walk its streets, which flow through its veins, the passion and creativity that keeps the heart of the city beating, the brilliant minds that keep it moving forward. Each indiviual creates its identity and these are the people you will meet in the train stations, shops, cafes, restaurants and bars, who will be at the gigs, festivals and events, and they are all important to its make up. 
  • Liverpool has a vast history of being negatively stereotyped and it's time to put these stereotypes to rest in this positive celebration.  
  • This is the first large scale project I have undertaken, and so far it has been more than successful in creating itself. The interest and support it has received has been overwhelming and shows this project is already worth a lot to so many people.
  • There is nothing stopping this project building on itself and doing something nation wide. Community is about including everyone and Liverpool is only a smaller community inside a much greater one. If there has been such a huge response from just one city, then I am sure there is something to be said for the rest of the British Isles.     

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spreading the word about this campaign will always be appreciated. Please tell your family and friends and ask them to share it on too.  
  • Remember you can do this by using the share tools on this campaign. 
  • If you feel you want to help further, volunteers for the exhibition weekend will be needed, as well as helping to build the exhibition itself. 

I am truly looking forward to working with you all to create something beautiful.

Thankyou.
