story:
Let me sum up...

Hi. I'm James 'Grim' Desborough, owner of Postmortem Studios. We're an independent RPG game and fiction publisher with a large portfolio of genre stock art. I've been working in the RPG industry for nearly 20 years and have worked with a lot of great artists and publishers.

For many years I worked with a young, promising artists known as 'DarkZel', until he was tragically killed in an accident. In his memory I have run a scholarship fund for several years as a competition, helping out young or struggling artists with money for supplies or just to help them through school. I want to help them in the same way I helped Zel.

This year we're doing something a little different. My ill health will not allow me to run a full crowdfunder and competition as I have in the past, and it has also become apparent that we do not have a large enough stockpile of stock art - yet - to make the scholarship self sustaining. To that end, this year, I intend to solicit donated art and to use the money raised here to commission art pieces from young and struggling artists, all of which will be sold as stock art to help the viability of the scholarship long term.

By helping here, you'll be contributing to aid for young artists for years to come.

What We Need

The money raised from the last year's sales of the scholarship stock art will be combined with whatever is raised here to commission pieces from young and struggling artists. $500 will allow us to commission a number of pieces which will then be sold on sites like RPGNOW into the games design and writing community.

'Exposure' has a bad rap when it comes to creative work - I'm writer, believe me, I know - but artists who donate art or get commissioned will get exposure to a large, potential pool of clients and their contact information will be disseminated to anyone who buys their art. I will also promote them on my blogs, social media and Youtube channels. Those commissioned will, of course, also be paid!

If we don't reach the full goal, whatever amount is raised will go on commissioning art. Similarly, if we exceed our goal, all the money raised will go on commissioning art.

What do you get? You get to help create a legacy and to make young and struggling artist's lives a little easier.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, what you can do is share the campaign and encourage others to do so. You can make people aware of the existing Scholarship stock art and encourage them to buy it and use it in their own projects. If you're an artist, you can donate work and the details for that can be found on the Postmortem Studios blog.

I will also promote them on my blogs, social media and Youtube channels. Similarly, if we exceed our goal, all the money raised will go on commissioning art.
What do you get? You get to help create a legacy and to make young and struggling artist's lives a little easier.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate, what you can do is share the campaign and encourage others to do so. You can make people aware of the existing Scholarship stock art and encourage them to buy it and use it in their own projects. If you're an artist, you can donate work and the details for that can be found on the Postmortem Studios blog.

story:
Designs aren't just beautiful, they tell a story.

Here at Artviation, we love aviation, travel & art. In the spirit of beautiful design; we turn a memory, a magnificent view into a masterpiece.

Founded by Francis Lye, a frequent flyer, a story-teller and an award-winning designer. His work ranges from product to architectural projects focusing on blending everyday pieces like furniture, home decor, lighting design and art into new expression and uses. Everything he designs come from the attention towards what is around him, living or inanimate. His works have been widely recognised with design awards, frequent publications and exhibitions.

If you would like to contact Artviation with suggestions, wish list or anything that go through your mind. Please drop us an email at hello@artviation.com

 

 

                                                                             

 

Seeing the world through an airplane window. 
"Whenever i fly i always ask for a window seat. Seeing the world from the above gives you a different perspective on the world. Patterns emerge, nature shines and cities feel colossal"

 

Every month we present you the new destination we liked & enjoyed.

 

Each piece of work is limited to 300 copies only, hand signed & numbered by the designer.

 

  • Offset printed on FSC certified paper Renoir 130gsm Extra White.
  • Printed using soy ink, it is a kind of ink made from soybeans, as opposed to traditional petroleum-based ink, soy-based ink is more environmental friendly.
  • Each piece of hand-drawn work takes at least 504 hours to complete.

 

  • Posters will be packed & delivered in Hard Tubes.
  • On the confirmation and dispatch of your order, you will be provided with a tracking number.

 

  • Does not include frame.
  • The print is easily fits on standard frame size (50cm x 70cm) available at any IKEA stores worldwide.

 

 

 

 

 

  • The artwork design completed (1st fly-in destination_Moscow):  September 2017
  • Paper selection, material sourcing, offset printing, packaging:  1-14 October 2017
  • Worldwide shipping:  From 15 October onwards

 

http://instagram.com/artviation_official

 

http://www.artviation.com

 

hello@artviation.com

story:
What is it about?

My name is Alexander Smith. I'm an artist who has been working professionaly now since more then 7 years. Although my work has been shown in different parts of the world and has been described as a marvelous blend of western painting technique with the influence of Japanese art, it still is a tough battle to get things done. 

This campaine is not a major idea that needs to be sponsored. It is, actually a rather small thing but with significant importance to me and my carrier as an artist. To be able to sell, to recieve commissions and te be invited for shows, you have to build a name. a simple and effective way to do this is to be mentioned in a professional art guide. This particalur guide has already a renowed name for reaching a wide spread public. A public which has its interest in art and always likes to see new entries. 

What We Need & What You Get 

A fixed fee needs to be paid in order to have my work being represented in this art guide. The fee consist out of ordering 20 copies of the art guide + a extra fee for having a double page publication. Also there is a small amount needed for having someone writing a professional shot story about me and my work. Although I'm good with a brush, I come short when it come to words. 
All together it comes down to the following:

- basic fee consisting out of 20 copies á 10,60 euro makes: 212,00 euro

- extra fee for double page publication: 106,00 euro

- having a short story written by professional: around 150,00 euro

Al together it becomes around 468,00 euro (not 19% tax included) this brings it down to up and around $ 700,00. 

Now, if you are that sweet person that is going to help me out, what is it that you can expect? First of all you will be updated with all the activities arond this art guide publication. You will receive standard a personal thank you and as perks you might be mentioned on my website, get an invitation, receive a copy of the actual art guide or become a owner of a unique handmade zen ink drawing on handpressed paper. 

In case I do not reach my goal of $ 700,00 the funds will still be used for my representation in the art guide.  

Of course it would be great if you could contribute to this fund but I understand very well that some of you just don't have the means for it. nevertheless I would like to ask you to spread the word for my cause. You can use the special Indiegogo share tools on this page!!

story:
Hi! I’m Ann Moeller Steverson. I am a contemporary figurative painter native to Huntsville, Alabama. I love painting people and beautiful objects.

OPEN is my new series of contemporary realist paintings, which will explore the beauty of letting go.

I am creating this new body of work for a solo show opening in February 2019 at the Little Green Store in Huntsville, Alabama. Through this Indiegogo fund, you have the opportunity to pre-purchase work (in exclusive and first-choice formats) that will be created for the show and have an inside view of its creation.

Since the very first time I was asked to create an artist statement, I’ve struggled over what to say other than, “I just really want to make beautiful paintings.” This is still the truest statement about why I make my work, but I’ve come to the realization that the beauty in what any of us has to offer is the most authentic parts of ourselves. That is what I want to give. My pieces are always a reflection of where I am personally and are continually changing with me.

This past year, I’ve been going through a period of dramatic change and transition in my life, throughout which I’ve been intentionally practicing the art of letting go. This has included releasing expectations, letting go of resistance, and my best attempts at sharing the most open, authentic version of myself. I am finding that this process lets in peace, love, joy, and intense beauty.

For my next body of work, I will integrate this personal inspiration with specific design ideas that I have in mind. I will explore visual concepts of movement, light and dark patterns, and cool light softly falling across beautiful scenes. I want to construct abstractly well-designed pieces while sharing what I find intensely beautiful and peaceful. My hope is that through this work, you can experience openness, joy, and peace.  

For the creation of this work, I will be collecting orchids in whites and purples, soft green moss, and taxidermic doves. I will also be hiring models so that I can continue to explore human connections and the universal experiences that we have.

I want to invite you to join me on this journey. Every level of collector now has the opportunity to pre-purchase a piece from my new body of work, thereby helping to fund its creation. I am creating prints exclusively for my Indiegogo supporters. I have not created prints in several years, and no other prints from this body of work will be created or sold. I hope this option provides an opportunity for those who love my work but are not able to afford my original pieces to have something of mine in their homes. Your purchase will help provide me with the resources to explore the inspiration that is calling me to this project.

Muse - $2,000: First choice of one original painting from OPEN, up to 12”x16”

Patron - $75: A signed and framed, highly limited edition 8”x10” giclée print, including a weekly progress report

Sponsor - $45: A signed, unframed, highly limited edition 8”x10” giclée print, including a weekly progress report.

Even if you can't make a pre-purchase today, you can still be a part of the project. Join the journey as a supporter for a budget-friendly $5 and receive weekly email updates from the studio. Or simply share the love by using the Indiegogo share to invite your art lover friends and help spread the word about OPEN.

Project Budget

Orchids:                                   $100

Taxidermic Doves:              $150 each, up to $600

Model Fees:                            $20 per hour, up to $120

Props/Other Botanical:   $100

TOTAL:                                     $1,000

If I don’t reach this entire goal, I’ll use the available funds to gather what I can and then do what artists do best: get creative. Funds that exceed this budget will be used for art materials and framing expenses for the show, so your generous support is greatly appreciated.  

With faith, gratitude and love,

Ann

story:
Above: Sneak peek at Wanderer of Yawnder final cover art 

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

HEAR YE!!

THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED SO FAR. AT THE HALFWAY POINT OF THIS CAMPAIGN, I HAVE REACHED MY GOAL. AMAZING!

Reaching this goal will enable me to print 100 or so books. Ultimately, I would love to be able to print more. So the more I raise, the more books I can print, eh! I'm currently putting the finishing touches on the artwork and layout, and I'll be sending the files off to the printer next week. Cripes! But I can't wait to deliver the books.

By visiting, contributing to, and sharing this campaign, I will be able to publish, what will hopefully be, the first of many picture books, thanks to you.

Regards,
Jay Dart
11/7/2012

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _


WANDERER OF YAWNDER - FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN

“While the ponderers ponder, and the wonderers wonder,
the wanderers wander, and the plunderers plunder.” - Jiggs

G’day. Since 2008, I’ve been exhibiting original graphite and watercolour drawings from my series about Wanderers around the whole world. Over the past couple of winters, I’ve been honing a narrative that has been slowly emerging from my artistic practice in which I’ve produced almost 100 drawings and even won some awards. The result is my first picture book, titled Wanderer of Yawnder. This is the first in a series of stories from the epic narrative that has come from my ponderings about Wanderers and my learnings from Granduncle Jiggs — my Foredad, mentor and provider of the story in this book. It's also the most significant art endeavor that I've undertaken. It's very scary and exciting at the same time.

With your support, I will be self-publishing a limited first run of these books, featuring 21 brand new graphite and watercolour drawings. This is also your opportunity to get one of these special artist-editions. Each one will be signed and numbered, and will include a little doodle inside, to make it extra special. There are also plenty of other perks for your contributions. I believe this book will be like something you’ve never seen. It’s a storybook for all ages to enjoy and I look forward to sharing it with yuz.

For a complete look at my portfolio, please visit www.thedart.ca.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

FUNDS
I have set a goal for this fundraising campaign at an amount that would cover costs associated with printing, binding and shipping a limited run of books as well as fulfilling some of the perks. It's an expensive endeavor printing books so, as a first time author, it's great to know that there are people out there who'd want one. If I go beyond my goal, then I will be able to print more books. If I really go above and beyond my goal, like say I double it, I will be able to do a fancier print job with linen cover and foil stamping. Wouldn't that be nice!

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

ABOUT THE BOOK
Wanderer of Yawnder follows Jiggs as he wanders Elsewheres parts, searching for inspiration, when he finds a source over Yawnder. He soon learns about the Foredad clouds; whispering and yawning geists and zeitgeists in the winds. The book focuses on Jiggs’ personal experiences discovering the Elsewheres Lights and getting himself up there by building the tallest of ladders in order to procure a geist and proclaim his first invention: Magical Mystery Beards. When others happen upon this source, he finds his invention wasn't so inventive after all and he must dig deeper in order to create something truly original.

The story is based on the series of graphite and watercolour drawings that I have been exhibiting over the past few years which purports to elucidate epiphanic experiences through whimsical compositions. They reference hiking, fishing, agriculture and forebears in an attempt to create a timeless yet palpable perspective on the nature of inspiration, creation and originality. Contemporary cultural trends, where ideas can be broadcast instantly to a wide audience and recorded in the ‘cloud,’ also manifest themselves in this story.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

BOOK SPECS

  • 48 pages
  • 8.5” x 8.5”
  • Hardcover book containing reproductions of 21 new graphite and watercolour drawings
  • Limited edition of 100-250 (depending on how this fundraiser goes)
  • Each copy signed and numbered along with a doodle from the artist on the inside cover
  • The book will be printed on FSC approved paper in the UK

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

 

Above: Elsewheres Lights artwork for new limited edition print

PERKS

Thank You Card: As a heartfelt thanks, Jiggs and I will send you a thank you card featuring a little drawing and special message. 

Limited Edition Print: I’m taking this opportunity to do a couple other special things. Firstly, I will be including a brand new limited edition Elsewheres Lights print (pictured above) with some of the perks. This print was recently chosen through a contest that I ran on my Facebook page. It will be an 8" x 10" giclee print (meaning digitally printed with archival inks) on high quality bamboo paper.

Bookmark Set: I will also be doing a new set of 4 bookmarks especially for this campaign (those who are familiar with my exhibitions know how I love to give out bookmarks). Each one will feature artwork from the book.

Xmas Print & Greeting Cards: At the $150 Xplorer level, you can get one of my 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas limited edition prints, which are valued at $150, plus I’ll throw a full set of 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas greeting cards (set of 12) and you get a copy of the book too.  

Commissions: The commissions are the best deal of all though, really, cuz you’ll be able to request whatever you want, and those are good prices for my drawings at those sizes. Plus you get the book and other goodies. Although I am open to different requests, my intention for the commissioned pieces is to do a Wanderer-related drawing, such as a portrait of you or someone ye know with a magical mystery beard. I am also open to recreating pieces similar to ones that I have done over the past few years with your input. Futherer, for 8” x 10” commissions, I can do individual portraits or slightly less involved compositions. If you would like a group portrait or a complex composition, please consider the larger commissions. Shanks.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

ABOUT JAY
Jay Dart is an award-winning drawist based in Port Perry, Ontario, Canada. Born in Toronto, Jay graduated from the Fine Art programme at the University of Guelph. He currently works in Toronto as a graphic designer while living and drawing in the sticks. He has released two series of prints from his graphite drawings; the Yesteryears album and 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas. He has exhibited within Canada in Toronto, Guelph, Whitby, Canmore and internationally in Amsterdam, Netherlands and Portland, Oregon.

ABOUT OL' JIGGS
Who is this Jiggs anyway? Granduncle Jiggs has showed me what's beyond the sticks and everythin' about how to wander and about the place over Yawnder. He's about a hundred but feels 36, cooks by a fire with wood sticks, and when he sits he hunkers cuz he's ol' Jiggs. He’s also a drawist and he just got the internet so ye may see some of his drawings soon enough. Most importantly, the words in this book are his. This is his story that he’s shared with me and it has inspired many a-drawin’.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

SHIPPING
Shipping costs are included in the perk amounts (as a courtesy, please add $5 for those outside North America). As long as everything goes smoothly with printing and shipping, I am aiming to have the printed books back just in time to deliver them to you for the holidays. For those kind folks contributing at $250 and above, I would gladly send you the book as soon as I get them but ask for a bit more time for the commissions.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

SHARING
I realize times are tight so if you aren't able to contribute funds at this time, please consider spreading the word about my project via the many sharing tools Indiegogo provides here.

Also, here's where I can be found elsewheres on the internet:
For a complete look at my portfolio, please visit www.thedart.ca.
For the most up to date news, Facebook page... facebook.com/wandererdart
Sometimes I'm a Twitterer and I'll have special updates throughout my campaign... @wandererdart
For further insights, I'm a Tumblrer too... postcardsofelsewheres.tumblr.com

I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone in advance for your support. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask em'.

Hardcover book containing reproductions of 21 new graphite and watercolour drawings
Limited edition of 100-250 (depending on how this fundraiser goes)
Each copy signed and numbered along with a doodle from the artist on the inside cover
The book will be printed on FSC approved paper in the UK
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
 

Above: Elsewheres Lights artwork for new limited edition print
PERKS 
Thank You Card: As a heartfelt thanks, Jiggs and I will send you a thank you card featuring a little drawing and special message.  
Limited Edition Print: I’m taking this opportunity to do a couple other special things. Firstly, I will be including a brand new limited edition Elsewheres Lights print (pictured above) with some of the perks. This print was recently chosen through a contest that I ran on my Facebook page. It will be an 8" x 10" giclee print (meaning digitally printed with archival inks) on high quality bamboo paper.
Bookmark Set: I will also be doing a new set of 4 bookmarks especially for this campaign (those who are familiar with my exhibitions know how I love to give out bookmarks). Each one will feature artwork from the book.

Xmas Print & Greeting Cards: At the $150 Xplorer level, you can get one of my 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas limited edition prints, which are valued at $150, plus I’ll throw a full set of 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas greeting cards (set of 12) and you get a copy of the book too.  Commissions: The commissions are the best deal of all though, really, cuz you’ll be able to request whatever you want, and those are good prices for my drawings at those sizes. Plus you get the book and other goodies. Although I am open to different requests, my intention for the commissioned pieces is to do a Wanderer-related drawing, such as a portrait of you or someone ye know with a magical mystery beard. I am also open to recreating pieces similar to ones that I have done over the past few years with your input. Futherer, for 8” x 10” commissions, I can do individual portraits or slightly less involved compositions. If you would like a group portrait or a complex composition, please consider the larger commissions. Shanks.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
ABOUT JAYJay Dart is an award-winning drawist based in Port Perry, Ontario, Canada. Born in Toronto, Jay graduated from the Fine Art programme at the University of Guelph. He currently works in Toronto as a graphic designer while living and drawing in the sticks. He has released two series of prints from his graphite drawings; the Yesteryears album and 12 Days of Climate Change Xmas. He has exhibited within Canada in Toronto, Guelph, Whitby, Canmore and internationally in Amsterdam, Netherlands and Portland, Oregon.
ABOUT OL' JIGGSWho is this Jiggs anyway? Granduncle Jiggs has showed me what's beyond the sticks and everythin' about how to wander and about the place over Yawnder. He's about a hundred but feels 36, cooks by a fire with wood sticks, and when he sits he hunkers cuz he's ol' Jiggs. He’s also a drawist and he just got the internet so ye may see some of his drawings soon enough. Most importantly, the words in this book are his. This is his story that he’s shared with me and it has inspired many a-drawin’.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
SHIPPINGShipping costs are included in the perk amounts (as a courtesy, please add $5 for those outside North America). As long as everything goes smoothly with printing and shipping, I am aiming to have the printed books back just in time to deliver them to you for the holidays. For those kind folks contributing at $250 and above, I would gladly send you the book as soon as I get them but ask for a bit more time for the commissions.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
SHARINGI realize times are tight so if you aren't able to contribute funds at this time, please consider spreading the word about my project via the many sharing tools Indiegogo provides here.
Also, here's where I can be found elsewheres on the internet:For a complete look at my portfolio, please visit www.thedart.ca.For the most up to date news, Facebook page... facebook.com/wandererdartSometimes I'm a Twitterer and I'll have special updates throughout my campaign... @wandererdartFor further insights, I'm a Tumblrer too... postcardsofelsewheres.tumblr.com
I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone in advance for your support. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask em'.

story:
Cleburne in an Instant! 

Who the heck is this kid, and what the heck is his project all about?

Hey everybody! My name is Christian Oliveira, and the project I need your help with is called Cleburne in an Instant. Clebune in an Instant is an art project attempting to capture all the perks my hometown of Cleburne, Texas, has to offer! Cleburne is a pretty down-to-Earth town, and it has been that way for a long time. However, with the opening of the new highway coming next year and a continued influx of newcomers alreadu=y streaming in, its small-town charm can't last forever! That is why I would like to capture all of that charm on instant film and put it in a book for posterity! To make it even more interesting, I want to capture the places with David Hockney-style collages. The biggest collage will be an 8x10 instant collage of Downtown Cleburne from the roof of a local office! Awesome, right?! 

Help Wanted! 

In order to make this project work, I need your help!

Because this project is going to consist of Polaroid collages of each place, we're going to need lots of film! My $1,500 goal is to help pay for the cost of film (particularly the 8x10 film) and the cost of rewards. Any extra money will go to pay for more film and other perks that will enhance the project even more! If I do not reach my goal of $1,500, your money will still go towards paying for the film, and I will pay for the rest!

Rewards!!!

If you help me out, there will be something in it for you!!!

  • $5 donations will recieve a special thank-you card with a hand-written note!
  • $10 donations will recieve a thank-you card as well as a discount on the price of the book!
  • $25 donations will recieve a special signed 8x10 print of one of the collages, in addition to a thank-you card and a discount coupon.
  • $50 donations will recieve a poster with the 8x10 collage on it, as well as the previously mentioned rewards!
  • $100 donations will recieve all of the previously mentioned rewards AND a signed copy of the book!

Why this is important...

I belive that capturing memories is an important part of living life to the fullest! It helps us remember where we've come from, and where we are yet to go. This is why I find it highly important to capture Cleburne as it is now before it grows up. Please help me capture my town in an interesting way so that future generations may see what life was like "back in the day." Thanks a ton!

story:
Genocide Prevention and Awareness Series

ACCESS Atlanta, the young professional board of the American Jewish Committee, is commissioning a custom work of art to commemorate the Holocaust, Rwandan Genocide, Sudanese Genocide and all atrocities committed around the world. This piece is designed to commemorate a movement through which we hope to bring understanding, awareness, and action. As the artwork describes, we should not see these memories as an end, but rather a means to understanding how to approach the future. 

At this very moment, our commissioned artist is hard at work, preparing for the unveiling of this piece at our finale on November 9. This special evening of reflection will include the unveiling of our commissioned work of art along with narratives from survivors of Genocide.

Working largely in blown glass, the artist (Thompson Galetovic) saw the need for something different in this piece; something that evokes both the chaos of tragedy and the hope for life after it. He will create a multi-media sculpture that will allow the viewer to feel a part of the piece and of 'putting the pieces together.'  "Putting the Pieces Together" incorporates a user-interface suspended above a mosaic of broken glass (harkening back to the Night of Broken Glass [Kristallnacht, 1939]). 

What Your Donation Supports

  • Over half of this campaign will directly support our local artist, giving him the time and resources needed to complete this masterpiece
  • Funds will also support video production services to capture intimate interviews with survivors of the Holocaust, Rwandan and Sudanese Genocides
  • Remaining funds raised will be used for event logistics to provide audio and projection for these important stories of survival 

The Impact

We have all been affected by Genocide, or know people who have been affected by Genocide. We need to engage our peers, young professionals, in this important conversation. 

ACCESS participates every spring as part of a coalition that lobbies the Georgia State Legislature to renew the resolution designating April as Genocide Prevention and Awareness Month in Georgia (GPA Month).  Please check for the 2015 calendar of events surrounding GPA month and stay tuned for opportunities to participate in events and advocacy during GPA month in 2015.

The end of genocide may not come tomorrow, but it's a journey, and every person that enters that journey with us puts us one step closer to our destination.  Thank you for joining us.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please use share buttons on the bottom of the page to spread the word
    • Contact anyone on our team to find out how you can get involved 
    • After you've donated, please reach out to five people directly to ask them to join you in supporting Genocide Awareness and Prevention

    "Putting the Pieces Together is a mission that embodies the name. When ACCESS approached me for proposals for this piece, I felt lost in the goal; how does one embody the vast range of emotion and history that stems from genocide? These are moments in time with implications and repercussions beyond compare. Yet for each person affected by them, it is something specific and personal.
    To express this confluence of memories and meaning, I had to design something that involved the intermingling of more mediums and symbolic features than any other piece; I had to show both how these tragedies shatter our world, and how we can still hold ourselves together above the atrocity and avoid getting caught in the pit of negative influence; together, we can put our pieces back where they belong, and find that peace is not as far away as it seems.  This does not involve forgetting the past. Instead, this piece encourages us to use the past as a lens through which we may dream of a brighter future." -Thompson Galetovic

story:
My name is Durty-1 and I'm an urban artist from Pittsburgh, PA. I have been displaying my art for about two years now, and in that time span my art has gotten into the hands of: hip hop legend KRS ONE, hip hop iconic figure Paradise Gray, Mr. Dibbs, 1/2 of Run DMC Darryl "D.M.C." McDaniels, and graffiti legend Adam Cost. My work has also gotten recognition from Chuck D, Paradise Gray and Atmosphere.

This campaign is being done to raise $2500 for a studio that is getting built. I am converting my garage into a functioning studio. Having this studio built will give me the room to grow as a full time artist. Right now, all I have is a work space, and I need to add the proper ventilation, and lighting for what I create. Once this is completed, I will have everything in one area, and be able to work on multiple commissions at once, and work on bigger projects. 

What is needed? The funding that is raised will go to all the materials for building the studio: drywall, electrical materials for the proper lighting, a ventilation system for while I'm working, and all other materials . What ever is left over will go into the supplies to get me started, not one cent will be pocketed for anything outside my art career.

With everyone's contributions to this campaign, it will get me one more step closer to pursuing the career I've always wanted, being a full time artist. I love art, and the process in creating it. Even if the goal of $2500 is not reached, the funds that are raised will all go to getting this studio built. 

Even if you can't contribute financially, sharing this link and info is another way to help bring awareness to my goal. Please make sure to use the Indiegog share tools to bring awareness to this campaign. 


To view the work that I have done please go to the following links. 
www.facebook.com/durtyarts 
www.instagram.com/durtyart 
www.redfishbowl.com/durty

story:
Our Story


We are a group of friends and artists in Toronto, most of us recent graduates from the Ontario College of Art and Design. We are comprised of illustrators, graphic designers, printmakers and new media creators, but we all have a love and interest in silk screen printing. We have been participants in group and solo shows in the last year, but as a collective we want to enable ourselves to reach a wider audience. If we could build a studio to produce more work for show and sale, we would be able to thrive from our art, and would be able to table at art and community events, not to mention be able to work as a for-hire silk screen studio. The idea is to build the studio for personal and collaborative projects. Thunderbird will also gives us a great opportunity to put together a new group show, and ideally we will be working on a show to be conceived and created all from our humble studio. We would like to have the studio fit, finished and furnished by the end of the summer, to buckle down for a long winter of printing!


Gillian Blekkenhorst, http://www.blekkenhorst.ca/

Katherine Verhoeven www.verwho.com

JJ tebrake http://johanntebrake.blogspot.com/

Erin Ornstein http://users.livejournal.com/_intothetrees_/

Igor Provod http://igorprovod.carbonmade.com/

Trevor Henderson http://trevorhendersonillustration.blogspot.com/

Jenn Woodall http://www.jennwoodall.com/

Misha Snyder www.mishasnyder.com

Mary Verhoeven


The Impact

As young artists, resources are hard to come by. It's also difficult to afford secondary spaces for the production of art, and continuing experimentation. We have the space, but now we need to make it real and functional. Without your donations, none of us will be able to work on screen printing. We won't have the opportunity to make zines, cards, prints, full scale pieces, and will miss great opportunities. Your donation will help not just one person, but nine start a new way to live and thrive from the creative process. Your donation ensures our continued ability to live from drawings and design.

Our first project will be a series of 11"x14" posters for an upcoming show.


What We Need

PLUMBING
$35  Garden Hose 60'
$10  Plumbers Tape
$10  bucket for waste water.
$10  screen to keep chunks of paint from going down the drain

MISC
$15 Clothes Pins and String for drying. hopefully the drying racks and space ought to be enough.
$20 Water Resistant Insulation Foam
$20  Screws
$20 Insulation foam and sheet plastic

$30 two squeegees

$60 three buckets of primary inks

$30 printing clamps

$14 screen cleaner

$30 emulsion


EXPOSURE UNIT
$120  four 4 foot long Black Light Bulbs
$200 Exposure Unit:
- big sheet of glass or plexi
- electrical/wiring
- Black drop cloth
- red safe light


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're in the Toronto area and are at all able to donate anything from the list above, we'd love to hear from you!

story:
Advance ticket sales to our fundraiser have closed, but tickets are still available at the door for $20.

Help NYC be a part of the largest coordinated burn in Burning Man history!


The CORE Effigy Burn

The CORE (Circle of Regional Effigies) project invites Burning Man communities from around the world to submit effigies representative of their culture to be placed in a circle around the Man. This highly ambitious undertaking will culminate in the simultaneous burning of 24 pieces: the largest coordinated burn in the event’s 25-year history.

The Tree of Heaven

The Tree of Heaven is the greater NYC community's contribution to the CORE effigy burn. It consists of a luminous subway map that appears to be embedded in the Playa floor, glowing with the vibrant energy of the city that never sleeps. 

From the center of the map a tree pushes its way towards the light, as if busting up through a crack in the cement. A captivating mash-up of organic tree-shapes and steel, concrete and chain-link textures, it erupts in thousands of leaves that are customized by the entire New York City area Burning Man community to reflect our brilliant diversity.

Benches, each owned and designed by a different New York City area Burning Man artist or collective, surround the piece, offering participants an opportunity to relax and reflect on their relationships to NYC, BRC and the growing, changing world around them. At each bench, sound artist Douglas Hart will create a different installation that reflects the sounds of the city.


The Impact

The Tree of Heaven offers NYC-area Burners to collaborate on an art project that represents our community. As Burning Man gains popularity and participants, large regional communities such as NYC become increasingly factioned into theme camps and sub-cultures, and we have begun to lose the sense of ourselves as a cohesive community. Our contribution to the CORE regionals project offers us a valuable opportunity to come together as a single community once again, and prove to ourselves and to the world that together we are greater than the sum of our parts. 

And what better way to do it than to build something that will look great going up in flames?

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to purchase our materials - lumber, metal, lighting, sound.  We've already gotten some amazing assistance: router time has been generously donated by SceniCorp, and shipping provided by the NYC Container Crew.  


And we have perks!

$25 can get you a leaf from the tree

$50 can get you a leather leaf necklace based on the design of the tree

$100 can get you a custom picture frame based on the design of the tree

$150 gets you a leaf necklace AND picture frame

$250 puts you on Sparky the Fire Truck for the Art Car parade prior to the burn on Thursday night.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to spreading the word about this fund raising campaign, there are a ton of other ways you can help out with this project. The Tree of Heaven needs:

-Illustrators

-Electricians

-Scenic Painters

-Camps willing to adopt a box of leaves for decoration

-Help at our Drink Play Work days

-Help us plan a fund raising party

-Let us set up a decoration station at YOUR fund raising party


Email us at nycore11@gmail.com and let us know how you'd like to help.

In addition to spreading the word about this fund raising campaign, there are a ton of other ways you can help out with this project. The Tree of Heaven needs:
-Illustrators
-Electricians
-Scenic Painters
-Camps willing to adopt a box of leaves for decoration
-Help at our Drink Play Work days
-Help us plan a fund raising party
-Let us set up a decoration station at YOUR fund raising party

Email us at nycore11@gmail.com and let us know how you'd like to help.

story:
BROWN & BLACK tattoo shop is a big dream of ours. Studio will not only be a place, where you can get tattooed, but also a gallery and a place where each can find inspiration. It is going to be a friendly and classy shop, where people will be able to hang out and meet new friends.  The shop will be a custom tattoo shop so there will be no flash designs, everything will be unique and designed just for the costumer. 

Who are we?

Hey! I am Pino from Slovenia. I am currently studying at University of design. I have been a tattoo artist for more than 6 years. I have got two great passions in my life; art and tattoo. I worked in two professional tattoo shops and gathered many experience, working with costumers and art. I thing a long road still lays in front of me in which I think the next step is to open my own tattoo shop. You can take a look at my artwork and sketches on Instagram @pinosavnik.

My name is Rok Polanc, I am 24 years old. Since I remember, art especially drawing was my greatest passion. From my perspective tattoo is a fascinating way to express art and I have always admired and respected people who carry this extraordinary art on their bodies. That and Pino Savnik, who inspired me and gave me this opportunity, are two main reasons why I have this big wish to work as tattoo artist and express myself through art of tattoo. There is nothing better than to make living of your biggest passion.


Lets make it happen

  • Brown & Black is simple in nature, but multifaceted in concept and is going to be so much more than a place to get inked.  It will be an all-in-one creative studio space, tattoo shop, gallery, and classroom.
  • We want to help people visualize their ideas, and breathe life into them. Motivation, ambition, and determination empower us. We have love, passion, and drive for what we do and want to be creative full time.
  • The funds will also help us acquire everything we need to make our shop as hygienic as ti can get. We want our shop standards to be the best they possibly can be. 
  • All perks will be limited edition and are never to be reproduced again. Take a look, there is something for everyone.
  • Even if we are unable reach our funding goal we still can move forward with a smaller version of our biggest dreams.

  • Our tattoo shop we will embody above and beyond customer service. Going to a tattoo shop/art studio can be uncomfortable especially for first timers. Brown & Black will have a comfortable and friendly atmosphere making each tattoo experience as stress free as possible. We want it to be a place where people will want to be a part of, just come to say hello, hang out, and have fun. Hopefully one day it will be a staple in the community, a place to see art, and source of many forms of inspiration.
  • From the second someone walks in we will engage them and find out what they want and how we can achieve their goal. We plan on giving complimentary aftercare packages to each tattoo client/guest. Being paperless as far as the administrative part of the shop is another aspect we will be striving to make a reality. We will make sure it is okay to contact each person a few weeks after their appointments to follow up on how well their tattoo is healing and if they would like to schedule a touch up appointment if necessary. Lastly, we will host a closed party for our clients to have their tattoos photographed and documented. Not only will our clients be able to network and meet other people, but also we will able to get to know them as friends.  
  • Furthermore, on top of being a place you can get tattooed, gain inspiration, and have your ideas visualized we would like to give back to young and emerging artists. We have many ideas from basic to complex.

How to help?

As much as Brown & Black is our idea, it's for everyone to be a part of.  We are reaching out to art lovers, tattoo enthusiasts, makers, creators, and people of all ages.  Help us make this dream a reality.  Thank you for looking and if you see something you like, please pass it along and share it with your friends and family.

story:
WHO, WHAT & WHY

 Hi, I’m Colleen Wolstenholme. I want to create a free 8-month studio residency for emerging artists in my Hantsport, N.S. studio which is unused 8 months of the year. It is fully equipped for sculpture, ceramics and jewelry-making (metalsmithing). Accommodation will also be provided.  Meals will be the artist’s responsibility.
Supporters’ donations will cover rent for accommodations and studio space plus the operating costs incurred through use of the space. 

Our goal is to begin this first residency shortly after our campaign’s end, so we need your contributions now to ensure a timely start for the project.

Your generosity now can help support this studio into the future, and help young emerging artists create futures for themselves through their work. At the end of the residency the work produced will be shown in a prearranged exhibition where it can be professionally documented adding to the residency archive and giving the selected artist high resolution images of their work to aid in applying for grants and future exhibitions.

We have built a large well-equipped artist studio of 1,200 square feet, which we want to utilize for this residency. We don't want to waste this valuable resource but seek to use it to enrich Nova Scotia and therefore we would even like to enhance the studio's ability by adding new equipment such as a TIG welder, band-saw, etc. In addition to being of benefit to the community, through shorter term projects, and the selected artists, this project will enable us to generate enough income to cover our costs thereby ensuring the survival of the space as an artist studio and workshop. The studio is equipped with a pottery kiln, large capacity compressor, MIG welder, lost wax casting equipment, and other tools used to make sculpture, as well as table saw, drill press, well-equipped jeweler's bench, and many other tools which will provide opportunity to work in a variety of media.

One of the toughest things for newly graduated artists is to find the time and well-equipped workspace with which to produce a cohesive body of work, a necessary step on the way to becoming a professional artist.

Recent grads can’t afford to rent studio space and the equipment they need is very expensive.  This project will provide needed help on the road to their being able to
generate income from their work. It will give new graduates the opportunity to continue the work they have begun during their university years. Without an opportunity such as this, most are forced to obtain full time employment and thereby lessen the likelihood that they will continue on the road to becoming an artist.

Nova Scotia is home to one of Canada’s premiere art schools – the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design University, but the attrition rate for recent BFA graduates is very high.  This residency  will ultimately provide two of these graduates each year the opportunity to kick-start their careers.  Becoming a successful artist takes dedication and hard work from the start.

Residency artists will be selected from a pool of applicant submissions. The call will go out immediately after the campaign ends and be selected by a committee composed of professional artists and art professors.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The budget per artist is $15,000.  The studio can support two residencies at a time.  $10,000 per resident for expenses: rent and other accommodation costs,  e.g., heat, electricity, internet, and other supplies and utilities, kitchen facilities, laundry facilities and other needs.  $5,000 grant for the artist to cover needs related to the residency, including art making materials and other expenses.


PERKS

For a donation in the specified amount the supporter will receive one of the following:

  • 10.00 A heartfelt thank you and your name on our Facebook page as a supporter.
  • 20.00 Invitation and poster for the exhibition.
  • 50.00 T-Shirt designed by the artist selected.
  • 75.00 Invitation, poster and catalog for the exhibition.
  • 75.00 Pill lapel pin.
  • 100.00 Pill necklace.
  • 150.00 The above exhibition materials plus artist designed T-shirt or tote bag.
  • 300.00 Original 13" diameter signed ink drawing by Colleen Wolstenholme from the Shifty Packets series. Ceramic plaque on the donor's wall at the residency with your name on it.
  • 600.00 One original ink drawing by C. Wolstenholme 2013, Map Drawing#1.


  •  

For a larger selection visit

www.colleenwolstenholme.com

and click on the silver pill daisy.

THE IMPACT

This residency has great potential for increasing the number of successful practicing artists in Nova Scotia. A strong presence of art in a society is known to support the
development of critical thinking and improve educational outcomes.  It will foster the development of creativity and imagination and facilitate social change.  It has been argued that culture is as important for full development of human beings as health or wealth.

 We must foster the imaginative capacity and creative thinking of our population in order for Nova Scotia to participate on a world stage in new innovation economies.  There is no discipline that nurtures this more than arts and culture. 

Investment in arts-related infrastructure benefits everyone, providing concrete benefits to the broader society.  In the longer term, it will create an attractive place for others to locate.

 THE ECONOMIC SPINOFFS

Nova Scotia, a beautiful coastal province that has a low population, is seeking to develop creative ways to retain the young people who are educated here.  Viability in our era of rapid technical change necessitates creative approaches to problem solving.  This residency, established in the small Annapolis Valley town of Hantsport, will help facilitate the long term development of an Arts Hub for this region with its long term goal including an outdoor sculpture park. By helping to ensure the continued practices of the artists who participate, the residency will contribute to the creative economy in Nova Scotia and Canada.

Future plans for the property include development of 1 acre of land adjacent to the
studio into a sculpture garden with curated installation of large scale outdoor sculptures.  These and other initiatives being considered will over time create a destination for those looking for art and cultural experiences. 

Thus, the economic spin-offs of this residency will be many-fold:

FOR THE TOWN OF HANTSPORT AND SURROUNDING AREAS

We have recently lost two of our 4 main industries.  The proposed residency will, over time, contribute to the establishment of a vibrant hub that will function as an economic engine and attract new residents and visitors to the Hantsport area which is also home to Blue Beach and its associated Fossil Museum containing the 350 million year old fossils found there.

FOR NOVA SCOTIA

Support for the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design University through providing another option for graduates to make a successful move from student to professional artist.

The residency by introducing its participants to the area will encourage them to establish studios in Nova Scotia's lovely Annapolis Valley region.

The economic spin-offs in an area generated by active professional (visual) artists are many-fold.  They include all of the economic benefits derived from a resident;  e.g., purchase of living space, food, transportation and other personal needs, plus studio space, staff (many artists require assistants), studio equipment and supplies, and indirectly the employment of gallery and retail workers who support and supply the artist, as well as many other business activities in the community. Art is a necessary component of a good place to live.

It is a loss to everyone when newly graduated artists don’t find the support to go
on and establish their careers.

story:
Maciej and Lukas Serwa - we are cousins and we love METAL MUSIC !!!

Lukas - artis sculptor - his hands are worth a lot!!! He creates these little pieces of art

Maciej - brain - 3D printing, marketing spec ;) runs crowdfunding campaign

We are huge Metallica fans but in Poland Lukas i s one of the GREATEST.

Lukas' flag is in Metallica HQ since 10 years. You can see it on Videos and photos - usually it's behind Kirk !! ;)

4 Years ago Lukas sent his first Metallica figurines to Metallica HQ, at the reguest of James.

But there were just toys.

!!! Now we are making new better versions !!!

And this time we want to make it REALLY HUGE.

We want to thank Metallica for new album.

We want to print really HUGE STATUES in 3D technology.

No artist has EVER received such a gift from his fans.

Together we will create the largest fans campaign on EARTH.

 

 

 

3D printing of BIG elements is really expensive. We need money. Huge James Statue cost 6000 USD but when we staterd counting and adding taxes, and fees and perks, marketing costs, transport to USA (we don't want to make problem on tour in Europe).... all these little expenses soon added up to a total of 21500 USD.

In return, we offer you unique perks.

Something what many Metal fans desire and what ALL metalheads should have.

                                                                                                                                                     

 

FAN, TRUE FAN, METALL FAN

- Entry in the BOOK which Metallica receive with their statues ( I believe that we will make it all 4 STATUES!! )

Who will be first -> will be on first pages. We are sure that Metallica will recognize many photos of their greatest FANS !! *

TEMIDA FOR ALL

- Our Lady ;) I know that you recognize her !!

METALL NEVER DIES

- Devil horns hand - that is also a guitar pick prezenter !!! I know that thousand of fans have unique guitar picks from live shows. Now You can prezent it in front of your CD collection!!

 

 

 GRAY MYSTERY BOX

- Surprise for our friends and fans ;) inside You will find 5 little gray gifts.

 COLOUR MYSTERY BOX

- Better surprice for our friends and fans. 5 little colored gifts inside.

 

3D PRINT & BIG 3D PRINT

- We will print what you want ;) Our 3D printer will work for you for 24 hours (or more if necessary to finish project ;) ). You can send us your 3D file or choose something from our stuff ;) 3D print will be painted on gray or painted with special undercoat paintif if you want to paint it yourselfe.

 

MEGA METALL FAN

- You can have a half of one of the first pages in our BOOK - This Metallica will read for sure !!! *

 

ZOMBIE HAND SPONSOR

/

 TEMIDA HEAD SPONSOR

You can have right or left side of our boxes. This is perk suitable in particular for companies but not only. Who first will chooses this perk will have priority to choose side of a box.

Advertisement stays in all Temida or Devil Horns Hand boxes in this campaign. *

 

TOP SPONSOR

- Your logo or picture and name can be fixed forever to the spot under STATUE !!! 15x10cm (5,9 x 3,9 inch) We will add more of these perks after reaching stretch goals !! *

MAIN METALL SPONSOR

-  Your Logo or picture and name can be fixed forever to the center place of the spot under STATUE !!! 30x20cm (11,8 x 7,8 inch) We will add more of these perks after reaching stretch goals !! *

 

METALL FIGURINE

- Luke will devote for you 200 hours to you and will sculpture a figurine. It can be a figurine of you your friend or a Rock Star !!! James ;) or maybe Cliff !!!

This perk includes up to 3 sketches and 3 consults - after that you should trust his art senses;)

Figurine is mage with Super Sculpey clay

 

YOUR OWN STATUE !!! 

YES, you can have YOUR OWN Statue !!! This perk includes Metall Figurine and Huge 3D printed statue + delivery to any place in the WORLD!!!

-------------------------------------------------------------------

IF METALLICA AGREES, EVEN TO LIMITED EDITION OF LITTLE FIGURINES EVERYONE WHO SUPPORTED our campaign will know first - before the rest of the world.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If You love Metallica and you want to support our idea, but don't have the financial resources - I understand Christmas is coming;)

BUT you can always help !!!

Share this news !!! Greatest fans action in the world !!!

Please share on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter

 

-- OUR COSTS --


Metallica is not only JAMES !!

We have to create statues of all members !!!

 

THANK YOU !!!

ANTYRADIO & ANTYRADIO.PL - Thank You for Support and opportunity to be in THE BIGGEST ROCK MEDIA in POLAND !!! Thank You Aleksander Ostrowski, Krzysztof Skiba, Jakub Gańko, Aleksandra Degórska, Justyna Kierzkowska, Robert Skowroński and all Antyradio.pl & Antyradio teams !!!

MENTALWAY - Michał Wawrzyniak and each of the Dream Team !!! Thank you for washing my brain !! : D without the knowledge and support we would be nowhere now ...;) !!!

COACH MIKE RULED !!!!

Jakub Wołyśnki and his brother Janek Wołyśnki thank yo for Your patience during recording and making great movies !!!

Michał Szmuda and his graphic Karol :) thank you for help with this great graphics !!!

3D TEAM for good job with careful scanning our pieces of art !!!

 

Risks & Challenges

We choose flexible founding and if we will not reach our target ... we are VERY creative people ;) for sure we will deliver ALL perks !! we will work 10 times harder ... it will take few months more but we have  to do this - because there are some perks that can't exist without James Statue !!!

 

We are not kidding - look what we have already achieved

* (texts. logos and photos will be subject to verification - we do not want to print anything insulting, BOOK, LOGOS on Spots .. evertyhing goes to Metallica)

Figurine is mage with Super Sculpey clay

 

YOUR OWN STATUE !!! 
YES, you can have YOUR OWN Statue !!! This perk includes Metall Figurine and Huge 3D printed statue + delivery to any place in the WORLD!!!

-------------------------------------------------------------------
IF METALLICA AGREES, EVEN TO LIMITED EDITION OF LITTLE FIGURINES EVERYONE WHO SUPPORTED our campaign will know first - before the rest of the world.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If You love Metallica and you want to support our idea, but don't have the financial resources - I understand Christmas is coming;)
BUT you can always help !!!
Share this news !!! Greatest fans action in the world !!!
Please share on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter
 
-- OUR COSTS --


Metallica is not only JAMES !!
We have to create statues of all members !!!
 
THANK YOU !!!

ANTYRADIO & ANTYRADIO.PL - Thank You for Support and opportunity to be in THE BIGGEST ROCK MEDIA in POLAND !!! Thank You Aleksander Ostrowski, Krzysztof Skiba, Jakub Gańko, Aleksandra Degórska, Justyna Kierzkowska, Robert Skowroński and all Antyradio.pl & Antyradio teams !!!

MENTALWAY - Michał Wawrzyniak and each of the Dream Team !!! Thank you for washing my brain !! : D without the knowledge and support we would be nowhere now ...;) !!!
COACH MIKE RULED !!!!

Jakub Wołyśnki and his brother Janek Wołyśnki thank yo for Your patience during recording and making great movies !!!
Michał Szmuda and his graphic Karol :) thank you for help with this great graphics !!!

3D TEAM for good job with careful scanning our pieces of art !!!
 
Risks & Challenges
We choose flexible founding and if we will not reach our target ... we are VERY creative people ;) for sure we will deliver ALL perks !! we will work 10 times harder ... it will take few months more but we have  to do this - because there are some perks that can't exist without James Statue !!!
 
We are not kidding - look what we have already achieved






* (texts. logos and photos will be subject to verification - we do not want to print anything insulting, BOOK, LOGOS on Spots .. evertyhing goes to Metallica)

story:
Our Story

Hola! I'm Isela, owner and creator Sac Dance Lab. Since January 2017, our studio has provided hundreds of commercial-style dance classes for dancers from around the world. We cater to college students, industry professionals and folks who just love to dance! Our instructors include NBA, NFL, collegiate and agency-represented professionals passionate about the art of dance. We're on a mission to catalyze Sacramento's dance industry by offering affordable training, advocacy and paid performance work for current and aspiring pro-dancers - while providing an encouraging place to learn for recreational dancers. We are excited to announce that we're moving to a beautiful new space to better accommodate our growth!

With the support of the local dance community, the studio has quickly become a hub for pro-dance training and introductory training for adults of all ages. We're proud to say that in our second year we grew sales by 80% and we hosted over 600 classes attended by over 1000 people. We welcomed several community groups to use our space, and donated performances to more than 30 non-profit organizations and community events. Today, we offer 15 public classes weekly. We are humbled by Sac Dance Lab's growth so far and couldn't have done this without every dancer that has ever set foot in our space. Thank you.

Though Sac Dance Lab is off to a wonderful start, the upfront costs of moving and building a new dance studio have been considerable, and easily one of our largest expenses to date. In order to keep our classes affordable and our space accessible, we are asking for $5,000 in contributions from the community.

What We Need & What You Get

Our new space will feature twice the dance floor space, stretch area, reception, beautiful window wall, plenty of well-lit parking and a creative atmosphere! To complete our mission and make the dance studio of our dreams, we need to raise $5,000. Funds will be used toward studio build-out, including:

1.  Sprung Marley flooring. Our current floor is expandable, so we'll be adding to it

2. 40 feet of glassless mirrors, 8 feet high. Super safe and lightweight

3. 10-foot portable barres (3-4)

Your contribution would help ensure our affordable class price of $10 stays at our new location. 

Contributions over $25 offers a Sac Dance Lab reusable bottle. In our new space, we plan to operate with the goal of eliminating all single-use materials from our space. 

Every campaign contribution of over $50 offers the following perks:

Silver:  $50-$99--receive 10% off coupon for all class packages for one year.

Gold: $100-$499--receive 20% off coupon for all class packages for one year.

Platinum: $500 -- $999--receive 25% off coupon for all class packages for one year.

Diamond: $1,000+ -- receive 50% off coupon for all class packages for one year.

Contributions of any amount under $25 for the amount of your choosing, is also acceptable.

The Impact

The early years of Sac Dance Lab are critical. Though we have worked on ways to reduce expenses and grow sales, we want to be in position to continue to offer affordable training, while fairly compensating our valuable instructors.

Your contribution is an investment in local art. By providing access to training and hosting local performing artists, our community is more likely to sustain and flourish. We believe the vision of a live, cultured and art-filled city is shared by Sacramentans and beyond.

We see this as an opportunity for you to support this community in a way that is meaningful to you. Right now, there is no more effective way for you to be part of Sac Dance Lab's growth, future, and legacy.  

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in expanding, especially for a small business like a dance studio. But, in our last two years, we have demonstrated what we can offer this community and how committed we are to making a positive impact.

We understand that we've set a big goal, but we believe we will reach it. Regardless of how much we raise through this Indiegogo campaign, you can feel confident that 100% of your contribution will go toward our studio build-out.  No dollar is wasted. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can donate financially and we totally understand that. There are a few ways you can still support our goal:

  • Spread the word about our studio. It means so much to us when you bring new friends to build our community. Word of mouth is a great way for Sac Dance Lab to serve more people.
  • Consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign on social, with your co-workers, with your family, and any other way you can think of.

We have 30 Days to raise $5,000! Our campaign will begin on Feb 14 and end on March 14.

If you are unfamiliar with Sac Lab Dance, or would just like to know more,  check out our classes and performances on our YouTube Channel, our Instagram page or at SacDanceLab.com.

story:
video was made possible by Roberto Gomez

The Place

"Queerness," as described in American/European contexts, is not new to the Zapotec Culture located in the Isthmus of Oaxaca, Mexico. Like most pre-colonial Native American cultures it has special (significant) spaces for people of fluid sexuality and gender. These people are called Muxes (pronounced Moo-shay) and are considered the third gender in Zapotec culture; they are biologically born as males, but exhibit aspects of woman-ness later in life. They can often be seen as mediators between both sexes. They are the in-betweens and are respected for their versatile roles. Some of the Muxes I have encountered dress flamboyantly while others dress more like traditional women. They usually contribute to domestic and care taking realms, but can also have multiple roles in teaching, local government, etc.. They have a reputation for carrying artistic talent especially when it comes to working in textiles and embroidery. In late November of every year, their heterosexual counterparts in collaboration with the local Catholic church in the city of Juchitan de Zaragoza, give the Muxes a procession in their honor as a thank you for their participation in society.




                     (I do not own above images. They are being used with permission.)



What we're doing:

 I, Alex Hernandez, was invited by a community leader to take part in the procession in the city of Juchitan. Since I didn't have a Quinceanera,I see this as my right of passage in growth as an individual and in my search for a Utopia for persons with similar identity characteristics.


Neil Rivas is an artist/photographer (and dear friend of mine), that will accompany me on this journey. In the process, he will capture these experiences through photography and video which will later be used for multiple projects that we hope to exhibit at later dates.


Also during my stay, I am going to do on-site research: pursuing further dialogue with the community, and exploration regarding the Muxes’ views on their social role, their craft aesthetics, and to learn more textile techniques. These techniques are going to be passed down in my MFA thesis.


What the Money will be used for...reimbursement for the following costs:

Round trip flights from Los Angeles to Oaxaca city: $830
Transportaion to and from San Francisco and Los Angeles: $250 
Transportation to and from Oaxacaty city to Juchitan (6 hr bus ride): $80
Room and Board in Oaxaca City and Juchitan: $150
Food,taxi fare, gathered materials and samples in both cities: $400
Other miscellaneous costs (including necessary photo equipment): $400

What You Get:

Any amount of money is greatly appreciated. But for some encouragement, here are some perks:

Anyone contributing $25.00 or more gets the the Craftbook in PDF format for your computer. Released in the Spring 2012


For anyone contributing $50.00, you get the craftbook in PDF format plus a Klaus Nomi patch embroidered by yours truly, Alex.


For anyone contributing $150.00 you get an 8x10inch photograph of the event plus previous items.


Sample Pic taken by me. Photograph print that donator will get will be of image taken Neil Rivas during the trip.


For anyone contributing $300.00 or more you get everything mentioned above, plus, I will create a digitally embroidered image for you.


Sample..self portrait on Denim


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, tell your friends and your friend's friends. PLEASE

story:
Cantos is a multi-genre project that includes poetry, narrative, visual art and original music. Cantos is loosely based on Dante's Purgatorio, with heavy influences from Alice Notley's Descent of Allette and Eileen Miles's work. It is the first of several decade-long projects by Ana-Maurine Lara. We are in the last 8 months of the decade!!

Your donation will provide completion funds for this project.  Money will go directly to collaborating artists to enable the purchase of materials and as a gesture towards their time. Money will also go towards off-setting the costs of scroll materials, and to commission hand-made boxes.

Cantos consists of the following components: 

LITERARY: 7 poems written in forms based off of the rhythms of specific surah from the Q'ran. Each poem has been "translated" into an 8-tone musical scale; 1 labyrinthine prose narrative which has "4 circles" leading into/out of a "center". **Mirroring the intentional references to both Judeo-Islamic traditions, the literary elements will all be handwritten onto scrolls. There will be a limited production of 36 scrolls. 

MUSICAL: An original musical score based on the 7 poems, which will also result in a recorded instrumental album in the format of the musicians' choice. Each edition of Cantos will include the accompany music. Martín Perna is the lead musician for Cantos. 

VISUAL: Four drawings or prints to accompany the literary element. These visual elements represent the pillars/steps/breaths between the circles of the labyrinth. The visual pieces are part of the work, the limited edition of 36, and will be included. Youmna Chlala is the visual artist for Cantos.

Each edition of Cantos will come in an individual, original hand-made box.

There will be a release party in New York City in January 2015 to celebrate the decade-long journey of artist Ana-Maurine Lara, the individual and incredible work of all collaborating artists and the completion of Cantos.  

Parts of Cantos were developed in Phyllis Levine and Sharon Dolin's workshop on Dante in 2005, during the Atlantic Center for the Arts Residency program in 2007, and in the Cave Canem Poetry Residencies in 2008 and 2012. Dozens of hearts have helped to bring Cantos to life. Thanks to all of the poets for their brilliant, loving and sharp feedback, and to Giacomo Castagnola and John Salvage for working through the musical components with me.

And THANK YOU to YOU for helping Cantos come to completion!!

Any and all help is appreciated. Please give a $1, or give $1000. Help spread the word, and get others involved. Become part of the book, Cantos. 


Why Cantos needs to live in the world:

  • Because it reflects a profound, collaborative and long artistic process.
  • Because it speaks to what it means to confront "freedom" and "sin" in a post-9/11 NY.
  • Because it brings a range of literary traditions together.
  • Because it incorporates poetry, prose, math, music, photography, drawing and print-making.
  • Because it is beautiful.


About the Lead Artists:

Ana-Maurine Lara

Ana-Maurine Lara is a national award-winning novelist, poet and playwright. Her publications include Erzulie's Skirt (RedBone Press 2006), When the Sun Once Again Sang to the People (KRK Ediciones 2011), Watermarks and Tree Rings (Tanama Press, 2011) alongside numerous short stories and poems in anthologies and literary magazines from both the U.S. and UK. She was awarded the PEN/Northwest, the National Latina/Chicano Literary Award and the Barbara Deming Award for poetry, as well as being named a Lamdba Literary Finalist. Ana-Maurine is a Cave Canem Fellow, and was a participating member of the Austin Project, under the direction of Sharon Bridgforth and Joni L. Jones/Omi Osun. As a scholar, Ana-Maurine has published scholarly essays on topics engaging Afro-Latin@ and Afro-Diasporic queer identities and aesthetics in anthologies and journals. She is currently Founding Director of Source Writing & Editing Services and will be receiving her PhD in African American Studies, Anthropology & Women, Gender and Sexuality Studies at Yale University in May 2014. Cantos is the first of three decade long projects.

Youmna Chlala

Youmna Chlala is the lead visual artist for Cantos. She is an artist and writer born in Beirut and based in New York. Her work investigates the relationship between fate and architecture through drawing, video and performance, prose and poetry. She has exhibited widely including the ICA in London, Rotterdam International Film Festival, Camera Austria, CultuurCentrum Bruges and Art in General in New York. She was commissioned for Dubai Art Projects (2014) and is an Open Sessions artist at the Drawing Center in New York (2014-16). Shehas participated in the Performa Biennial 11, Jerusalem Show IV and the first roaming Tehran Biennale. Chlala has been awarded residencies and fellowships from the LMCC Process Space, Henie Onstad Art Centre in Norway, Headlands Center for the Arts, CMAC: Center for Art and Technology, Triangle Arts Fund Jordan & Lebanon, European Cultural Foundation and Goethe-Institut. Her writing apears in Urban Hopes by Steven Holl and in publications such as Guernica, Bespoke, CURA, MIT Journal for Middle Eastern Studies, and XCP: Journal of Cross Cultural Poetics. She is currently an Associate Professor in the Humanities and Media Studies Department at the Pratt Institute where she co-coordinates the Language-Making program in the Architecture Department. To see more of Youmna’s art, visit yc7.tumblr.com.

Martín Perna

Martín Perna is the lead musician for Cantos. He is a musician and multidisciplinary artist and educator. He is a founding member of Sharon Jones and the Dap Kings, and founder/musical director of the groups Antibalas and Ocote Soul Sounds. Since 1995, he has performed over 1600 concerts in over 40 countries on five continents. As a session musician, he has performed and recorded with artists including David Byrne, TV on the Radio, The Roots, Elvis Costello, Public Enemy, and Burning Spear. To hear Martín’s music, visit Antibalas.com and Ocotesoul.com.


Visit the websites for the Cantos Affiliated Artists:

John C. Savage

Wura-Natasha Ogunji


Here's where your money would go:

Lead Artists: $1500.00 each for materials and/or services (total, $4,500.00)

Affiliated Artist Honorarium: $500.00

To commission 36 hand made boxes: $1000.00

Travel for two lead artists ($600.00)

Indiegogo fees, and perks ($600.00, less if the full amount is raised!!)

TOTAL: $7,200.00

story:
About me

My name is Nichole Montanez. My niece is 8 years old and has Dravet Syndrome (severe myoclonic epilepsy of infancy). Our family is on a journey to improve her quality of life by using medical cannabis. I first learned about using cannabis to treat seizures from Paige Figi. Paige is the mother of little girl named Charlotte who also has Dravet Syndrome. We first met 3 years ago when my niece, Teapot, was in a medically induced coma to stop her seizures. The Figis raised money to get Teapot the medication she needed and continued to fund it for the following year. We have remained friends since that time. 

When Charlotte began using CBD to treat her seizures, I was able to see, firsthand, the remarkable change in her. She went from having 200-300 seizures per week to one or two per month. She was eating, walking and beginning to talk. We wanted, for Teapot, what Charlotte had -- a new life. 

I began to attend support groups with a few parents who had started on this new medicine. I went for two reasons -- to learn more and to help with daycare. Not long after my first meeting I started a project to raise awareness. The idea was simply to take a portrait of each child and put the faces together in one installation. 

I have taken 77 portraits of children in Colorado with epilepsy, cancer and autism. That number is growing weekly and now I would like to expand the project into other states where children need medicine. 

What I Need 

Your donation will go toward travel expenses and photo equipment, as needed. Currently there are 17 states with pending legislation and hundreds of kids waiting. I want to travel to every state, photograph every child and tell every story. 

The Impact

Raising awareness and putting a face on the need for a better medicine is changing laws and lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit faceofcannabis.wordpress.com to see profiles of each of the Faces of Cannabis. You can also like us on Facebook and share their stories.
