story:
An Epic Series of 54 Oil Paintings Inspired by the Weekly Readings from the Hebrew Bible

 

The Series is Complete…

It took 3 years.  I journeyed and worked on them from the jungles of Costa Rica to Israel's Holy Land, back to my birth place in Montana, then to Shelter Island in New York. And now, I’m back west again, in Idaho on the Nez Perce Reservation, where I’m framing and putting the finishing touches on the series. 

It’s Been Selected for Museum Placement…

I’m ready for this work to be seen.  Last year, while I was living in New York I submitted it to the nation’s only public relations firm that deals exclusively with artists.  It’s a prestigious and credible company and their selection process is very competitive.  They only take on artists whose work they know they can place. A signed 18 month contract with them guarantees me at least 2 one-man museum shows.  The good news is - I’m in; I’ve been selected for their museum placement program. A public relations campaign with this company will help bring these paintings to the wider masses. The services are all fee based, and I need your help to establish my PR campaign with them. 

 

My Story:

I’ve painted full time for over 30 years - coming time and again to a familiar cross road.  I’ve had my share of success, raised 6 children doing only this, but there have also been some lean times along the way. For the duration of my career my paintings have shown in galleries throughout the US that carry mainly impressionistic representational landscape and genre work typified by Southwest Art Magazine. The thing is, I am experimental in my approach to painting and I’m drawn to diverse subject matter.  The spiritual work is a passion for me and though it’s not the only thing I paint, I foresee it being a focus for many years to come. My old galleries are just not a good fit anymore so I am so thankful to have this opportunity to promote what I’m painting now.

 

My Project:

An 18 month public relations contract to promote the “Torah Series”

Included in the contract is all the specialized research to place my work; implementation and follow-up with no less than 300 museum contacts and also surrounding art centers, better college and university galleries, alternative and corporate spaces, and commercial galleries nationwide; writing services by known art critics; preparation and mailing of quality color catalogues, promotional packets, press releases, etc. and my inclusion on the company’s web site.

54 Postmodern Paintings, arranged in six installations, approx. 6 by 6 feet, each containing nine 2 by 2 feet canvases based on the weekly readings from the Hebrew Bible 

The stories are universal and contain truths and ethics for all people. Through painting the stories I've come to know things I didn’t before.  I think these paintings reveal different things to different people and deliver new truths continually because there is something of the Eternal that resides in them.

To get beyond estabished ideas about the stories I re-imaged them in a way that couldn't be taken in at a single glance. I wanted to create a mix of literature, psychic shock, and unconscious visual aesthetics to arrive at a new state of pictorial reasoning. The images need to be absorbed piece by piece, to overwhelm what's already known, allowing a new rhythm to run through every part to result in the miracle - an overall sense unity inviting something not previously known.

I started with random washes of neutral colors and next with a drawing, something tangible, then the idea was to start intuiting, to become childlike enough to trust the process, to get out of the way. Eventually there came a point of sacrificing the drawing; shapes and colors become the order in interest of the whole. The departure from a literal interpretation or illustration leaves room for the Ruach (or Spirit) to engage the viewer from within rather than me imposing something from without.

To me the paintings are like stained glass windows or post-modern icons, representative of the stories.  In the same way that the title of each passage evokes the essence of the entire reading for sages and scholars, I become re-immersed in a dialogue with the respective passage when I engage the individual paintings .  

In my wife's words, "These paintings sprang from the ritual of creation, each burst of inspiration had a sense of the sacred.  Relating intimately with sacred texts, re-imaging old stories, interacting with ancient spiritual truths in the context of creative innovation became new rituals altogether".

 

My Team:

These guys are a constant support and inspiration to me, they've stood with me through the thick and thin of many adventures.

Left to Right: Daughter - Tali, Baker Extrodiare; Son - Francis (Switz Jr), Oil Painter in his own right; Son - Malachi, Beats 2nd to none; Son- Rob, Switzervideos, many hours, many thanks; My wife Shelley - her adaptations of the Torah readings accompany the paintings and are included in some of the perks we are offering (see below); Son - Scott Jr, Commercial Fisherman, Builder, all around Vagabond; and Son - Cody, Jedi Master in disguise and Director of Youth on Record Alaska.  Not Pictured: Cody’s wife Brittani or his kids Harmony, Justice, and Talon and our other Brittani, Rob’s new bride.  (We’re doing pretty good getting this many of us in one picture but we'll keep trying and maybe update later.)

Nuanced Connections and Ongoing Goodness

Chief Don Miguel and the Wimea people of Costa Rica welcomed me to their land to work when I first started this series so I gave them the studies for the first installation.  A year later, to honor the decendents of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob for preserving and keeping the Torah, I presented the first nine paintings completed from those studies to The Jerusalem Great Synagogue in Israel where they now hang in the hallway to the Rabbi's study.  On my way back to the U.S., I stopped in Vilnius, Lithuania to check out the newly opened Vilnius Jewish Library and gave them a hand-embellished giclee of that first installation. In my mind those were all kind of first fruits of the series. I like to think there is now an unexplainable shared goodness between all these people because of their welcome and reception of this work; and I invite you to be a part of it too.

Where does the Money Go?

I need at least $12,000 to get my public relations campaign started.  You can see by the breakdown of expenses below that I will definitely appreciate and be able to apply any funds that go over my goal.  I need to raise:

$3000 - for 500 tri-fold color CD mailers right away

$9000 - for a contract term of 18 months (6000 to be paid at signing, 3000 by 120 days later) 

Traveling expenses either for me to return to New York to meet with the art critic who will be writing the essay about my work or to bring him to my studio Idaho.

As exhibitions are secured I will need additional placement fees per size and importance of each venue.  My contract guarantees me a minimum of two one-person venue placements and more with no limits to the number except as specified by me.

  • Level 1 - $900 to $2100
  • Level 2 - $2100 to $3600
  • Level 3 - $3600 to $5400
  • Elite - $5500 to $10,000

About  15 to 20% will go towards preparing and shipping rewards.  And another 4 to 9% for Indiegogo fees. 

My Thanks for your Help:   

 

 
 
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help me with my campaign.  Please Spread the Word!

Email your friends and family, put a link to my project on your blog, website, or whatever else you can imagine!  I’m thankful for every bit of help I can get!

"Just as people cannot survive without other people, colors can't survive without engaging other colors, shapes must have fellowship with other shapes, and so on with line and texture. In all great paintings the 'characters' must have faith and be willing to risk. A color becomes vulnerable and bares its soul while another stands quiet and listens. A shape may have to confront her mate, creating a storm, which eventually turns into a poem. Light and dark, joy and pain, all are being engaged in an on-going drama. Whether the stage is a song or a painting, the primary catalyst is relationship."    ~ Scott Switzer ~

story:
*** ATTENTION ATTENTION ***

15NOV: The calendar is produced and of course you can still order directly with me - allthough this campaign is over. Just drop me an email: nina@ninazimmermann.com

Thank you. Nina

 

What's this about?

I work freelanced since three years. Last year I decided that I want to do one personal work at the end of every year. To wrap it up with something nice. Non profit, to share with those who enjoy looking at nice things. So what's better than putting all this into an advent calendar.

Last year's work AC11 focused on food and drew a portrait of a complete three course christmas meal including drinks.

Originally produced for the website it was selected to be shown during the Browse Photo Festival 2012 and exhibited from 1st of june till the 30th of august.

The photos were printed on a Fine Art Pearl Paper, 15x22cm, framed by a beautiful Ragtime museum passepartout and handmade wood frames from the black forrest. Limited to an edition of 5.

You can view the work here: www.ninazimmermann.com/archives/category/advent-calendar

 

And now?

This year's calendar will cover a complete different topic.

Of course I cannot tell you what, since the joy of an advent calendar is the surprise effect, but the outcome will be a piece of art you can order for your home.

Yes, you heard right!!! This year you can order the AC12 from 1st November on as an actual advent calendar for your home. Shipping will begin 19th of November so your calendar will be safe and sound with you at the 1st of December.

The first edition will be limited to 30 signed copies and can be only bought by claiming the "AC12. Signed." perk -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------> or the "AC12 deluxe kit."

Additional 50 unsigned copies will be printed and shall not sell for more than 35 EUR.

As always, I work with quality materials only. I guarantee you a limited, valuable, fun and interactive, long lasting piece of handmade artwork.

 

And here comes my problem:

Printing and material costs are covered.

But paying fees to crew, for rental equipment and location sums up to 1000 EUR.

Yes, I know - crazy. I tried to work around this, but without this extra grand I will not be able to produce in proper quality. And if I cannot produce in proper quality I don't produce. That's what I stand for.

 

I am asking you to help me raise these 1000 EUR so I can produce this lovely advent calendar 2012.

You can also help by spreading the word. Tell your friends, share the link, shout it out at your five o'clock tea party, midnight soup-date, early morning bus ride or even on facebook, g+ and twitter.

 

Website: www.ninazimmermann.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/pages/Nina-Zimmermann-Photography/156909134346033

story:
My name is Salvadora McCaffrey and I am a senior set design major at a performing arts high school. For my project, I will be building a factory farm set using the elements of set, lighting, prop, and sound design to create an experiential set so the audience can travel through and understand the existence the animals in this farm must endure. A couple months ago, I received a couple grants and support to go forward with this project. With your help I can afford the rest of this project. Because of the unethical practice of industrial farming, I became a vegetarian and I started becoming interested in food justice. Factory farming is an agricultural practice that adversely affects our environment, personal health, the welfare of animals, and our local economy. If we can reduce factory farming and increase the local farming where we live, then we in turn can experience a wonderful range of benefits from better health to a richer local economy. My contributors will be helping me in affording to buy the necessary materials for construction and print production.

As a set design student who is actively involved in theatre design and construction, I have the experience necessary for an intricate set like this. Funding will be going towards lumber, paint, screws, fencing, feathers, and nails. All of these materials are essential for my set and trust me, lumber really adds up! Even if I don't reach my goal, any donations do make an impact towards the success of completing my project.

Factory farming affects us from a local to global scale. Through my project, I promote the reduction of industrial farming and an increase of local farming. Your funding allows me to send this message to people and hopefully continue doing projects like this. With the success of this project, I will go on to create a blog and an emailing list to grow people's involvement. We can all reap the benefits of a better food industry.

If you can't donate, you can still help! Feel free to share this project and pass it along via email, facebook, and other social networking sites.
story_txt:
My name is Salvadora McCaffrey and I am a senior set design major at a performing arts high school. For my project, I will be building a factory farm set using the elements of set, lighting, prop, and sound design to create an experiential set so the audience can travel through and understand the existence the animals in this farm must endure. A couple months ago, I received a couple grants and support to go forward with this project. With your help I can afford the rest of this project. Because of the unethical practice of industrial farming, I became a vegetarian and I started becoming interested in food justice. Factory farming is an agricultural practice that adversely affects our environment, personal health, the welfare of animals, and our local economy. If we can reduce factory farming and increase the local farming where we live, then we in turn can experience a wonderful range of benefits from better health to a richer local economy. As a set design student who is actively involved in theatre design and construction, I have the experience necessary for an intricate set like this. Funding will be going towards lumber, paint, screws, fencing, feathers, and nails. All of these materials are essential for my set and trust me, lumber really adds up! Factory farming affects us from a local to global scale. Through my project, I promote the reduction of industrial farming and an increase of local farming. story:
Art Sets the Table is a multifaceted, art advocacy project that supports an

inclusive dialogue with all members of our community and creates awareness of

the struggles, strength and beauty within individuals experiencing homelessness,

hunger and poverty within Maine. It also invites all Mainers to come and share

their intention towards building a stronger community at the interactive art event.

 

We are asking for your support in funding for this project. Such as the materials used in the various elements: art supplies at the workshops, materials used in building the table and the loom as well as displaying the plates. Many hours, hands and minds came together to make this project a reality, we all would appreciate your support in helping to fund this project.  

 

Thank you!  Nancy and Hilary

 
 

For more information and to help spread the word, please visit Art Sets the Table

on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/ArtSetsTheTable

story:
Little Myrtle is our first children's book!

I've always wanted to illustrate a children's book...He always wanted to become a published children's book author.  Little Myrtle is a dream come true for both of us.
 
We love Myrtle! She is love and she's full of the beauty of life!  And, to our team, she's like family.  The book was certainly a family effort.  Paul Trefz is the author of the children's poem which I interpreted into collage based on the drawings of Paul's young daughter.  The children featured in the song are our children and god children.  Over the past year, we have worked on the illustrations, design and layout of the book. 

An amazingly positive response from the public!

We had a short run of the book printed this Spring and quickly sold them all!  In the process, we were able to get the feedback of more than 500 individuals in Philadelphia...And they loved Myrtle as much as we do!  We found that the book made people smile and even chuckle out loud; children were anxious to get their hands on it. 
 
Adults wanted to talk about the moral of the story or they were inspired to tell us about their own dreams of creating  a children's book.  Most surprising was that people we met while vending were so grateful for our presence. We realized that beyond creating literature we were creating public spaces for sharing stories around the value of dreams, family and self determination.  Myrtle had become a public performance!
 
We collected signatures from people who read or bought the book.  We wondered: how could we make Little Myrtle More than a local phenomenon?  And just how many signatures could we collect in six months?  A million? That's a stretch...but it's fun to dream big isn't it? That's what the Myrtle's Millions tour is about.

Please support our book project!

Your contributions will get us started in really distributing the book to the public.  We will be able to pay for a larger printing. Contributions will also pay for promotional materials and transportation.  We will be able to travel with our family to create spaces where children and children's literature are loved.

By contributing to our campaign you get to become a part of Myrtle's story and a part our family's experiment in social entrepreneurship. 

Support for Little Myrtle is support for children's literature, independent publishing and distribution...it is support for one family's dream.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you don't have children in your immediate family, books are a great gift for young friends, cousins, neices, nephews, grandchildren or other loved ones.  Children's books are great gifts for teachers, child care providers, therapists, and others who work with children.  And you know what? Some adults just love children's books.  We do! 

Not everyone can afford to contribute financially...We'd still love you to be a part of the campaign! 

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!  If you know someone who love books, children and art, please let them know what we're doing.  

Contact us if you have a business or non profit that would like to sponsor our project or if you have any other ideas about getting involved with our adventures send us an email and of course send us well wishes!!!!

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support,

Misty Sol

 

 

Links to other Art and Youth projects by Misty Sol and Paul Trefz

http://www.leeway.org/grantee-info.html?action=granteeDetail&GranteeID=831

http://www.leeway.org/grantee-info.html?action=granteeDetail&GranteeID=172

http://www.leeway.org/grantee-info.html?action=granteeDetail&GranteeID=214

Misty Sol and Paul Trefz are recognized for work with homeless youth

http://osaphilly.com/index.php?page=steppys

Misty Sol and Paul Trefz perform a the 2011 Philadelphia International Festival of the Arts:

http://www.kimmelcenter.org/news/index.php?id=253

Misty Sol and Paul Trefz perform music inspired by love of children:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y-B8M6IYBoE

Misty Sol and Davina Stewart perform at the Philadelphia Clef Club accompanied by Paul Trefz on guitar

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xsZxCo5QvCI

 

More visual art and collage by Misty Sol

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y1iCrwLngmc&...

story:
UFOs are something that people have been curious about for thousands of years. There are reported sighting worldwide everyday and it continues to be in our popular culture. There have been countless studies, articles, books and theories written about the subject. 

Whatever your perspective is on UFOs, it’s clearly something people are interested in. 

Our team includes people of sound mind who wanted to go to a UFO museum one day close to home: in Paris, London and Berlin, and who realized that one had to travel thousands of miles to visit such a place. This is how we decided to create a non-profit UFO museum in London.

We already have access to material from a former UFO museum, but to open a new place today that would look modern, one would need much more material and to purchase new equipment. We’ve even found a few perfect locations to rent in London, but there are many other issues to solve first. We need your support to do more research, produce new information boards, manikins, videos, purchase of copyrights of pictures, purchase of screens and computers etc. The plan is to open the place when enough material is available, hopefully within one year. 

We truly believe this is a unique, exciting project that would attract a lot of people and we need your help and support to make this become a reality.

 

The pictures of the perks are also in the Gallery section. 

When ordering, specify which design you want unless you have no preference.

story:
UPDATE 5/7/14:

We have raised $8,888 dollars for our Janky Barge 2.0 Indiegogo Fundraiser!  That's 111% of our original goal,  BUT we aren’t just done yet!  

Thanks to many of your generous contributions we now have some kick-ass high density addressable LEDs!  However, this will require us to bring five times as much wattage out to the Playa (our trusty ol’ Honda generator just won’t cut it). We'll need an additional generator to run in parallel with our existing genny, giving our new sexy lights the clean and full power they need.  We have four days left, we can still use all the help we can get!

Also, as we prepare for the light installation, we figured our contributors would like a lil’ video update on what we have accomplished since reaching our original fundraising goal.  


_________________________________________________________________________

The Little Janky Barge that could... can!  And with your help, we can give our art car the upgrade it deserves after 4 years on the Playa and since its birth in 2009.

What is The Janky Barge?

The Janky Barge was once just your average school bus until a few creative visionaries looked past the flaky paint, and saw into its future as a Burning Man art car.  Over the years, these original members modified and cut the school bus, putting the sweat, blood, and tears to create what The Janky Barge is today. 

Who is The Janky Barge?

Simply put, we are a family of friends that work hard to play hard.

From what was originally a small group of rebel rousers and professional party people, we have grown today to a camp of over 30 people including talented artists, DJs, dancers, producers, builders, and mischief makers. We come from all walks of life but carry one common goal to provide solid sound from our creative DJs and an experience for you to never forget.  From driving with (or aside) us during sunsets and sunrises in Black Rock City to participating in festivals and throwing parties with San Francisco's local favorite promoters, we hope your experience with us was-- and will continue to be-- a great one!

What Do You Want?

 We have plans and a few guys who love to nerd out on lighting, panels and tools. With their help, we’ve come up with a budget to give the Barge the upgrade it deserves. But all our dreams come in the form of wood, solder, fuses, LEDs, and lots of materials with a price.  From the LED strips to the hardware and power supply- fresh paint and newly cut wooden pieces, we will be pouring extra love in this lil ol’ Barge of ours with a new set of lights, paint and more!

The Dusty Details:

For the build... we're going to build a strut channel skeleton on the outside of the bus to serve as a base for a new aluminum outer skin, designed and built as a modular system in preparation for on and off playa repairs.

[Wondering what the hell the above means?] This is a strut channel:


Now, the fun stuff!  We are going to install 100 meters of Light Emitting Diodes, also known as LEDs!  At 60 LEDs/meter, that's 6,000 individually controllable LEDs pulling up to 1800 watts of power, run off teensy microcontrollers linked with XBee wireless modules. This will double the current lighting output of the bus. That’s right, DOUBLE! That means when you're lost in the deep Playa, or running into the hot coals of The Man, our brand spankin' new LED lined shields will help you spot us and direct you to the warm protective Janky embrace.   

LEDs are awesome!

 

Really awesome when trimming our shields, like so:

With YOUR help, we will be able to sail the Playa seas for many more years to come! 

With a dusty salute, Happy Sailing!

Lots of LOVE, HUGS and DUST!

story:
Who Are You?

My name is Ikechukwu Ufomadu. Most call me Ike, and so can you. I'm an actor, comedian and entertainer based in Brooklyn, NY. 

What Are You Doing?

I'm running a fundraising campaign for my next project, "Ike at Night". It's a talk show. It will premiere on Thursday, March 27th, and the whole operation will shut down on Friday, April 5th. We'll be taking that Monday off. This means that - all together - we're looking to produce 9 nights of quality entertainment. Each show will be all new.

And Why?

There are few fields of human endeavor more fascinating than entertainment. Incidentally, there are few fields more entertaining. In the past, I've hosted several Christmas Specials, and produced a few evenings of live comedy. And now, I wanna roll up my sleeves, say a prayer, and see what I can do with the talk show format for 9 nights. For the audience's sake, I hope we knock it out of the park each time. 

How Will You Do It, Ike?

Only with your support. This show will cost roughly $8,000 to produce. This campaign is meant to close the gap between funds we have already and what we'll need to pull the show off. Here's a break-down of those costs:

- Materials: Set & Lights - $1,100

- Materials: Transit - $400

- Materials: Props, Costumes, Equipment for Performers & Musicians - $1,750

- Behind-the-Scenes Crew: Set & Lighting Design, Technical Director, Labor for Load-In & Construction, Stage Management, Camera - $4,180

- Contingency - $500

What Can I Do?

Please donate! Also share the campaign with friends, family, colleagues, and others! I appreciate your support!

story:
Short Summary

Anchor Studios is a new cross discipline artist co-operative in Richmond’s Art District. Located at One East Broad, our goal is to serve as an anchor for the East end of the First Friday Art Walk. We want to connect the public not just to our work but also show them how and why we make. With plans to build a gallery, host resident artists, and offer workshops and educational opportunities, we strive to engage the community and integrate them into our creative process. Anchor’s founding members come from varied backgrounds in painting, photography, filmmaking, tattooing, graphic design, fashion, and fibers. All VCUArts graduates, we are professors, art directors, exhibiting artists, sign painters, public speakers, and curators who are active in the Richmond art community. 

We are seeking out a community of investors to support us as we make this dream a reality. We make art and run this studio because we are passionate about our creative processes and want to share that that passion with the community. Bringing our work to East Broad is giving us better visibility and at the same time contributing to ongoing neighborhood revitalization efforts. Our goal is to not just make our own work, but to offer classes to that will allow us to pass on our skills to others.

Anchor Studios is:

Thomas J Condon

Harrison Möenich

Michael-Birch Pierce

Larry Thacker

Sure Hand Signs (Ross Trimmer)

Mickael Broth

Will Connally

Mary Fleming

Mattie Hinkley

Sibelle Yüksek

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial fundraising efforts will focus on collecting $10,000 to get our projects off the ground. The five founding members of Anchor Studios have already invested a significant amount of money but at the end of the day, we're artists and need to seek support in creative ways! 

A large portion of our budget will be set aside for renovations to our storefront. While the space is beautiful, we are renting it "as is." Our plans call for constructing a window front mini exhibition space to display our work to the public, developing an art library for research, building a dark room for photography and screen printing capability, replacing existing track lighting and floors, and putting a fresh coat of paint on everything. We also need to build a second bathroom in order to meet zoning regulations as we grow. These improvements will allow us to continue to produce high quality work and allow us to focus on helping others do the same. 

It is important to us to give back to our community. Many of our members are art educators and believe strongly in passing on their knowledge and craft to others. Donated funds will be put towards creating workshops, classes, and events that will be open to the public. Each member of the Anchor collective will use their expertise in their field to offer a diverse range of educational opportunities. Classes will cover anything from sewing and embroidery, sign painting, photography, glass work and more. Your support will allow us to build large shared work tables, purchase supplies, award scholarships to underprivileged applicants, advertise, and build our resource library. 

Donating won't only serve our needs! There are plenty of great perks that our artists have to offer our investors. 

Up to $9 : Thanks so much for donating! Every little bit counts!!

$10+ : A framable postcard sized print of one of our artists' work. 

$25+ : One 11"x14" print from your favorite Anchor artist

$40+: Hand screen printed t-shirt featuring the Anchor Studios logo, designed by Anchor artists Larry Thacker and Sure Hand Signs. Plus one postcard print from your favorite artist. 

$50+: One postcard print plus your choice of the following:

An embroidered portrait from Michael-Birch Pierce; A hand lettered show card from Sure Hand Signs; A handworked print from Tom Condon; A sketchbook designed by Larry Thacker; A pair of glass earrings from Sibelle Yüksek

$75+: One 11"x14" print plus your choice of the following:

Anchor t-shirt; 1 of a kind tattoo watercolor from Ross Trimmer, or set of 5 tattoo watercolor prints (11x14) from Ross Trimmer; A flame worked glass necklace Sibelle Yüksek, An embroidered necklace from Michael-Birch Pierce

$100+: One 11"x14" print, T-shirt plus your choice of the following: 

Gift certificate for a future workshop or class; Hand lettered sign (1'x2' max) from Sure Hand Signs; One 20"x30" transparent print from Harrison Möenich;

$250+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, and one item from any of the previous tiers plus:

Your name in our window as a studio investor. 

$500+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, name in our window, class gift certificate, and one item from the $50-75 tiers plus your choice of the following:

A 4-hour embroidered portrait event appearance from Michael-Birch Pierce; A Wooden Light Box (24"x36"x8") from Harrison Möenich, Hand painted sign up to 4'x6' by Sure Hand Signs;

1000+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, name in our window, class gift certificate, and one item from the $50-75 tiers plus your choice of the following:

Storefront makeover from Sure Hand Signs (Within 100 miles of RVA); One hand painted woven film canvas (3'x3') from Harrison Möenich; One embellished blouse or skirt from Michael-Birch Pierce;

More rewards from our other artists will be added as the campaign progresses! Keep coming back!!!


The Impact

Your support will mean so much to us as a community of working artists. This campaign is an effort to build something bigger than ourselves and to become an active, visible force in RVA's arts community. You will be allow us to better ourselves and in turn better the lives of children and developing artists who want to learn here. You will have an impact not just on our studio but on the growing revitalization efforts in Richmond's Arts District. Every successful business on this street helps ring this neighborhood back to its former glory! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute monetarily! Please help us by spreading the word to your friends, coming to our open studios, or volunteering to lend a hand during our renovations! 

Follow us on Twitter: @anchorstudiorva, Instagram: @_anchorstudios 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/anchorstudiosrva

And keep coming back to this page! We'll be updating with more rewards, info about each of our resident artists, and exciting fundraising events! 


THANKS!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Anchor Studios is a new cross discipline artist co-operative in Richmond’s Art District. Located at One East Broad, our goal is to serve as an anchor for the East end of the First Friday Art Walk. We want to connect the public not just to our work but also show them how and why we make. With plans to build a gallery, host resident artists, and offer workshops and educational opportunities, we strive to engage the community and integrate them into our creative process. Anchor’s founding members come from varied backgrounds in painting, photography, filmmaking, tattooing, graphic design, fashion, and fibers. All VCUArts graduates, we are professors, art directors, exhibiting artists, sign painters, public speakers, and curators who are active in the Richmond art community. 
We are seeking out a community of investors to support us as we make this dream a reality. We make art and run this studio because we are passionate about our creative processes and want to share that that passion with the community. Bringing our work to East Broad is giving us better visibility and at the same time contributing to ongoing neighborhood revitalization efforts. Our goal is to not just make our own work, but to offer classes to that will allow us to pass on our skills to others.
Anchor Studios is:
Thomas J Condon
Harrison Möenich
Michael-Birch Pierce
Larry Thacker
Sure Hand Signs (Ross Trimmer)
Mickael Broth
Will Connally
Mary Fleming
Mattie Hinkley
Sibelle Yüksek


What We Need & What You Get
Our initial fundraising efforts will focus on collecting $10,000 to get our projects off the ground. The five founding members of Anchor Studios have already invested a significant amount of money but at the end of the day, we're artists and need to seek support in creative ways! 
A large portion of our budget will be set aside for renovations to our storefront. While the space is beautiful, we are renting it "as is." Our plans call for constructing a window front mini exhibition space to display our work to the public, developing an art library for research, building a dark room for photography and screen printing capability, replacing existing track lighting and floors, and putting a fresh coat of paint on everything. We also need to build a second bathroom in order to meet zoning regulations as we grow. These improvements will allow us to continue to produce high quality work and allow us to focus on helping others do the same. 
It is important to us to give back to our community. Many of our members are art educators and believe strongly in passing on their knowledge and craft to others. Donated funds will be put towards creating workshops, classes, and events that will be open to the public. Each member of the Anchor collective will use their expertise in their field to offer a diverse range of educational opportunities. Classes will cover anything from sewing and embroidery, sign painting, photography, glass work and more. Your support will allow us to build large shared work tables, purchase supplies, award scholarships to underprivileged applicants, advertise, and build our resource library. 
Donating won't only serve our needs! There are plenty of great perks that our artists have to offer our investors. 
Up to $9 : Thanks so much for donating! Every little bit counts!!
$10+ : A framable postcard sized print of one of our artists' work. 
$25+ : One 11"x14" print from your favorite Anchor artist
$40+: Hand screen printed t-shirt featuring the Anchor Studios logo, designed by Anchor artists Larry Thacker and Sure Hand Signs. Plus one postcard print from your favorite artist. 
$50+: One postcard print plus your choice of the following:
An embroidered portrait from Michael-Birch Pierce; A hand lettered show card from Sure Hand Signs; A handworked print from Tom Condon; A sketchbook designed by Larry Thacker; A pair of glass earrings from Sibelle Yüksek
$75+: One 11"x14" print plus your choice of the following:
Anchor t-shirt; 1 of a kind tattoo watercolor from Ross Trimmer, or set of 5 tattoo watercolor prints (11x14) from Ross Trimmer; A flame worked glass necklace Sibelle Yüksek, An embroidered necklace from Michael-Birch Pierce
$100+: One 11"x14" print, T-shirt plus your choice of the following: 
Gift certificate for a future workshop or class; Hand lettered sign (1'x2' max) from Sure Hand Signs; One 20"x30" transparent print from Harrison Möenich;
$250+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, and one item from any of the previous tiers plus:
Your name in our window as a studio investor. 
$500+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, name in our window, class gift certificate, and one item from the $50-75 tiers plus your choice of the following:
A 4-hour embroidered portrait event appearance from Michael-Birch Pierce; A Wooden Light Box (24"x36"x8") from Harrison Möenich, Hand painted sign up to 4'x6' by Sure Hand Signs;
1000+: One 11"x14" print, t-shirt, name in our window, class gift certificate, and one item from the $50-75 tiers plus your choice of the following:
Storefront makeover from Sure Hand Signs (Within 100 miles of RVA); One hand painted woven film canvas (3'x3') from Harrison Möenich; One embellished blouse or skirt from Michael-Birch Pierce;
More rewards from our other artists will be added as the campaign progresses! Keep coming back!!!



The Impact
Your support will mean so much to us as a community of working artists. This campaign is an effort to build something bigger than ourselves and to become an active, visible force in RVA's arts community. You will be allow us to better ourselves and in turn better the lives of children and developing artists who want to learn here. You will have an impact not just on our studio but on the growing revitalization efforts in Richmond's Arts District. Every successful business on this street helps ring this neighborhood back to its former glory! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can contribute monetarily! Please help us by spreading the word to your friends, coming to our open studios, or volunteering to lend a hand during our renovations! 

Follow us on Twitter: @anchorstudiorva, Instagram: @_anchorstudios 
Facebook: www.facebook.com/anchorstudiosrva
And keep coming back to this page! We'll be updating with more rewards, info about each of our resident artists, and exciting fundraising events!

story:
Kristine Woods,  a professional artist based in Brooklyn and a professor at Maryland Institute College of Art (MICA) offered me a position as a studio assistant starting in late June till mid August. She is working on Guests in the Field, an ongoing participatory weaving project that invites artists who have no prior weaving experience to weave on an 8-harness floor loom in the studio. 

I will direct the vast array of digital & manual skills that I developed at MICA towards producing a limited edition of artist's books that introduce her project to the artists. I cannot accept the opportunity until I can afford to live in Brooklyn.  I'm a self­-sufficient student,  I make work and live by any means necessary exhausting whatever resources I posses at a given time in order to survive. This urgency naturally cultivates a more fluid intuition and provides to find reliable solutions to any obstacle. The success of an artist can be is measured by the value of their degrees and working under other artists is a necessary part of a art education.  Thank  you for taking the time to support my campaign!

About Marcel Mandeng 

  • Rising Senior at MICA, major in Interdisciplinary Sculpture with a 3.7 GPA 
  • Recipient of an extensive list of school generated scholarships including the Thalheimer Scholarship and the Don F. Turano '59 Scholarship
  • Weekly art therapy counselor at Powell Recovery Center for Recovering addicts in east Baltimore
  • Lives in a communal gallery/living warehouse space, Annex 2e that is self-­sustained, managed and  by 7 student artists that we built in August 2013
  • Oldest of three  in the Ekobeni family immigrant and political refugee from Cameroon that relocated to the U.S. in 2004

Throughout my academic career at MICA, I have relied on a limited personal budget and my own resourcefulness to sustain the creation of my works. With this insatiable drive to be successful, I push the vocabulary of the materials in my sculptures, performances and prints with precise labor and develop meaning using predominantly provisional means such as repurposing old work or utilizing my bedroom as a studio space. The content of the work often reflects on introspective everyday experiences in order to expand the fierceness of my own personal voice as an individual. 

I Need Your Help

The $1500 I receive from this campaign will cover the high cost of living expenses in Brooklyn which would secure my ability to participate in the internship. Whether or not I reach my goal, the donations will be split in half to accommodate my rent for the months of July and August.  

Krisitine Woods is a professor at MICA that is committed to mentoring serious student artists and under her guidance during the internship,  I will learn how to proficiently manage time, money, personal health and effectively, a small business. As a studio assistant I will develop a more mature set of skills and habits such as memberships in museums; budgeting supplies or writing applications for grants. I will essentially use this opportunity to grasp a deeper understanding of what a rigorous contemporary art practice entails given the current state of our economy. 

An Extension Of My Gratitude

In exchange for your selfless donations and generous support,  I am offering the printed and ceramic work shown to truly show how thankful I am:

Printed Works

Ceramic Objects


The Impact Of Your Contribution

Fulfilling the goal of the campaign would allot some time to maximize my art practice, improve my writing skills and develop a network of connections through Kristine's immense well of resources.  I consider her to be a mentor after sharing a significant relationship with  her as a  student in Intro to Fiber and Junior Seminar. Being immersed into her community of artists, who range from performers to filmmakers to writers will provide history, context and insight into commercialized and/or independent art avenues in preparation for graduation in May 2015

At the end of the summer, Guest in The Fields will culminate in an exhibition in Kristine's parlor floor studio in her Brooklyn's browstone. A site specific installation that will purposefully raise ideas of labor and production in the domestic arena and the particular architectural history of the parlor as a space between public and private. I will participate in the planning stages of this show. 

If You Cannot Afford To Donate PLEASE!!!

 :) Post this campaign to any social media platform using the indiegogo sharing tools.

 :) Spread the word out to friends, family or anyone else that supports the development of young student artists. 

Thank you so much for you time and donations!!!!

story:
Short Summary

"Let's all move to Lawrence, KS and live in this amazing church and make theatre and stuff."

When I posted this on Facebook on April 8th, I had no idea I'd be securing a lease for the place less than a week later.  And yet... and yet.

A bit of background: My name's Josh Meyer.  Along with Matt Hislope, I'm the co-Artistic Director of Rubber Repertory--an experimental theatre company based in Austin, TX.  Matt and I started making performances together when we were both theatre students at the University of Kansas.  After graduation, we moved to Austin and have been at it ever since.

As we near our 15th year of working together, it seems like a great time to do something radical, so we're heading back to where we started--Lawrence, KS--to run a temporary artists' colony in a historic church-house.  We're going to invite daring artists from a variety of disciplines (dance, theatre, fiction, photography, video, music, etc.) to come and spend some time living in the church and making something new. 

We'll have a simple application process and will seek out a diverse group of artists: a mix of people who are part of our community and those we've never met, early and mid-career artists, those who want to work solo and those who'd like to collaborate with us or others.  Over the course of the year-long lease that begins on August 1st, we anticipate being able to host over 50 different artists for visits ranging from one to four weeks.

I hope you'll take a few minutes to watch the video tour, check out all of our unique perks, and consider helping us with this project.  Your donation will ensure that the Pilot Balloon Church-House is able to get off the ground and float in all kinds of unexpected directions.

(And we'd be remiss not to mention just a few of the church's amenities, like the 700 sq. foot open rehearsal space with beautiful oak floor, the scenic brick loft, the private second bedroom, the utility room with washer and dryer, the kitchen altar, the detached garage, the backyard porch that's perfect for communing, and on and on it goes...)

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $8,500 in funding.  This will subsidize a portion of our rent and utilities (which will total $1,600-$1,700 a month) and allow us to keep artist fees minimal.  We plan on charging artists $50-$75 a week, but if we exceed our funding goal, we'll be able to bring this number down even lower, and possibly offer travel grants as well.

I've never liked the word "perks," but we've got twelve of them for you to check-out and see what suits your fancy.  There are scripts, CDs, original art, singing telegrams, Rubber Rep golden tickets, a private performance by Austin's premiere storytelling collective, a postcard-of-the-month club, and guaranteed stays at Pilot Balloon.  

The Impact

Even in cities like Austin that are so teeming with creativity, it can be difficult to find a good place to rehearse, compose, choreograph, etc.  I've often found myself living in a cramped apartment and dependent on pay-by-the-hour rehearsal spaces that fill up months in advance.  The Pilot Balloon Church-House doesn't solve this problem, but spaces like this can be part of a solution.

*We want to give people another tool they can use to create the work they need to make.

*We want to facilitate relationships between artists from different backgrounds and locations.  

*We want to introduce others to the offbeat and idyllic setting of Lawrence, KS.

*We want to see if it's possible for two guys without any private funding or personal fortune to succeed in their crazy impulse to run an artists' colony for a year. The proverbial, "If we can do it, anyone can."

And of course, even though we'll be the ones shoveling the snow (!!) and mowing the lawn, Matt and I stand to benefit considerably by living in the house for the duration and interacting with all of the artists who pass through.  We get a little misty thinking about the work we'll be able to get done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we'd be so grateful if you could share this project with friends or with anyone else who might be interested.  Also, if you'd like to join us at Pilot Balloon, please keep an eye out for the residency application in Mid-May.

story:
How I Became a Part of a World Wide Controversy That Became Known as the Banning of the 'G' Word

Hi,

I’m Cynthia Rahming, 2010 Judo Youth Olympian from the Bahamas. You may have heard about the controversy from the BBC World News about the ‘G’ Word. Well I am the athlete behind the G Word.

So it started with an interview for Judo with the BBC World News. And I threw the host and he said that he’d never live down being beaten by a 19 year old girl. After the BBC World News aired it the first time, the second time they aired the interview they edited the word “girl” out. I guess they figured it might offend someone.

I was not offended by it, but I do respect different feelings and I understand that someone might be offended by it. And I do see that everyone has different feelings because I see this even within my own family.

After the BBC took out the ‘G’ word it created a media storm that went all the way to the British Parliament, to newspapers in Australia and even made its way to the O’Reilly factor.

                       G Word Controversy Appeared on Several Media



                   How I Am Able to Throw Someone Twice My Size


Elite Athletes do amazing things. I’ve been training for seven years and now I train 30 hours a week. That involves running in the morning, weight lifting in the afternoon, then training again in the late afternoon for Judo. All that training makes us able to amaze people.

On top of all of that training athletes can be multi talented. Personally I do art. I love to make ceramics, I love to draw, and I also love to paint. So I channel my athleticism into my art.

The Olympic values are respect, excellence and friendship. So I’ve painted a series of women demonstrating these values in the Olympic disciplines. I call this series my ‘G’ Word series. I’m doing an Olympic run which involves 25 tournaments in different countries and this can be quite costly. So I’ve decided to share my artwork to those who pledge to my cause.

So please check them out. And thanks for your support.

                                                       My Art Work

The Archer ( 11 X 14 Canvas):


When persons are performing archery there is a certain grace in something that is easy to perform but difficult to master. The lines in the body are ascetically pleasing.

The Gymnast (11 X 14 Canvas):


Sports can also be entertaining. With a simple ribbon, this gymnast demonstrates flexibility, beauty and grace. There is originality in every routine.

Strength and Beauty (11 X 14 Canvas): 



This painting was inspired by a photo of a painting that I saw online. I was attracted by the simplicity and the relaxed state she was in while performing a tremendous feat of strength. In the Olympic sport of Judo in addition to  being very strong, you have to keep your head on your shoulders when you fight. 

The Boxer (16 x 20 Canvas):


Power and speed of the hands are reflected in this drawing. Along with cooperation of your training partner. I wanted to concentrate on the upper body where the focus in this moment is taking place.

The Judo champion (16 X 20 Canvas):


This painting captures the dedication necessary to defeat another person. It captures the moment as you go past your opponents tipping point, where he can no longer hold his balance and is thrown with control and force to his back.

The Lunge (16 X 20 Canvas):


The lunge demonstrates strength, balance and  explosive power. The ability to work with a partner using his body weight is a great way to train and build friendships.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's What I need & What You Get:

  • I'm trying to raise $50,000 to pay for tournament travel, specialist coaches, sports psychologists, uniforms and other things related to high level athletics.
  • I'm going to share my Art work and self defense knowledge with those who help.
  • Every bit helps, as I have to attend about 25 tournaments to get to the level I need to qualify.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference.

  • While I may be an underdog in trying to win a medal at the Olympics, in 2010 I became the first person from my country to win a world level match at the Youth Olympic Games in Singapore. 
  • I have consistently improved and recently won a gold medal at the Caribbean Championships and the US Junior Open.

Risks & Challenges

Judo is a very tough sport. It challenges you mentally and physically.
  • I train 30 hours a week to prepare.
  • I am trying to be the very best in the world and competing against countries that spend hundreds of thousands of dollars per athlete for their training

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share on your FaceBook page and among friends. I really appreciate your help.

The Judo champion (16 X 20 Canvas):This painting captures the dedication necessary to defeat another person. It captures the moment as you go past your opponents tipping point, where he can no longer hold his balance and is thrown with control and force to his back.

The Lunge (16 X 20 Canvas):The lunge demonstrates strength, balance and  explosive power. The ability to work with a partner using his body weight is a great way to train and build friendships.   What I Need & What You Get Here's What I need & What You Get: 
I'm trying to raise $50,000 to pay for tournament travel, specialist coaches, sports psychologists, uniforms and other things related to high level athletics. I'm going to share my Art work and self defense knowledge with those who help. Every bit helps, as I have to attend about 25 tournaments to get to the level I need to qualify.   The Impact Your contribution will make a difference. 
While I may be an underdog in trying to win a medal at the Olympics, in 2010 I became the first person from my country to win a world level match at the Youth Olympic Games in Singapore.  I have consistently improved and recently won a gold medal at the Caribbean Championships and the US Junior Open.   Risks & ChallengesJudo is a very tough sport. It challenges you mentally and physically. 
I train 30 hours a week to prepare. I am trying to be the very best in the world and competing against countries that spend hundreds of thousands of dollars per athlete for their training   Other Ways You Can Help Please share on your FaceBook page and among friends. I really appreciate your help.

story:
Ihr könnt das Buch weiterhin über die Kampagne erwerben, jedoch ist es für deutsche Kunden empfehlenswert direkt über den verlagseigenen Shop, www.yaoishop.de zu bestellen! :)

Hier gehts direkt zur Dragonlords-Kategorie, in der ihr das Buch, die Prints, sowie eine Reihe an Merchandise-Artikeln bestellen könnt. Ab 27€ Warenwert innerhalb Deutschlands sogar Versandkostenfrei.

Die Finanzierung steht! :D
Wir danken jedem, der uns geholfen hat, das Buch zu finanzieren, aus tiefstem Herzen. Jedem, der die Kampagne beworben hat und natürlich jedem Zeichner, der darin involviert ist! Danke, dass ihr es uns ermöglicht habt, dieses Buch zu drucken!

We’re funded! :D
Our eternal gratitude goes to everyone who helped funding the book, everyone who advertised the campaign and of course every artist involved! Thank you so much for giving us the chance to create this book!

Hier seht ihr eine detaillierte Vorschau:
Go here for a detailed preview:
http://www.fireangels.net/Artbook/Dragonlords/dragonlords_digitalextra.pdf

Fireangels, ursprünglich als kleiner deutscher Verlag gegründet, expandierte schnell über die Grenzen des Landes hinaus und veröffentlicht seit 2005 Zeichner aus der ganzen Welt.
Und auch wenn Comics und Manga die eigentliche Leidenschaft der Redaktion sind, haben wir schon 3 große Artbookprojekte ins Leben gerufen und als Bücher herausgebracht:

  • Bi-Color, eine einzigartige Sammlung an Illustrationen, die nur schwarz, weiß und eine zusätzliche Farbe beinhalten. An diesem Buch beteiligten sich vor allem Zeichner der deutschen Plattform Animexx, aber auch internationale Künstler aus Brasilien und China sind mit von der Partie.
  • Lemongrass, ein Buch, 6 Zeichner: Aziell, Del Borovic, Diana Liesaus, Nina Nowacki, SlippedDee und Zel.
  • World of Aziell: drin ist, was drauf steht! Atemberaubend schöne Werke aus der Feder der talentierten Italienerin als hochwertiges Hardcover-Buch mit 112 Seiten
 Fireangels is the name of a German publishing house, which quickly expanded across the boundaries of its homeland and releases artists all across the world since 2005. Although we mainly specialize in Comic and Manga – the not-so-hidden passion of the editorial staff! – we already created three major artbook-projects, which were released in print:

  • Bi-Color: A unique collection of illustrations printed in black, white, and one additional colour. The book placed its main focus on German artists active on the Anime and Manga-centric website Animexx.de, but also inspired international artists from Brazil and China.
  • Lemongrass: One book, six artists. Aziell, Del Borovic, Diana Liesaus, Nina Nowacki, SlippedDee and Zel came together to create a work of art.
  • Word of Aziell: Breathtaking artworks by the talented Italian artist, blended in an exquisite hardcover book with 112 pages in total!

Nach drei Jahren Pause war es an der Zeit für etwas Neues und so haben wir uns an die Planungen für das nächste Artbook gesetzt, und all unsere Erfahrungen einfließen lassen. Mit Dragonlords verwirklichen wir ein Projekt, das alles in den Schatten stellt, was wir bisher gemacht haben.
  • 18 internationale Top-Zeichner, aus Europa, Asien und Nordamerika
  • 104 Seiten, hochwertiger Druck, fadengeheftetes Hardcover
  • limitierte Auflage von 500 Stück
  • Prints, Autogramme und persönliche Widmungen


Der Titel des Buches "Dragonlords - Expedition ins Reich der Drachen" verreint Fantasy und Steampunk mit klassischen Rollenspielelementen.

Um dir einen möglichst guten Überblick über alle beteiligten Künstler zu geben, findest du hier die Links zu ihren Galerien:		 It has been three years since our last artbook, and we decided that it was time to create something which benefits from all our knowledge, experience, and the wish to create something unique. This was the birth of “Dragonlords”, the artbook experience which outshines everything we had done before!
  • 18 international top artists, hailing from Europe, Asia and North America
  • 104 pages placed in a thread-stitched hardcover book of exceptional looks
  • A limited edition of 500 pieces
  • Prints, autographs, and personal dedications – this book will be an all-out experience for anyone involved!
"Dragonlords - journey to the dragonrealms", the title of the book melds fantasy and steampunk with classic roleplay elements.

 To offer you some insight in the works of the artists taking part in this project: Here are the links to their official galleries!


Mit deiner Unterstützung sicherst du in erster Linie den Druck des Projekts. Dieser beläuft sich auf ca. 3.000.- Euro. Zuzüglich der Gebühren für diese Kampagne benötigen wir ein Kapital von 3.200.- Euro. Jeder Cent, den wir darüber hinaus einnehmen, geht vorangig in die Bezahlung der Künstler. Jede im Buch abgedruckte Seite hat einen Gegenwert von 80.- Euro, die ohne Abzüge an jeden unserer 18 Künstler ausbezahlt wird. Je schneller sich die Bücher verkaufen, desto schneller bekommt jeder sein Honorar. Und je mehr Bücher verkauft werden, desto mehr Geld bekommt auch jeder Künstler!
This is where you come into play. Your support will mainly secure the print of the project at hand. The total costs of printing fall around EUR 3,000 ; adding the fees for this campaign, we need a total seed capital of EUR 3,200 to get the book started. Every additional cent earned by both this campaign and sales of the product will mainly go into the hands of our artists. Every one of the 18 artists receives a base payment of EUR 80 per page designed and printed in the book; the quicker we’re able to sell the books, the quicker our artists will receive their complete fees, as well as additional payments!

Wir haben uns bemüht vielfältige Perks für dieses Projekt zu gestalten, damit du uns unterstützen kannst, auch wenn dein Budget den Kauf das Artbooks selbst nicht zulässt.

Beachte bitte, dass alle Preise exklusive Porto angegeben sind. Du musst das Porto entsprechend dem Bestimmungsland noch zum Komplettbetrag hinzufügen. Die Übersicht findest du am Ende dieser Kampagne.
 We tried our best to include a wide variety of perks, to ensure that everyone who would like to support us can do it, regardless of the funds at hand.




Please be aware that all prices are listed excluding shipping costs! You need to add the shipping cost for your destination to the perk's price accordingly. You will find a detailed list providing shipping costs to the different countries at the end of the campaign.

1.00 €uro - Thank you!
Der Klassiker unter den Perks, für jeden, der das Projekt unterstützen will. Klein und für jeden erschwinglich. The absolute classic of the crowdfunding perks, available for everyone who wants to support this project. No matter how small you might think this is – You helped us to make a dream come true, and we are so, so very happy to have you.

4.00 €uro - Print A4
Kein Budget für das Artbook? Das macht nichts, denn mit diesem schicken Print kannst du dir den Künstler deiner Wahl trotzdem nach Hause holen.
Beachtet bitte, dass der eingetragene Preis des Perks falsch ist und ihr den Betrag manuell ändern könnt! (siehe unten)
 The artbook is a bit too pricey? Don’t fear; this perk allows you to take the artist of your choice straight home with you. You can pick your favourite A4 print from the wide range of A4 posters, taken directly from „Dragonlords“!
Please consider the wrong price of the perk and make sure to change the amount of your contribution manually! (as seen below)

35.00 €uro - Artbook
Das Artbook zum regulären Preis inklusive Stickerbogen.
 You will not only receive our artbook for an discounted price, no – we’re going to top that with a sticker-sheet,

Porto / Shipping
Denke bitte daran, das Porto zu deinem Perk hinzu zufügen! Wenn du noch nicht weißt, wohin du dein Perk liefern lassen möchtest, kannst du das Porto auch später bezahlen. Please keep in mind to add shipping to your perk! If you've not decided which location your perk should be sent to (international, EU or Germany) you can pay the shipping later.


Unterstützen kannst du uns sogar, wenn du überhaupt kein Geld ausgibst. Wir benötigen nur ein paar Minuten deiner Zeit.
Teile die Kampagne und mach deine Freunde darauf aufmerksam! Du findest uns auf:		 Actually, you do not even need to spend money to support our campaign and dream; all we need are some minutes of your treasured time.
Share this campaign with your friends, family, neighbours, pets, basically EVERYONE, and spread the word! You can find us on the following homepages and social networks:
  • Tumblr
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Animexx
  • deviantArt
  • yaoi-gallery
  • oder mit dem Indiegogo-tool! / or with the help of the IndieGogo tool!
Danke für deine Hilfe. Ohne dich würde dieses Projekt nicht zustande kommen! Fühl dich gedrückt, geknutscht und wertgeschätzt - du bist toll.
Dein Team von Fireangels und alle beteiligten Künstler! 		We cannot thank you enough for all your help. Without you, we would never be able to take this step. Please take our most sincere Thank You’s, hugs and virtual kisses – you are absolutely perfect.
With lots of love,
Your team of Fireangels, as well as all artists involved in this project! :)

Hier findest du weitere Informationen, wie z.B. die Versandkosten für dein Land, die Liste der verfügbaren Prints und signierten Bücher. Below you will find further important informations, such as a detailed list of shipping costs as well as a list of available prints and signed books!

Porto / Shipping

Deutschland
European Union
International

 1x Book
3.00 EURO
6.00 EURO
8.00 EURO
2x Prints* 		1-5x Print
2.00 EURO
4.00 EURO
4.00 EURO
 6-11x Print
3.00 EURO
8.00 EURO
8.00 EURO
 2x Book
5.00 EURO
10.00 EURO
12.00 EURO
6x Prints*
*Das Gewichtslimit der einzelnen Posten lässt diese Zusätze zu.
*The weigth limit allows the addition of these products.

Du willst mehr? Bitte sende uns eine Nachricht und wir werden diese Liste entsprechend überarbeiten.
You want more? Please write us a note and we will update this list.
