story:
Following the success of last July's 1st Performance & Live Art Platform in Cyprus, Larnaca, we are now organising the 2nd time round! The Performance & Live Art Platform Cyprus is an artist-led event which returns to Cyprus in early September 2013. This platform celebrates the work of emerging as well as established artists, who have interdisciplinary backgrounds and whose work focuses on performance and live art.

On Saturday 7th of September the platform will be based at the Point Centre for Contemporary Arts in Nicosia, Cyprus; this time as a one day event, which will include a half-day Symposium with the theme of "Artistic Definitions of Performance Art" as well as discussions on "Performance Documentation". The platform will also include a screening, short and durational performances, one-to-one pieces, workshops, happenings, installations, performance lectures. 

Our aim is to create a platform that can accommodate and support the work of artists from Cyprus and abroad from the areas of performance and live art; to improve the understanding of the level of accessibility and awareness of live art across the island and most importantly to give the opportunity for Cypriot artists, who have to resort abroad, to present their work at home. This platform forms an intercultural dialogue between artists and by exploring the interdisciplinary nature of the work of each artist, it also intends to bring together local artists and visiting artists for possible future collaborations. It creates a network for possible future exchanges between the United Kingdom, Cyprus, Greece and other countries. Our platform includes live performances and will go beyond conventional boundaries and stereotypes about "what is art" through the kind of performance and live art.

 

A short presentation of the project

 

Performance Abstracts

Yiota Demetriou

An Exhibition of Hidden Stories: Love Letters

There are 4 types of love: Agapi, Eros, Philia, Storge. Love Letters is an on-going project with no definite end.

 

Natasha Davis

Internal Terrains

What cracks appear in the density of everyday pressures and ageing? Why is the body sometimes sensitive to every sound? Internal Terrains explores life as a choreography of decades, in search of what’s at stake as we move from one decade to another. Poetic and sensual, the performance plays chords with films and installations, crows, cages and electric shocks.

Created, written and performed by Natasha Davis in collaboration with: Bob Karper (sound), Branislava Kuburović (documentation), Elisa Gallo-Rosso (objects), Lucy Cash (movement) and Marty Langthorne (lights). Commissioned by Chelsea Theatre London, Refugee Week UK, Colchester Arts Centre and Live Collision Dublin. Funded by Arts Council England, Hosking Houses Trust and University of Warwick. Supported by Littoral.

 

Alexandra Reghina Draghici

HomeBirth ~ the chair of my loins ~ A chair, It is designed to accommodate the human body; it consists of a seat, legs, back, and often arms. While sitting, a moment of stillness comes over us and we are reminded of our interiority. The chair becomes both functional and mythic ~ catching us betwixt and between lying and standing, as we travel sitting down.  

Conceived & Directed By:  Alexandra Reghina Draghici

Performed By:  Stephanie Merulla & Alexandra Reghina Draghici

 

Transcendental Theatre Workshop Group

The Essence of the Inseparable

An improvisational physical theatre piece enriched by extracts from Nikos Kazantzakis’ “Askitiki”.

Livia Rita and Demetris Chimonas 

"Bleximo" (Tangle)

A visual performance piece exploring the surprises of life and its gifts. It attempts to shine light on the complexity of action and reaction within intimate relationships, delving into how we exchange with and influence one another and eventually bond. It's an ode to the beauty created between two individual beings.

 

Elena Kotasvili and Loucas Ioannou

Therapy: Session1

A reformed group psychotherapy session where notions of perception, deception and authenticity are introduced. Authority is redefined, reassessed and often abused during Therapy: Session 1. The use of language functions as a barrier between performers and the audience, provoking the audience not only to overcome this barrier by contributing to the development of performance, but also to break the established role of the audience as simply passive, secluded viewers.

 

Ashleigh Griffith

We were never here

A moment. Written. Marked down forever, made permanent.

A moment. Written and then washed away, but held within the fibres of the paper on which it was marked. Molded into the place it was marked, this memory object now contains its experience and place. Using a process traditionally used by archeologists, Ashleigh Griffith invites participants to create paper squeezes with her, which hold within them experiences, memories and sites. 

------

 

Artist’s Bios

Yiota Demetriou has a BA (Hons) in Theatre Studies from Queen Mary University of London, an MRes from the University of Hull and is currently undertaking a PhD at the University of Bristol, which is entitled An Exhibition of Hidden Stories: The Lives' of Others - Research into methods of staging oral history archives. She is a practitioner (performance artist and researcher). The applied theatre method that she developed in 2010-2011 through the research of her MA thesis, Young Voices: An Applied Theatre Project Bridging the Gap Between Youth and Adults, is widely used by youth workers. Demetriou also has her own column in a Cypriot online magazine, SkalaTimes, called Σκέφτομαι Τέχνη - I Think of Art, where she publishes articles, on a weekly basis in regards to her research interests and upcoming events both in the UK, which she is currently based and Cyprus, where she is originally from. Her work focuses on the memories of the audience and employs media such as live art, video and multi-media facilities. An Exhibition of Hidden Stories is her signature performance project that consists of a series of performances that explore the concepts of memory, nostalgia, and focus on her interests personal history and narrative, as well as how oral history can be staged and documented. In addition how material can be re-used for the development of a performance. Moreover, she is the initiator and curator of the Performance & Live Art Platform in Cyprus, where she attempted to reach new audiences and create opportunities for young people working with Performance and Live Art in Cyprus. 

Alexandra R Draghici  (Romanian/Canadian) is a site-specific performance maker. Her work is interdisciplinary, incorporating soundscape, choreography, visual / land art. She has devised site-specific cross-cultural performances in community contexts. Her work is informed by: magick, witchcraft, alchemy, noetic science, yoga & physiology, philosophy, psychology, and the numinosity retained in environments: material, architecture, the body, sound & light.

Theatro Transcendental is a professional theatre company based in Cyprus, with the aim of creating thought-provoking works that contribute positively to the development of human consciousness. (www.theatrotranscendental.com)

The Open Wide Collective is made up of Ashley J Edwards (Director, Producer and Performance Maker), Douglas Brown (Performance Maker) and Finn Anderson (Composer, Songwriter & Multi-Instrumentalist). Through the creation of this project the trio have strived to produce a piece of contemporary performance art which recognises and crosses boundaries both conceptually and aesthetically to explore how the mediatisation of queerness, sexualities and deviance across cultures affects and shapes public views towards homophobia and taboos.

Ashleigh Griffith is an undisciplined interdisciplinary artist from the UK. Her work includes and extends beyond live performance, film and installation. She uses found objects, kept objects, craft and technology to research and create through experimentation. She is currently conducting practice-based PhD research at the University of Chichester around the process of creation, dissemination and understanding of a memory, a memory object, and the creative process.

Livia Rita and Demetris Chimonas met in London a year ago. They study Contemporary Theatre together. Livia comes from the Swiss mountains and she likes flowers, change, trains, long dresses, dreams, beautiful men and music. Demetris comes from Larnaca and he likes fat, the colour black, spontaneous drawing and dance, cleaning and feet. Demetris also likes Livia and Livia likes Demetris, too.

Elena Kotasvili and Loucas Ioannou studied fine art in London and Berlin and have acted as a team for the last 7 years. Coming from a Fine Arts background they create performances that include double staging: partly regarding concept and space representation, and partly regarding the notion of performance itself. Their work usually stands somewhere at the borderline between reality and artificial reality, where the audience has always a key role. Loucas and Elena participated in exhibitions and art festivals in London, Berlin, Athens, Krakow, St.Petersburg and New York and they occasionally collaborate with contemporary theater and dance companies. 

------

 

So, why do we need your help?

This event will be FREE as we want to make it accessible for everyone! The Platform is a not-for-profit initiative supported mainly by its organizing team. All involved in this project are volunteering and investing freely from their own time towards making it a success.

However, for this event to take shape we require technical support, props, printing material, etc., while our budget also includes transportation, accommodation and catering costs for the artists, as well as advertizing costs.

Thus, we have begun this crowdfunding campaign to raise a portion of the budget that will help this project to become a reality.

Your support, however small, is significant for us!  

 

Other Ways to Help Us

  • Spread the word and promote this campaign and the event
  • Give us alternative funding ideas
  • Share your ideas about the festival with us

 

Thank you so much!

And we hope to see you at the Platform in September!!!
story_txt:
Following the success of last July's 1st Performance & Live Art Platform in Cyprus, Larnaca, we are now organising the 2nd time round! The Performance & Live Art Platform Cyprus is an artist-led event which returns to Cyprus in early September 2013. This platform celebrates the work of emerging as well as established artists, who have interdisciplinary backgrounds and whose work focuses on performance and live art.
On Saturday 7th of September the platform will be based at the Point Centre for Contemporary Arts in Nicosia, Cyprus; this time as a one day event, which will include a half-day Symposium with the theme of "Artistic Definitions of Performance Art" as well as discussions on "Performance Documentation". The platform will also include a screening, short and durational performances, one-to-one pieces, workshops, happenings, installations, performance lectures. 
Our aim is to create a platform that can accommodate and support the work of artists from Cyprus and abroad from the areas of performance and live art; to improve the understanding of the level of accessibility and awareness of live art across the island and most importantly to give the opportunity for Cypriot artists, who have to resort abroad, to present their work at home. This platform forms an intercultural dialogue between artists and by exploring the interdisciplinary nature of the work of each artist, it also intends to bring together local artists and visiting artists for possible future collaborations. It creates a network for possible future exchanges between the United Kingdom, Cyprus, Greece and other countries. Our platform includes live performances and will go beyond conventional boundaries and stereotypes about "what is art" through the kind of performance and live art.
 
A short presentation of the project
 
Performance Abstracts
Yiota Demetriou
An Exhibition of Hidden Stories: Love Letters
There are 4 types of love: Agapi, Eros, Philia, Storge. Love Letters is an on-going project with no definite end.
 
Natasha Davis
Internal Terrains
What cracks appear in the density of everyday pressures and ageing? Why is the body sometimes sensitive to every sound? Internal Terrains explores life as a choreography of decades, in search of what’s at stake as we move from one decade to another. Poetic and sensual, the performance plays chords with films and installations, crows, cages and electric shocks.
Created, written and performed by Natasha Davis in collaboration with: Bob Karper (sound), Branislava Kuburović (documentation), Elisa Gallo-Rosso (objects), Lucy Cash (movement) and Marty Langthorne (lights). Commissioned by Chelsea Theatre London, Refugee Week UK, Colchester Arts Centre and Live Collision Dublin. Funded by Arts Council England, Hosking Houses Trust and University of Warwick. Supported by Littoral.
 
Alexandra Reghina Draghici
HomeBirth ~ the chair of my loins ~ A chair, It is designed to accommodate the human body; it consists of a seat, legs, back, and often arms. While sitting, a moment of stillness comes over us and we are reminded of our interiority. The chair becomes both functional and mythic ~ catching us betwixt and between lying and standing, as we travel sitting down.  
Conceived & Directed By:  Alexandra Reghina Draghici
Performed By:  Stephanie Merulla & Alexandra Reghina Draghici
 
Transcendental Theatre Workshop Group 
The Essence of the Inseparable 
An improvisational physical theatre piece enriched by extracts from Nikos Kazantzakis’ “Askitiki”.
Livia Rita and Demetris Chimonas 
"Bleximo" (Tangle) 
A visual performance piece exploring the surprises of life and its gifts. It attempts to shine light on the complexity of action and reaction within intimate relationships, delving into how we exchange with and influence one another and eventually bond. It's an ode to the beauty created between two individual beings.
 
Elena Kotasvili and Loucas Ioannou
Therapy: Session1
A reformed group psychotherapy session where notions of perception, deception and authenticity are introduced. Authority is redefined, reassessed and often abused during Therapy: Session 1. The use of language functions as a barrier between performers and the audience, provoking the audience not only to overcome this barrier by contributing to the development of performance, but also to break the established role of the audience as simply passive, secluded viewers.
 
Ashleigh Griffith
We were never here
A moment. Written. Marked down forever, made permanent.
A moment. Written and then washed away, but held within the fibres of the paper on which it was marked. Molded into the place it was marked, this memory object now contains its experience and place. Using a process traditionally used by archeologists, Ashleigh Griffith invites participants to create paper squeezes with her, which hold within them experiences, memories and sites. 
------
 
Artist’s Bios
Yiota Demetriou has a BA (Hons) in Theatre Studies from Queen Mary University of London, an MRes from the University of Hull and is currently undertaking a PhD at the University of Bristol, which is entitled An Exhibition of Hidden Stories: The Lives' of Others - Research into methods of staging oral history archives. She is a practitioner (performance artist and researcher). The applied theatre method that she developed in 2010-2011 through the research of her MA thesis, Young Voices: An Applied Theatre Project Bridging the Gap Between Youth and Adults, is widely used by youth workers. Demetriou also has her own column in a Cypriot online magazine, SkalaTimes, called Σκέφτομαι Τέχνη - I Think of Art, where she publishes articles, on a weekly basis in regards to her research interests and upcoming events both in the UK, which she is currently based and Cyprus, where she is originally from. Her work focuses on the memories of the audience and employs media such as live art, video and multi-media facilities. An Exhibition of Hidden Stories is her signature performance project that consists of a series of performances that explore the concepts of memory, nostalgia, and focus on her interests personal history and narrative, as well as how oral history can be staged and documented. In addition how material can be re-used for the development of a performance. Moreover, she is the initiator and curator of the Performance & Live Art Platform in Cyprus, where she attempted to reach new audiences and create opportunities for young people working with Performance and Live Art in Cyprus. 
Alexandra R Draghici  (Romanian/Canadian) is a site-specific performance maker. Her work is interdisciplinary, incorporating soundscape, choreography, visual / land art. She has devised site-specific cross-cultural performances in community contexts. Her work is informed by: magick, witchcraft, alchemy, noetic science, yoga & physiology, philosophy, psychology, and the numinosity retained in environments: material, architecture, the body, sound & light.
Theatro Transcendental is a professional theatre company based in Cyprus, with the aim of creating thought-provoking works that contribute positively to the development of human consciousness. (www.theatrotranscendental.com)
The Open Wide Collective is made up of Ashley J Edwards (Director, Producer and Performance Maker), Douglas Brown (Performance Maker) and Finn Anderson (Composer, Songwriter & Multi-Instrumentalist). Through the creation of this project the trio have strived to produce a piece of contemporary performance art which recognises and crosses boundaries both conceptually and aesthetically to explore how the mediatisation of queerness, sexualities and deviance across cultures affects and shapes public views towards homophobia and taboos.
Ashleigh Griffith is an undisciplined interdisciplinary artist from the UK. Her work includes and extends beyond live performance, film and installation. She uses found objects, kept objects, craft and technology to research and create through experimentation. She is currently conducting practice-based PhD research at the University of Chichester around the process of creation, dissemination and understanding of a memory, a memory object, and the creative process.
Livia Rita and Demetris Chimonas met in London a year ago. They study Contemporary Theatre together. Livia comes from the Swiss mountains and she likes flowers, change, trains, long dresses, dreams, beautiful men and music. Demetris comes from Larnaca and he likes fat, the colour black, spontaneous drawing and dance, cleaning and feet. Demetris also likes Livia and Livia likes Demetris, too.
Elena Kotasvili and Loucas Ioannou studied fine art in London and Berlin and have acted as a team for the last 7 years. Coming from a Fine Arts background they create performances that include double staging: partly regarding concept and space representation, and partly regarding the notion of performance itself. Their work usually stands somewhere at the borderline between reality and artificial reality, where the audience has always a key role. Loucas and Elena participated in exhibitions and art festivals in London, Berlin, Athens, Krakow, St.Petersburg and New York and they occasionally collaborate with contemporary theater and dance companies. 
------
 
So, why do we need your help?
This event will be FREE as we want to make it accessible for everyone! The Platform is a not-for-profit initiative supported mainly by its organizing team. All involved in this project are volunteering and investing freely from their own time towards making it a success.
However, for this event to take shape we require technical support, props, printing material, etc., while our budget also includes transportation, accommodation and catering costs for the artists, as well as advertizing costs.
Thus, we have begun this crowdfunding campaign to raise a portion of the budget that will help this project to become a reality.
Your support, however small, is significant for us!  
 
Other Ways to Help Us

Spread the word and promote this campaign and the event
Give us alternative funding ideas
Share your ideas about the festival with us
 
Thank you so much!
And we hope to see you at the Platform in September!!!

story:
Namaste

First of all, thank you for checking out my campaign. It means so much to me!

Who Am I?

Allow me to introduce myself...my name is Elizabeth Shumaker, I live in Montana and I am an artist. Always have been, always will be. I want to do things with my art, go places, learn new things, and teach what I have learned....you know....contribute to making the world a better, more beautiful and harmonious place. And I feel that I do that best through my art. So art is many things to me....it is a path....a devotion....a passion....an expression of my heart's song.....and I long to share it with others!

I have been painting since I was 15 and took my first high-school art class. It quickly became a passion and a source of constant expression for me. I then attended Pacific Northwest College of Art for one year, and feeling like I needed a change, I moved back to my hometown of Billings, Montana. While always continuing to paint, I also became a mother, and studied massage therapy and healing arts. I currently have a massage and healing practice called Creative Healing, where I do massage, craniosacral, Reiki, and healing arts. I have an in-home art studio in which I spend the vast majority of my evenings, creating my art ;) White Lotus Visions.

Busy with life and raising a child as a single mother, I am primarily a self-taught painter. I haven't had too many opportunities to really devote myself to learning new artistic skills, other than doing my own research, but I am a devoted artist nonetheless and feel this would be a giant leap into a whole new territory! So exciting!!! 

What do I want to do?

SO, I feel one step, for me, in the direction of furthering my art career and ability to render my visions, is to attend an AMAZING seminar in Italy, this July. The seminar is called "Expanded Visions in the MicshTechnik". I will be studying with four amazing teachers/artists.....artists who's work I have admired for a long time- Amanda Sage, A. Andrew Gonzolez, Maura Holden, and Laurence Carauana. I will be bringing my seven year old son along with me, so he will be learning and absorbing the creative spirit and culture as well! I will also be staying in an amazing Eco-Village called Torri Superiore. It is a three week long intensive painting experience! I will be learning the techniques of the masters, known as the MischTechnik, as well as some other new mediums such as special airbrush and glazing techniques. It is something I have been feeling strongly pulled to go to for the past 2 years or so. Now I feel is the opportunity! 

This course will help me to deepen both my practical composition and style as well as "visionary" skills. Visionary Art is been the "genre" I have always painted in. I like to define visionary art as "art that has the potential to change or alter consciousness in a spiritual and evolutionary way". My work has always contained very deep spiritual content and symbolism. So to me, art is more than just creating a painting, it is a vision, a life an offering.....

 

That said....this is what I need to make it happen.....

Tuition for the full three weeks, including meals and board, and for my son and I to share a room, comes to $3670....

I'll also need travel expenses including airfare, train, and other travel-related expenses for my son and myself....

I have already paid the full tuition, but still need to raise money for the other expenses.  So I am setting my goal at $2000 and any more will go towards funding the journey! 

What's in it for you, you ask?? Lots! :)

Options! I have options for all different levels of support. All equally honored!


$10 - Postcard from Italy +love

$25 - Hand Painted Postcard from Italy +love

$50 - Giclee Print +love

$100 - Small Commissioned Painting +love

$750- THE Seminar Painting +love

$1500- The whole Sh'bang +love

Please check out my website to read more about me and my art!

Also you can view my work on this site under the "Gallery" tab above. Thank you!!

  

Trikaya                             The Watcher

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the love! If you like my art, but maybe can't spare the change, keep in touch and share my work! Exposure is so valuable to an artist.

Thank you so much and I can't wait to share my new work and life's journeys with you!

Thank you so much and I can't wait to share my new work and life's journeys with you!

story:
Short Summary

About Joseph and the Paw Paw Tree

Joseph and the Paw Paw Tree is an empowering story that teaches kids to believe in themselves and work hard  to achieve their dreams.  And with each purchase, one book will be sent to you and one book will be sent to a child in East Africa.  The story takes place in a rural African village, where Joseph lives with his father, sister, and brother.

Joseph's father gives him and his siblings papaya (paw paw) seeds to plant and tells them that for these seeds to turn into trees that bear fruit, "it takes hard work everyday, and no matter what, you have to believe in yourself."

While Joseph's siblings stop watering their trees because they stop believing, Joseph never loses sight of his goal: a swing.  He keeps believing and keeps watering his tree even when his brother and sister call him foolish.  And eventually his persistence pays off!

The story teaches kids the importance of hard work everyday, and also to believe in themselves.

To see and read the whole story, please click on the "story" section of our website: www.a4abooks.com

Why We're Doing This

We think that the best way to create the future we want is to empower our children, the future leaders of tomorrow.  The message of a good children's book can be profound and last a lifetime, especially in remote villages in East Africa where kids aren't exposed to many books, let alone anything relevant to their circumstances.

We wanted to create a book that kids in villages can identify with and teach them about cultures far away.  And we also wanted to create a book that could educate our children here about a distant place and culture that they're taught very little about in school or home.  This project was born from our desire to create something for our dear friends in the village of Matoso, Kenya, while also teaching our nieces and nephews here about places far, far away.

How We're Doing This

We wrote a children's story, and are selling it using a one-for-one model, sending one book to you and one book to a child in East Africa for every book purchased.

We wrote this story for our young friends we met in East Africa, and after working through many drafts, we've finally perfected it.  The name was changed from Joseph and the Papaya Tree to Joseph and the Paw Paw Tree because kids didn't know what a papaya was!  They use the word paw paw instead of papaya.  And we had to change some drawings as well, as we found out that a papaya tree wasn't strong enough to support a swing.

We took a few copies of the first iteration of the book to East Africa on our last trip and really learned from that experience just how needed these books are.  It really strengthened our commitment to this endeavor seeing the look on the kids' faces when they got a book.

What We've Learned

During that trip to Africa we discovered a way to really make a difference to these kids. For the lucky few who got a copy of the book it was the first and only book they owned. After seeing how appreciative those students and their parents were for the simple gift of a children’s book, we then committed to bringing them more, a lot more.

But we also learned some other things.  We took a soft copy of the book, and within an hour it was all messed up.  To live a long life in a rural setting, our children's books need to be hardcover.  And most importantly, to actually logistically do this, we need to order books in enough bulk to drive down the cost per book to actually make this doable.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $5,000 so that we can afford to print enough books to make this business model possible, and so we can actually afford to fulfill on a one-for-one model.  We need to make the books with a hardcover so that they can last in tough conditions.  Also, we have to raise money for the fees that we have to pay Indiegogo as the platform for letting us launch our crowdfunding campaign.

Our perks are really exciting.  With each book purchased we donate a book, and it doesn't take very long before you can provide books to an entire class, or even to an entire school.  And if you loved the pictures, then we have the perfect perk for you!

Imagine how amazing it would be to personally deliver books to an entire school!?!?! That can be yours.

If we don't raise our goal, the funds will be allocated to book production.  And we will continue looking for backers and investors to help make this project a reality!


The Impact

Ever wanted to make a difference? Well you can.  We are providing a way to make that possible.

"The future of Africa is education," Tesi, our Ugandan friend says, "and the first step to an education is to learn how to read.  Kids need books to learn how to read."

Your purchase is providing those books.

We have started a nonprofit organization to make an impact on the world, and we've been successful doing that.  Our organization has helped bring electricity to a high school in rural Kenya, we've helped start a village bank in Kenya as well, and we were part of creating Uganda's first ever suicide prevention hotline.  

While we aren't experts, we definitely care and are doing our best to make a difference, and we think that this project has a great opportunity to spread that impact even further.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support, you can still help out.  It would make a HUGE difference.  

People can't buy something they don't know about, so if you can help spread the word that would be AMAZING!  You can help by:

  • Posting a link to our campaign on your Facebook or Twitter page and inviting your friends to support and share
  • Having conversations with people you meet about this, or anyone that you think would be interested
  • If you know anyone in the media, share this with them and have them get in contact with us!  We would love to do an interview.

story:
Our Story

Raices Cultura is a Coachella-based nonprofit organization with a mission to create space for artistic and cultural expression, promote healthy communities, and strengthen the voice of the communities of the Eastern Coachella Valley.  We utilize art as a vehicle for youth empowerment and engage in projects for Dia de los Muertos, the Hue Festival, and the Coachella Music and Art Festival.

What We Are Planning

On Friday, November 1st, 2013 we are planning on bringing the annual Dia de los Muertos celebration to Downtown 6th Street Coachella as a lively street festival experience for the entire Coachella Valley and reimagine the Downtown with massive art installations of calaveras (skulls) and community altars along the street.  The event has outgrown the previous venue, thanks to great community support, and so we think it is time to grow our efforts.  We are looking to utilize Coachella downtown empty storefronts as a showcase for local visual artists and make the downtown come to life at night.  We plan to have performances by local bands, Danza Azteca, Balet Folklorico, and spoken word.  Your contribution will support youth and local artists to implement this vision and demonstrate the power of art and culture to transform downtown Coachella into a empowering community experience.

What We Need

To create this awesome experience and to keep the event rooted in the community, we need your support to reach our fundraising goal of $5,000.  Contributions in any amount are appreciated.  Raices values every community contribution and we have a history of making every dollar that we receive stretch as far as possible.  Your contribution will support the following:
  • 8 large altars for display created by local artists and community organizations
  • 4 music bands, Aztec Dancers, Balet Folklorico, and DJ
  • Support for artists to create 6 main outdoor art installations
  • Support for artists to create their own showcases in 3 empty storefronts
  • Craft supplies for special Dia de los Muertos craft tables
  • Art supplies for Raices artists to fabricate 6 massive Calaveras
  • Space and equipment rental
  • Special event permits

Keep updated on the event on our website at www.raicesdelvalle.org or find us on Facebook and let other friends know they can be part of this event!  See our work with Coachella youth at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1XWEIvN5Q80
story_txt:
Our Story
Raices Cultura is a Coachella-based nonprofit organization with a mission to create space for artistic and cultural expression, promote healthy communities, and strengthen the voice of the communities of the Eastern Coachella Valley.  We utilize art as a vehicle for youth empowerment and engage in projects for Dia de los Muertos, the Hue Festival, and the Coachella Music and Art Festival.
What We Are Planning
On Friday, November 1st, 2013 we are planning on bringing the annual Dia de los Muertos celebration to Downtown 6th Street Coachella as a lively street festival experience for the entire Coachella Valley and reimagine the Downtown with massive art installations of calaveras (skulls) and community altars along the street.  The event has outgrown the previous venue, thanks to great community support, and so we think it is time to grow our efforts.  We are looking to utilize Coachella downtown empty storefronts as a showcase for local visual artists and make the downtown come to life at night.  We plan to have performances by local bands, Danza Azteca, Balet Folklorico, and spoken word.  Your contribution will support youth and local artists to implement this vision and demonstrate the power of art and culture to transform downtown Coachella into a empowering community experience.
What We Need
To create this awesome experience and to keep the event rooted in the community, we need your support to reach our fundraising goal of $5,000.  Contributions in any amount are appreciated.  Raices values every community contribution and we have a history of making every dollar that we receive stretch as far as possible.  Your contribution will support the following:

8 large altars for display created by local artists and community organizations
4 music bands, Aztec Dancers, Balet Folklorico, and DJ
Support for artists to create 6 main outdoor art installations
Support for artists to create their own showcases in 3 empty storefronts
Craft supplies for special Dia de los Muertos craft tables
Art supplies for Raices artists to fabricate 6 massive Calaveras
Space and equipment rental
Special event permits

Keep updated on the event on our website at www.raicesdelvalle.org or find us on Facebook and let other friends know they can be part of this event!  See our work with Coachella youth at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1XWEIvN5Q80

story:
Raine Raine is the resident bio-girl/half-birthed alien fetus from The House of Gunt, Savannah’s free-form drag collective whose mission is to connect the trashy with the flashy, the kitschy with the classy, and the hetero-ghosts with a breath of fresh, queer air. Holding that breath, Raine will live in Art Rise Savannah's exhibition space for nine days in order to complete a series of learning and un/learning tasks that have inhibited their ability to become the most realized version of themselves through exhibition and installation art.

Raine will be live-streaming the UN/LEARNING 24/7 on their website, RAINEBLUNK.COM, as a part of a larger social media campaign in congruence with the live UN/LEARNING events. Raine will also be utilizing the Facebook event page as the main catchall for specific programming throughout the nine day intervention. Raine will also be collaborating with artists locally and remotely to produce a fully interactive installation and performance space that fuses necessary daily function with fully aware self-understanding and productivity through outward expression. 

The cultivation of this binging/purging experience will occur during the closing event on January 9th, where Raine will emerge from their self-built womb after three hours of rumination and subconscious self-actualization followed by the final un/learning task, the cutting of all ties to the created work. 

For a full schedule of all the Official Tasks and UN/LEARNINGs, visit: RAINEBLUNK.COM/UN-LEARNING.

What Raine Needs

Raine will be splitting the funding three ways: 

FOOD - Raine will need nine days of food + food for two UN/LEARNINGs (CASH ONLY + ORDERING CHINESE TAKEOUT)

SUPPLIES - Raine needs to purchase/find/rent some physical supplies. (For a full list, see "Other Ways You Can Help")

TRAVEL - Raine is planning to take UN/LEARNING on the road after the installation closes. They will spend money on traveling to Atlanta, Baltimore/DC, New York, and Boston at the end of January - early February.

The Impact

Raine will leave the UN/LEARNING as a fully-realized version of themselves with nine days of self-recorded and documented work as evidence.

Collaborators and contributors will become an integral part of Raine's UN/LEARNING process. Both will receive artifacts from the UN/LEARNINGs. 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the UN/LEARNING tasks might change according to the nature of the exhibition. All tasks will result in physical artifacts for sale, display and burning at the final UN/LEARNING on January 9th.

Other Ways You Can Help

Raine wants to collaborate on this project with you. For more details, visit RAINEBLUNK.COM/UN-LEARNING. Raine also wants you to spread the word. Add her on Facebook get daily updates and shareables.

Raine is still looking for physical items. Here is a list: 

-DUCT TAPE (WHITE, RED, AND BLACK)
-GARBAGE BAGS (20 GALLON WHITE AND BLACK)
-ACRYLIC PAINT
-CANNED FOOD
-HOT GLUE (STANDARD STICKS)
-FABRIC YARDAGE
-ROPE
-STRING
-TACKS
-NAILS
-SHOWER CURTAINS
-HP 7520 PRINTER INK (BLACK) 
-OLD CANVASES
-OLD CLOTHES
-WOOD

story:
Short Summary

The event will be an end of year degree show that will showcase the work from Bath Spa University students (located at the Weston College University Campus, in Weston-super-Mare). The students from the BA (Hons) Contemporary Arts and Professional Studies course (who specialise in Photography and Moving Image) and the FdA in Photography in Practice. 

The students from the BA (Hons) in Contemporary Arts and Professional Studies course have been working on individual projects since September so will have a quality collection of work to show, all of which are different from one to the next, including projects about gender, sport, and surveillance, to name a few. The students from the FdA in Photography in Practice have been working a variety of projects throughout the year, trying to find themselves as photographers. The work that will be on display will be diverse and range over multiple media disciplines. The work is currently in progress but from previous years shows we have had work displayed from video installations, soundscapes and photographs.

We are making this campaign because we'd like to raise money to increase the quality of the show, and give more opportunity to be able to give prints and perks for guests.


What We Need & What You Get

All of the money funded will go towards to make the show as high quality as possible. We need £1000 to help fund our show and make everything below possible.

  • Hiring of the gallery
  • High quality prints
  • Fixtures, and framing
  • Transportation of work
  • Marketing campaigns
  • Publishing a programme
We have a variety of unique perks available, from simple badges, stickers and compliment slips with our logo design, to unique images from the show on A3 paper, programme for the show, and a t-shirt!
For more information about our perks, please check out the perks section.

The Impact

Our project is about giving students a chance to operate our own independent art exhibition outside of the university curriculum. It allows us to start a transition from thinking inside of a very handheld environment and moving into working for ourselves in the real art world.

This will be an incredible experience for us and enables us to get a chance to host this show for hundreds of visitors and even present opportunities with jobs for the future after this show.


Risks & Challenges

There is very little risk with this exhibition. All the money raised will simply go towards making the show better, by using higher quality paper and fixtures, and have a larger budget for marketing, by printing more flyers and even advertising on Facebook.

If the money isn't raised, the show will still go ahead, just with less attention and potential than what it really could be.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you simply can't help out by donating, but you can still help by sharing this on your Facebook and Twitter pages, get this the attention it needs.

story:
Short Summary

Anklebiters Publishing is a small collection of writers and artists in Houston. It started in 2013 with an idea Chris Wesley had for an anonymous poetry zine. His friend, Kalen Rowe, immediately jumped on board. Plans were made, rumors were spread, invitations were sent, so the first Anklebiters meeting consisted of friends who specialized in poetry, fiction, essays, photography, visual art, and mixed media. Primitive Magazine started in 2014 as a podium for all these artists to display their work to the world. A collection of poetry, prose, visual art, and photography, it is based loosely on the primitive part of the mind, which we find to be absurd, hyperactive, constantly churning out a multiplicity of patterns that remarkably brings forth something new. Through solicitations and open submissions, we have our first issue ready to be printed and bound. We hope that by printing this first issue and distributing it, we will not only make Primitive an actual thing, but spread the word that artists and writers of all kinds have a new magazine to read and write for, providing a new hub, not only for Houston but everywhere, and for work of all kinds. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help in buying a printer that can handle both high quality color images and high volume text. Additionally and secondarily your contribution will go towards ink and paper for the first issue and following issues of Primitive Magazine. The printer we are looking at is a Dell Color Laser Printer C3760DN, which is roughly $500. Replacement toner cartridges will run us around $140 each. The magazine is roughly 70 pages in length and we want to print at least 100 copies as the first editions. Anyone who donates over $5 will receive one of these first editions, as you will approximately be covering the cost to make it. If you donate more and would like more issues, we will make that possible, whether it be more copies of issue one, or copies of future issues, just let us know.

The Impact

We have no aim to make any sort of profit from this magazine or from any of our publications at any time. We are doing this 100% for you. For example, we have already printed around 500 copies of the first two issues of Poets Anonymous, our anonymous poetry zine, and gave them away for free, as they cost very little to make. Recently, we hosted a fundraiser reading at The Jenner House in Houston called Shitfaced Poetry Night, which was filmed. Six of us started drinking and writing around 2pm and didn't stop until the reading at 9pm. We provided free beer and cake and asked for donations in return. In the end we lost money but had a great time. We accepted the loss and moved on, knowing that the night would not soon be forgotten by those who saw us perform. With your contribution, you will be funding a project that takes nothing for itself except in experience and understanding, while it creates a home for those who want to be published and those who want to read and see new work. 

Risks & Challenges

As mentioned, we have not been able to garner much funding in the past, but we hope to change that. We had another Indiegogo over a year ago to fund the printing of Poets Anonymous. We did not nearly reach our goal, but were still able to print with what we got by finding cheap methods of printing, and cutting and binding every copy ourselves. Imagine what we could do if we reached our goal. If we don't, we will find a way to get Primitive out there. It is already grown, it just needs to be borne. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Post it in social media, tell your friends, save this link. The more the word spreads, the more potential there is for someone to swoop in and contribute! Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

In Bloom: A Celebration of Teen Spirit and the Arts commemorates Nirvana’s frontman, Kurt Cobain, twenty years on to reduce stigma around youth mental health and promote artistic expression. Our charitable partner, Delisle Youth Services, has been providing front-line services to thousands of underserved teens and their families across the GTA annually. 

The cornerstone of In Bloom is a guest mentorship program comprised of notable Canadian artists--Ingrid Veninger, Charles Officer, Cara Gee, Joseph Shabason, Choir!Choir!Choir!, Amy Siegel, Aurora Stewart de Peña, Sarah Febrraro, Amanda Wyman, and members of Outside the March theatre company. The mentors have been working with teachers and youth at Delisle Youth Services, Etobicoke School of the Arts, and Lawrence Park Collegiate Institute, and through TIFF Special Delivery, to help them develop pieces that explore the theme of “Identities.” Artworks will be exhibited, performed, and screened on March 20 at Daniels Spectrum. 

In Bloom will also host a separate benefit concert called “Come as You Are” on May 6, at The Great Hall, as part of Canadian Music Week. The show will feature Toronto bands, including DIANA, VAG HALEN, Light Fires, and others. All proceeds from the show will go to Delisle.


What We Need & What You Get

While we've been lucky to garner the support of some great sponsors, we still need to raise additional funds to cover the many costs associated with both the Multi-Arts Show and Come As You Are. With your help, we'll be able to throw two high-profile events that will directly benefit Toronto's underserved youth; improve awareness around mental health; promote the importance of the arts in shaping teen experience; and support the immensely talented and generous filmmakers, actors, musicians, playwrights, and visual artists who have been participating as In Bloom mentors.

We've set our goal at $5000, but any money we raise above and beyond what is required to cover our expenses will be donated directly to Delisle to support their counselling services, drop-in arts studio and youth gallery, and LGBTQ program. So we're hoping to exceed our goal here! Every bit helps.

To thank you for your generosity, we've been able to put together some amazing gift packages with the help of some incredible contributors. Ranging from t-shirts to custom tote bags, Top Shop swag to original artworks, Geometry handbags to Rossmore jewelry, Lucian Matis homeware to the Everlane Petra bag (currently Angelina Jolie's handbag of choice!) and more, our perks were designed to entice donations at all levels, and to reflect how grateful we are for your support.  

The Impact

We selected Delisle Youth Services as our beneficiary because of their wide-ranging support for Toronto youth, emphasis on the arts, and longstanding LGBTQ support. Their services include: counselling, in-school and day-treatment programs, a group home, an LGBTQ youth program and support group for parents, a drop-in arts studio and youth art gallery, and residential case management for teens with complex special needs. With your help, In Bloom can provide Delisle with resources that will allow them to continue to make significant and measurable differences in the lives of Toronto teens.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! We know not everyone can contribute to this initiative with money. Sharing this link and the link to our website (www.inbloomtoronto.com) will help us tremendously. Together, we can pull off a high-level arts show and a successful benefit concert, and contribute to an invaluable resource for Toronto youth.

story:
Thank you for visiting my campaign! 

My name is Ariana Bird and I am a dancer, choreographer, founding member and House Developer at the Pendleton House. In May, I will receive my my BFA from Cornish College of the Arts. As a senior in the dance department we are asked to create a final thesis project that is usually shown on a stage setting mid-Feburary. During the six month process of working on my BFA I have learned that I desire much more than what the stage can offer me. I am hungry for collaborative work that lives in unconventional spaces and is overwhelmingly experiential for the audience. With the help of my collaborators; visual artist, Chelsea Rodino and composer, Cameron Armstrong, I have created an evening length site specific work that will premiere April 5th, 2014. 

Effigies Of My Own Mortality will be shown in a warehouse space downtown Seattle, utilizing the ground floor and underground basement. You will be traveling through different rooms and seeping through the most inner parts of our dreams and reality. For the night lets be in our twenty somethings, fantasize our weirdest desires, celebrate sex and sexiness, live in nostalgia, collide with materiality, sickening sweetness, sadness, excess, heartbreak, spectacle, glitter, color, sweaty bodies, grimy couches, addiction, and that boy or girl from high school you never wanted to remember. 

In its entirety Effigies Of My Own Mortality will be twelve choreographed pieces and six large scale installations. Chelsea, Cameron, and I have create a monstrous project, but we are eager to begin building! This is where you come in...

Satiate our Desires: 

We will be working mostly with found objects to lower cost and be environmentally friendly, but to truly transform the space there is a cost. Your contributions will be going to:


$300 Installations

$100 Costumes

$200 Lighting

$100 Makeup design

$100 Advertising 


The next two months will be dedicated to actualizing these ideas into physical form. I am incredibly lucky to have a group of dedicated and talented dancers who have been in process with me creating individual solos that are inspired by personal writings, improvisation, and movement development. 

The lovely:

Karina Campbell

Matt Drews 

Mariah Martens

Sean Rosado

Micaela Taylor

Appearances by:

Alexandra Maricich

Babette McGeady

Jachen Mackner

Coulliete

Pre-show solo work choreographed by:

Alia Swersky in collaboration with Ariana Bird

Performed by Ariana Bird

Live DJ:

Cry Club

Since admission to the show is free we will not be making any profit. If we do not reach our goal this work cannot happen! Please help in any way that you can. Share this link on Facebook, tell your people, and come to the show! 

If you would like to learn more here is our process/inspiration blog:

http://birdbfa.tumblr.com

During the six month process of working on my BFA I have learned that I desire much more than what the stage can offer me. I am hungry for collaborative work that lives in unconventional spaces and is overwhelmingly experiential for the audience. With the help of my collaborators; visual artist, Chelsea Rodino and composer, Cameron Armstrong, I have created an evening length site specific work that will premiere April 5th, 2014. Effigies Of My Own Mortality will be shown in a warehouse space downtown Seattle, utilizing the ground floor and underground basement. You will be traveling through different rooms and seeping through the most inner parts of our dreams and reality. For the night lets be in our twenty somethings, fantasize our weirdest desires, celebrate sex and sexiness, live in nostalgia, collide with materiality, sickening sweetness, sadness, excess, heartbreak, spectacle, glitter, color, sweaty bodies, grimy couches, addiction, and that boy or girl from high school you never wanted to remember. In its entirety Effigies Of My Own Mortality will be twelve choreographed pieces and six large scale installations. Chelsea, Cameron, and I have create a monstrous project, but we are eager to begin building! This is where you come in...Satiate our Desires: We will be working mostly with found objects to lower cost and be environmentally friendly, but to truly transform the space there is a cost. Your contributions will be going to:$300 Installations$100 Costumes$200 Lighting$100 Makeup design$100 Advertising The next two months will be dedicated to actualizing these ideas into physical form. I am incredibly lucky to have a group of dedicated and talented dancers who have been in process with me creating individual solos that are inspired by personal writings, improvisation, and movement development. The lovely:Karina CampbellMatt Drews Mariah MartensSean RosadoMicaela TaylorAppearances by:Alexandra MaricichBabette McGeadyJachen MacknerCoullietePre-show solo work choreographed by:Alia Swersky in collaboration with Ariana BirdPerformed by Ariana BirdLive DJ:Cry ClubSince admission to the show is free we will not be making any profit. If we do not reach our goal this work cannot happen! Please help in any way that you can. Share this link on Facebook, tell your people, and come to the show! If you would like to learn more here is our process/inspiration blog:http://birdbfa.tumblr.com

story:
This is digital Art Book project by artists Mick39 and Kiki-Uma of FurAffinity.
In addition to 10 colour drawings, the book will contain detailed writing about the aliens of Vilous.
Sergal, Nevrean, Agudner and Talyxian are all interesting alien species we have created and the art will depict them in their daily life.
Two pieces have been finished already, the other 8 pics are half colored.
We would like to do more art projects like this in the future, but first we hope to have a successful Indiegogo campaign and finish this book!
This is the first fundraiser we have done, and it is a very important project to both of us. Not to mention how important it is to the information of our project's planet- Vilous!


Risks and challenges:

We return your money with paypal we have not completed the art by our target delivery date (July).
There may be delays or refunds given in the event of an emergency (if one of the artists is hospitalised, in a car crash, goes crazy or dies...but we really hope this does not happen!)

...........................................................

$10 fund:
you can get the digital art book.

$70 fund:
you can get the digital art book and Mick39 random traditional pen-drawing with autograph on B5paper. (not lineart of this artpack)please enter your shipping address.

story:
Hello people!

My name is Holly Murphy and I am one of the very few potters left in what was once the pottery capital of the world, Zanesville Ohio. Our community was once a rich, vibrant, thriving area surrounded by family potteries. Unfortunately, thanks to politics, most of them had been sold out and the labor was moved to China.

About three years ago, I fell in love with clay and have been obsessed with it ever since. I was lucky enough to find an amazing teacher and friend who has taught me everything she knows. (she had lost her family pottery years ago)

Im 41 years old and recently divorced. I have two amazing little girls, Sedona, age 5 and Hadley, age 4. I am so happy that ive finally found something that im really good at, and Im proud to call myself an artist. Both of my daughters have shown a big interest in what mommy does and they work by my side quite often. I have always been heavily involved in the tattoo subculture. Sporting two full sleeves, I at one time researched tattoo styled kitchen ware and home decor online and sadly, found nothing. Merging two of my favorite things, Id like to be able to offer tattoo styled pottery, home decor, and kitchen ware to the public to decorate their homes. Finding a lack of such items leaves me with no competition and the ability to fufill a great need. The line will be labeled "Inked Earth." (thanks Joleen, for the name!)

Ive been supporting my little family of 3 with my pottery and I would very much like to continue doing that. If youd like to see what Ive been up to... www.lotsapotsa.com

Pottery is an expensive job. Supplies and equipment cost an arm and a leg these days. When I first started, I got lucky and a neighbor was selling a used kiln. It is small and very old but works! The elements and switches are starting to go out and isnt heating correctly. Also, due to its size, I am quite limited on the size of my pieces. Since it isnt working very well these days, i find myself throwing away alot of my work. Its a huge drain on resources and not to mention FRUSTRATING!

This funding would provide me with a larger, more efficient kiln. This would allow me to be more productive with my time and materials, and it would also be easier on my electric bill!

Another thing a new kiln would allow me to do is teach. There are many people in the area, including children who need a place to learn about pottery and cultivate their skills. This is exactly what our area needs so we can try to bring back at least a little bit of the areas lost pottery heritage. If the funding goes over my asking amount, Id like to buy a test kiln to properly test glazing techniques, and possibly an extruder.

thank you!!

Holly Murphy

story:
Short Summary

Hello!,

My name is Zoe McDonald and I am the owner of Zoe Marie Designs, a company that specializes in Artistic/Wearable Jewelry, Clothing Design and Interior Design.  I have a B.S. in Fashion Design from Howard University and studied Interior Design for 3 yrs and Marymount University.  My business is my passion and my love for it feeds my soul which is evident in the work I produce!

On June 17th I was blessed with the opportunity to share Vending space at the Essence Music Festival on the weekend of July 4th, 2014.  I have solely run my business full time for the past 4 months and have been able to do so with the support of family and friends.  One of my methods of generating income is though vending at festivals, art shows, displaying my work in galleries and sponsored home shows.

With Part 1, (June 18th & 19th) I was able to raise $255 of my goal of $550 in contributions to cover the cost of the vending space and paid $300 of that to my Supporter/Chief renter who is graciously allowing me to pay the balance when I get to New Orleans!

My long term goal with my business is to open a Studio where I can produce and sell my work and also help up and coming artists like myself get started with their own dreams. You can view my work via Facebook @ Zoe Marie Designs or my web site:  http://zoeonline.wix.com/zoee 

The Perks of this fundraiser will be that I will match contributions equally with a gift-certificate to shop at Zoe Marie Designs that can be used toward any of my products and/or services + gift(s). 

This is Part 2 of a 2 Part fundraiser. The total amount needed for me to travel and lodge to New Orleans is $2750.  I will set up the second part of the fundraiser on Friday, June 20th.  Part 1 fundraiser raised $255.  Part 2 of the fundraiser, the remaining  $2500 will cover airfare, hotel and transportation for 4 days.  

The Essence Music Festival is one that is visited by hundreds of thousands of people for 3 days out of the year.  This will be my biggest opportunity yet to gain exposure and prayerfully expand my clientele' and share my love and spirit through my work.

If I do not reach my goal, the funds earned from your wonderful and heartfelt donations will still go directly toward my trip costs as I have fully committed to be at the Festival!

I would like to thank you for your consideration and help and please share the news with your associates and friends.  You can use the Indegogo tools or other forms of social media. The more people that see this fundraiser, the better my chances in reaching this goal!

Wishing you much success in your own endeavors and many blessings!

Thank you!,

Zoe McDonald

story:
SCORRI IN BASSO 

PER LA VERSIONE IN ITALIANO!


WHITE PORCELAIN - Bianco Porcellana


Hello everybody!

I’m Francesca. My passion has always been earth: listen to it, cultivate it, protect it, respect it…and shaping it has become my job. In 2004 in fact, I obtained my diploma as ceramist with specialization in potter’s wheel in Tuscany, near Florence, and ever since I am LaVasaia.

My home and laboratory are in Pralungo, in the north-west of Italy. Not far from there, within the Ricetto di Candelo, a medieval jewel of the XIII century, you can find “La Cantina del Panpepato”, where I display my pieces of pottery. Give a look at my site to have an idea about what I do ( www.lavasaia.com ). I live at the foot of wonderful mountains, which continuously inspire me through their shapes and colors. Pottery is a menial art and I feel like honouring it, especially when I create simple objects, for a daily purpose, even trying to increase their value using the contrast between the bright glaze and the opaque clay.

Earth has a lot to teach us, but we have to learn to listen to it. I work, make attempts, test, play and dare…I use types of clay such as majolica or soft crockery firing at low temperatures, around 1830°F, because my kiln cannot reach higher temperatures. However, I feel in a more compelling way the necessity to widen my technical possibilities, to give vent to the ideas that have far-back been coming up to my mind, without any limitation in materials. It is very important to me now getting to work with porcelain, both for my creative and professional life. That’s why I need an high temperature kiln.

Here comes to life my crowdfunding project "Bianco Porcellana": a new earth to keep on cultivating my timeless passion! Among the first creations my hands are looking forward to creating, is coupling porcelain pure white with other natural elements: the metal that will embrace mugs and small cups, or the wood that will become cap or lid for new jars or, also, the wool that will inspire me for new textures on surfaces. There are many new objects I would like to pop out! I just need your help to begin!

The first indispensable step to take to lead this new adventure off is, of course, the purchase of an high temperature kiln, able to reach about 2370°F. Many are the models for choosing among, but my eyes have laid on a type finished in Germany: 200 liters, 11 KW, resistors on three sides; so, a 660 pounds robust fellow!

Perfect to begin, but very expensive: 6000€. The price includes a computer for firing programmes and a kit of fire-resistant plates.

If you help me to buy it, I promise it will work hard!

Give a look at the rewards I prepared for you: if you like them but, most of all, if you want to share the emotion of clay transformation, make a donation and you will have a happy potter! 

Thank you for your supporting  this campaing. I will appreciate  if you will share with your friends!

PASS THE WORD !!!

https://www.facebook.com/lavasaia?ref=hl


Perks:

Important! I need you to contact me via e-mail at lavasaia@gmail.com to have your addresses and send you your prize.

5 euro  Thanks!

I’ll send you a personal thank you e-mail and, attached, a picture of the video protagonist dedicated to you in person! Moreover, at the end of the campaign, a further thank you on facebook “lavasaia", as official supporter of “Bianco Porcellana”.

10 euro  Thanks!

I’ll send you a personal thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana”. Moreover, I’ll send you a stamped postcard in limited edition with an image inspired to the project.

25 euro  Thanks!

I’ll send you a personal thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana”. Moreover, I’ll send you a decorative ceramic tile customized with your name I’ll create exclusively for this campaign. Here you are an examples:

                                       

50 euro  Thanks a lot!

I’ll send you a personal thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana” and an image gallery in “Clay Motion” set from the promotional video. Moreover, I’ll send you two decorative ceramic tiles customized with your name I’ll create exclusively for this campaign.

100 euro  Thanks a lot!

I’ll send you a personal thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana” and an image gallery in “Clay Motion” set from the promotional video. Moreover, I’ll send you one decorative ceramic tile customized with your name I’ll create exclusively for this campaign and a kitchen jar of “Legumi” series:

http://lavasaia.com/per-conservare/barattoli-serie-legumi/

250 euro  Heartfelt thanks!

I’ll send you a special thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana” and an image gallery in ”Clay Motion” set from the promotional video. Moreover, I’ll send you three kitchen jars of “Legumi” series and three decorative ceramic tiles customized with your name I’ll create exclusively for this campaign.

http://lavasaia.com/per-conservare/barattoli-serie-legumi/

500 euro  Thank you very much!

You are a very generous supporter!

I’ll send you a really special thank you e-mail and, attached, a video tutorial I created to learn modeling a clay whistle shaped as the bird protagonist of the campaign “Bianco Porcellana” and an image gallery in ”Clay Motion” set from the promotional video. Moreover, I’ll send you three decorative ceramic tiles customized with your name I’ll create exclusively for this campaign and a whole tea set: a teapot with six cups and a sugar bowl chosen among those visible on the site www.lavasaia.com

(Or, for the most creative ones: design the teapot of your dreams and will be my pleasure to create it especially for you!)



FIRST RESULTS! 

A huge thank you to those who have won the shyness and opened the dance: the first four supporters of "Bianco Porcellana" . 

Find time to talk to friends, it is important to LaVasaia, for all craftsmen, for all growers of passions, for the preservation of beauty. 

Thanks for your support!


BIANCO PORCELLANA 

White Porcelain


Cos'è il Crowdfunding?

Il Crowdfunding (crowd = folla e funding = finanziamento, in pratica un finanziamento dal basso) è un processo per cui chiunque può contribuire a finanziare, anche con piccole somme, un’idea o un progetto tramite una piattaforma internet e si basa su 4 grandi caratteristiche: Collaborazione: un gruppo di persone può aiutare concretamente un progetto. Qualità: questo gruppo di persone sceglie il progetto che ritiene migliore rispetto ad altri. Fiducia: lo stesso gruppo di persone punta sulle capacità e sulla correttezza del detentore del progetto. Responsabilità: da una parte ci si prende carico di un’idea e dall’altra si lavora per renderla fruibile a tutti. E’ un patto virtuoso.

Queste caratteristiche fondamentali dovrebbero essere la base per tornare a creare un senso di comunità, un senso creativo autentico svincolato dalle solite leggi commerciali che aiutano solo ciò che è già avviato e un senso di cooperazione per rendere reale una bella idea. 

Infatti non sono mai le idee a mancare ma i soldi per realizzarle! E questa non deve essere la condizione principale per abbandonare i propri sogni. 

Poter scegliere che progetto far crescere, poter seguire un artigiano nella creazione, poter aspettare i frutti del lavoro in cui si crede, essere mecenati di qualcuno: ecco il senso per chi aiuta a finanziare, anche con poco, il sogno. L’unione fa la forza.

Quindi siate curiosi! Volete aiutarmi in questa avventura?


IL PROGETTO

Ciao a tutti! Sono Francesca.

La mia passione da sempre è la terra: ascoltarla, coltivarla, proteggerla, rispettarla… e modellarla è diventato il mio lavoro. Nel 2004 infatti ho conseguito il diploma da ceramista con specializzazione tornio in Toscana a Montelupo Fiorentino, vicino a Firenze, e da allora sono LaVasaia.

Casa e laboratorio si trovano a Pralungo, in Piemonte. Poco lontano, all’interno del Ricetto di Candelo, un gioiello medioevale del XIII secolo, potete trovare “la Cantina del Panpepato”, dove espongo le mie ceramiche. Vivo alle pendici di splendide montagne che mi regalano in continuazione forme e colori a cui ispirarmi. Trovo che la ceramica sia principalmente un’arte umile, che cerco di omaggiare realizzando soprattutto oggetti d’uso quotidiano uniti ad uno studio formale e cromatico sempre nuovo sfruttando il contrasto tra il lucido dello smalto e l’opaco della terra. Date un’occhiata al mio sito per farvi un’idea di come lavoro www.lavasaia.com

La terra ha molto da insegnare, ma bisogna imparare ad ascoltarla. Lavoro, sperimento, gioco, oso… ho sempre utilizzato argille come la maiolica o la terraglia tenera che cuociono a bassa (si fa per dire) temperatura, intorno ai 1000°C. Ora sento però, in maniera sempre più pressante, la necessità di ampliare le mie capacità tecniche, di dare libero sfogo alle idee che mi danno la caccia da tempo senza limitazioni di materiali. Arrivare a lavorare la porcellana è per me adesso molto importante, sia per la mia vita creativa che professionale, e per questo mi serve un forno ad alta temperatura.

Da qui l’idea di iniziare questo progetto di Crowdfunding: “Bianco Porcellana - White Porcelain”: una terra nuova per coltivare la passione di sempre! Sono moltissime le idee che le mie mani non vedono l’ora di realizzare abbinando il bianco puro della porcellana ad altri elementi naturali: il metallo che andrà ad abbracciare tazze e tazzine, il legno che diverrà tappo o coperchio per nuovi barattoli o la lana che servirà da ispirazione per nuove texture sulle superfici. Tanti sono gli oggetti che vorrei sfornare! Mi serve solo il vostro aiuto per cominciare!

Il primo passo obbligatorio per dare il via a questa avventura è, naturalmente, l’acquisto di un forno ad alta temperatura che possa cioè raggiungere circa i 1300°C. Tra i modelli su cui il mio sguardo si è posato ce n'è uno di ottima fattura tedesca: 200 litri, 11Kw e resistenze sui tre lati… insomma un bel ragazzotto da 300 Kg!!!

Perfetto, ma molto costoso: 6000 euro. Nel prezzo sono inclusi una centralina elettronica per programmare le temperature e un kit di piastre in refrattario.

Prometto che se mi aiuterete a comprarlo lo farò lavorare sodo!!!

Date uno sguardo alle ricompense che ho preparato per voi; se vi piacciono, ma soprattutto se volete condividere con me l’emozione dei sogni che si trasformano in terra, fate una donazione e contribuirete ad avere una ceramista felice! Grazie!!!

Grazie per il supporto alla mia campagna! Vi sarò grata se vorrete condividerla con i vostri amici su facebook o dove vorrete!

PASSAPAROLA!

https://www.facebook.com/lavasaia?ref=hl


Ricompense:

Importante! Avrò bisogno di essere contattata da te alla mail lavasaia@gmail.com per avere i tuoi recapiti e poterti inviare il tuo premio.


5euro   Grazie!

Ti invierò una mail personale di ringraziamento con allegata una foto del protagonista del video dedicata proprio a te! Inoltre, alla fine della campagna, un ulteriore ringraziamento sul canale fb  “ lavasaia “ come sostenitore ufficiale di “Bianco Porcellana”.

10 euro  Grazie!

Ti invierò una mail personale di ringraziamento con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana”. Inoltre ti invierò una cartolina postale affrancata e in tiratura limitata con un’immagine ispirata al progetto.

25 euro  Grazie!

Ti invierò una mail personale di ringraziamento con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana". Inoltre ti invierò una piastrella decorativa in ceramica realizzata da me esclusivamente per questa campagna e personalizzata con il tuo nome. Ecco un esempio:

                                       

50 euro  Grazie mille!

Ti invierò una mail personale di ringraziamento con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana" e una galleria di  immagini dal set in “Clay Motion” del video promozionale. Inoltre ti invierò 2 piastrelle decorative in ceramica realizzate da me esclusivamente per questa campagna e personalizzate con il tuo nome.  

100 euro  Grazie mille!

Ti invierò una mail personale di ringraziamento con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana” e una galleria di  immagini dal set in “Clay Motion” del video promozionale. Inoltre ti invierò una piastrella decorativa in ceramica realizzata da me esclusivamente per questa campagna personalizzata con il tuo nome e un barattolo da cucina della serie “Legumi”:

http://lavasaia.com/per-conservare/barattoli-serie-legumi/

250 euro  Grazie di cuore!

Ti invierò una speciale mail di ringraziamento con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana” e una galleria di  immagini dal set in “Clay Motion” del video promozionale. Inoltre ti invierò 3 barattoli da cucina della serie “Legumi” e 3 piastrelle decorative in ceramica realizzate da me esclusivamente per questa campagna e personalizzate con il tuo nome.

http://lavasaia.com/per-conservare/barattoli-serie-legumi/

500 euro  Grazie infinite!

Sei un sostenitore molto generoso!

Ti invierò una mail di ringraziamento veramente speciale con allegato un tutorial video realizzato da me per imparare a modellare un fischietto in argilla a forma del pennuto protagonista della campagna “Bianco Porcellana” e una galleria di  immagini dal set in “Clay Motion” del video promozionale. Inoltre ti invierò 3 piastrelle decorative in ceramica realizzate da me esclusivamente per questa campagna e personalizzate con il tuo nome e un set da tè completo: una teiera con 6 tazze e una zuccheriera a scelte tra quelle visibili sul sito www.lavasaia.com

(Oppure, per i più creativi: disegna la teiera dei tuoi sogni e  sarà un piacere per me realizzarla appositamente per te!)



PRIMI RISULTATI!

Un enorme grazie a chi ha vinto la timidezza e ha aperto le danze!

Aumentano i donatori tra cui molti generosi anonimi. Posso invece già ringraziare Fioly Bocca, Emanuela Scotti, Umberto Vecchi, Luca Terribile, Nicola Berardi, Edoardo Ghirardelli, Gabriele Artuso e Luisa Albera per aver creduto in "Bianco Porcellana" e nei sogni di LaVasaia.

GRAZIE!

Trovate il tempo di parlarne agli amici, è importante per LaVasaia, per tutti gli artigiani, per tutti i coltivatori di passioni, per la conservazione del bello.

Seguite la pagina fb LaVasaia per maggiori contenuti!


SPINGITORI 


Un enorme GRAZIE anche alle attività commerciali che hanno fatto richiesta del KIT degli SPINGITORI di Bianco Porcellana! Per maggiori informazioni www.lavasaia.com

 Aiutando in maniera attiva la promozione della campagna si meritano una menzione d'onore! Eccoli:

-Thierry, bagni stazione Porta Genova, Metro di Milano

www.lightandsound.it

-SERENO GIOCATTOLI, in via 1 Maggio a Biella. Tutti i giochi che potete desiderare.

https://www.facebook.com/SerenoGiocattoli

-PESCHERIA DUOMO, in via Duomo 10 A Biella. Alimentari e drogheria.Pesce fresco con arrivi giornalieri

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Pescheria-Duomo-Srl/154581061276613

-GIGOLE' Fashion and More, via D'Antona 1, Chiaravalle, ANCONA. Negozio d'abbigliamento e museum-store. Specializzato in jeanseria, arredamento e diavolerie varie.

www.gigole.it

https://www.facebook.com/gigole.it

-MERCATO DELL'USATO DI ROPPOLO, Via Viverone 10, RoppolO, BIella. Compravendita di beni al dettaglio.

https://www.facebook.com/mercatousatoroppolo?fref=ts

-BOCCIODROMO DELLA SERRA, Via per Sala 2, 13884 Torrazzo Biella. Campi da bocce, da tennis, da pallavolo, da calcetto e tanto altro. Un'oasi di relax immersa nel verde dei boschi della Serra.

www.bocciodromodellaserra.it

https://www.facebook.com/BocciodromodellaSerra?fref=ts

-VINI E AFFINI ,Via C. Vercellone 57 a Cavaglià, Biella.  Enoteca e vineria

https://www.facebook.com/pages/VINI-e-affini-La-Vineria/220347787997525

-IL RIFUGIO DEGLI ASINELLI ONLUS, via per Zubiena 62 a Sala Biellese, Biella. Spingitori d’eccezione, il loro lavoro consiste nel:

  • provvedere alla cura, alla protezione e alla sicurezza permanente di asini e muli in difficoltà per malattia, maltrattamento, povere condizioni di vita o qualsiasi altra circostanza in cui essi stiano soffrendo crudeltà;
  • proteggere gli asini e promuovere il loro benessere in Italia;
  • dare agli asini perfettamente recuperati dal punto di vista psico-fisico la possibilità di essere ricollocati in famiglie, attraverso il programma di affidamento;
  • preparare gli asini più predisposti al contatto con gli umani alla onoterapia per bambini con bisogni speciali.

http://www.ilrifugiodegliasinelli.org

-VIVERE E VIAGGIARE  agenzia viaggi. In via Torino 43 a Biella

-PASTICCERIA, PANETTERIA, CAFFETTERIA PAPARINI in Piazza Conti Rebaudengo, 8 a Torino
